story:
Update: 50% of profits moving forward will go to Act To Change

Please see the updates page for how the decision was made :)

 

Story of My Book

Not THAT Rich is a fictional drama-filled novel about a group of diverse teenagers struggling to find their identity in a highly pressurized affluent community.

My name is Belinda Lei and I am the author of Not THAT Rich. I wrote this book because, like many teenagers out there, high school was an immensely transformative experience for me, filled with all the angst, laughter, tears, and drama that makes your teenage years so formative. Through this book, I want to not only give readers an escape into a satirical and predominantly affluent Asian American community, but also lend my voice to young readers out there who might feel lost or invisible because of their racial, sexual, socioeconomic, or generational identity.

Siblings Hunter and Trisha Wang are smart, multi-talented, overachievers that have grown up embracing the dream of many families in the San Gabriel Valley - to one day attend one of the nation's top universities. They're also students at Winchester, one of the premier private high schools in the valley with a track record of sending all its primarily privileged and wealthy students into top tier colleges. As a senior, Hunter is laser-focused on submitting his Stanford college application, but an investigation into stolen AP exams, relationship struggles with the "It" girl, Sierra Jones, and the arrival of the son of a Chinese billionaire, Jack Zhou, and outsider, Ray Martinez, is about to flip the school year upside down for not just Hunter, but all the Winchester students. 

You will enjoy this book if you are a fan of Crazy Rich Asians, Never Have I Ever, or Gossip Girl. Readers who want to escape into a very "extra" version of a wealthy, predominantly Asian American community will also love it.

Not THAT Rich speaks to young adults and Asian Americans who want to grapple with college admissions and the pressures of family and status in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Not THAT Rich takes readers through a dramatic, yet fun, story, but also inspires feelings of reflection, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • What does it mean to be Asian American today?
  • How do you find individuality amongst family and societal pressures?
  • Why is the college admissions process so skewed towards favoriting the wealthy and privileged?

 

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

 

And more...

About the Author

Belinda Lei is a Yale School of Management Silver Scholar, software engineer, and Managing Director of Act To Change, a non-profit that aims to prevent bullying in the Asian American and Pacific Islander (AAPI) community.

As someone who has always been passionate about Asian American identity and education, Belinda set out to initially write a non-fiction book capturing the experiences of Asian American leaders across diverse industries. However, she soon discovered that almost every interview included a common theme of grappling with identity and lack of representation in popular culture during their teenage years. One thing led to another, and Belinda embarked on the path of writing a teenage novel that is set in her hometown area, San Gabriel Valley, an iconic area east of Los Angeles that is home to a large and rapidly growing Asian American population. Her book is part Crazy Rich Asians, part Gossip Girl, and part Never Have I Ever.

Belinda’s hope for Not THAT Rich is to first and foremost be a fun read for her audience as they dive into the a satirized version of the San Gabriel Valley while also hoping to drive conversation on what it means to be Asian American today.

For more information you can connect with Belinda at belinda.lei95@gmail.com and @blei_writes on Instagram. She will happily jump on a call with her camera-bombing cat, Pishi, and her very loud snoring dog, Tyrion.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #NotTHATRich and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Belinda

story:
We hit $6K, now shooting for 150 copies!

Y'all, we reached our $6K goal! Thank you, thank you, thank you to everyone who has contributed. Thanks to your purchase/donation, my book will now be published in both a paperback AND hardcover edition. It's a dream come true, and it's all because of you. 

The next steps: I set a personal goal of selling 150 paperback editions of my book. Right now, we have sold 117 with only 10 days left in the campaign. We are so close — tell your friends and family about the book. Continue sharing #TheBoyWithFire on your socials.

And if you haven't already, join the giveaway! As an early supporter, you will get access to special prizes i.e. a hand-drawn map of Ravence, a personal note written on my vintage typewriter, a signed photography print, etc. All you need to do is share my book link with a friend, and if they purchase the book, both of you will be entered into the giveaway. 

Again, I want to thank all of you for helping me in my journey. Your support makes me work even harder to make The Boy With Fire the best that it can be. I promise you, the day you get to hold it in your hands, the story of Sayon will sweep you away. ✨

Love,

Aparna 

 

Story of My Book

Yassen Knight knows he cannot be forgiven. After years of committing acts of high treason for the Arohassin, a criminal organization, his hands are numb with sin. But when an old, devious friend offers him a chance at redemption, Yassen takes it. He must journey back to the ancient Kingdom of Ravence where he had lost his family, and where the people have forsaken him.

But an old power awakens deep within the deserts of Ravence. A raging, unforgiving power that speaks of prophecy and annihilation. Its very existence threatens to unveil a closely guarded secret of the royal family. And it will stop at nothing to take back what it had claimed long ago.

The first of The Ravence Trilogy, The Boy With Fire is a tale of a world teetering on the edge of war and prophecy, of fate and betrayal, of man’s irrevocable greed for power — and the sacrifices that must come with it.

***


My name is Aparna Verma and I am the author of The Boy With Fire. Some stories arrive with such a force that they are impossible to ignore. They occupy every vestige of your mind, and intrude on your moments of peace. The characters speak to you with such conviction that you cannot bear to put the pen down. The Boy With Fire is that story.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the magic of Sayon. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to relish the power and beauty of magical realism, of unlimited imaginations, of myth and lore, and of the simple love for storytelling.

You will love this book if you’re a fan of sci-fi and fantasy, if you enjoy epic tales of lore, or if you are someone who believes in second chances.

Ultimately, I hope that The Boy with Fire inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  1. What do we sacrifice in order to remain comfortable?
  2. Who do we assign as scapegoats in our society?
  3. Why do we believe in powers older and greater than us?
I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing them will inspire us to look deeper into ourselves, and transport us to the long, desert halls of Ravence. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2020.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Aparna Verma is a lover of myth and lore. An avid storyteller, she graduated from Stanford University with honors in English and an artist’s book about marids and wayward travelers as proof.

She wrote The Boy With Fire during the pandemic of 2020, in a time when people dug deeper into their echo chambers and wells of intolerance. She hopes that this tale of Sayon and Yassen Knight will show people the beauty of second chances.

When she is not writing, Aparna likes to take photos, drink too much Earl Grey, and ride horses — hoping that one day she can become one.

For more information, you can connect with Aparna Verma at @spirited_gal where she turns photography into poetry.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheBoyWithFire and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Aparna Verma

Y'all, we reached our $6K goal! Thank you, thank you, thank you to everyone who has contributed. Thanks to your purchase/donation, my book will now be published in both a paperback AND hardcover edition. It's a dream come true, and it's all because of you. 
The next steps: I set a personal goal of selling 150 paperback editions of my book. Right now, we have sold 117 with only 10 days left in the campaign. We are so close — tell your friends and family about the book. Continue sharing #TheBoyWithFire on your socials.
And if you haven't already, join the giveaway! As an early supporter, you will get access to special prizes i.e. a hand-drawn map of Ravence, a personal note written on my vintage typewriter, a signed photography print, etc. All you need to do is share my book link with a friend, and if they purchase the book, both of you will be entered into the giveaway. 
Again, I want to thank all of you for helping me in my journey. Your support makes me work even harder to make The Boy With Fire the best that it can be. I promise you, the day you get to hold it in your hands, the story of Sayon will sweep you away. ✨
Love,
Aparna 
 
Story of My Book
Yassen Knight knows he cannot be forgiven. After years of committing acts of high treason for the Arohassin, a criminal organization, his hands are numb with sin. But when an old, devious friend offers him a chance at redemption, Yassen takes it. He must journey back to the ancient Kingdom of Ravence where he had lost his family, and where the people have forsaken him.But an old power awakens deep within the deserts of Ravence. A raging, unforgiving power that speaks of prophecy and annihilation. Its very existence threatens to unveil a closely guarded secret of the royal family. And it will stop at nothing to take back what it had claimed long ago.The first of The Ravence Trilogy, The Boy With Fire is a tale of a world teetering on the edge of war and prophecy, of fate and betrayal, of man’s irrevocable greed for power — and the sacrifices that must come with it.
***
My name is Aparna Verma and I am the author of The Boy With Fire. Some stories arrive with such a force that they are impossible to ignore. They occupy every vestige of your mind, and intrude on your moments of peace. The characters speak to you with such conviction that you cannot bear to put the pen down. The Boy With Fire is that story.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the magic of Sayon. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to relish the power and beauty of magical realism, of unlimited imaginations, of myth and lore, and of the simple love for storytelling.You will love this book if you’re a fan of sci-fi and fantasy, if you enjoy epic tales of lore, or if you are someone who believes in second chances.Ultimately, I hope that The Boy with Fire inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

What do we sacrifice in order to remain comfortable?
Who do we assign as scapegoats in our society?
Why do we believe in powers older and greater than us?
I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing them will inspire us to look deeper into ourselves, and transport us to the long, desert halls of Ravence.  What I Need & What You'll Get This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2020.
The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more! About the Author Aparna Verma is a lover of myth and lore. An avid storyteller, she graduated from Stanford University with honors in English and an artist’s book about marids and wayward travelers as proof.She wrote The Boy With Fire during the pandemic of 2020, in a time when people dug deeper into their echo chambers and wells of intolerance. She hopes that this tale of Sayon and Yassen Knight will show people the beauty of second chances.When she is not writing, Aparna likes to take photos, drink too much Earl Grey, and ride horses — hoping that one day she can become one.For more information, you can connect with Aparna Verma at @spirited_gal where she turns photography into poetry. Risks & Challenges The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship. Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheBoyWithFire and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.
Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Aparna Verma

story:
¿Qué es Buensalvaje?

Buensalvaje es una revista de literatura. Nació en el Perú en setiembre del 2012, pero sus ecos llegaron hasta Costa Rica, donde decidimos hacer nuestra propia versión.

¿Cómo nació el proyecto?

Somos un grupo de amigos heridos de muerte por los libros y movidos por el afán de compartir con otras personas nuestras propias obsesiones como lectores.

Después de meses de trabajo, a finales de enero pusimos en la calle mil ejemplares de nuestra primera edición: 32 páginas de la mejor literatura producida en Iberoamérica, con un diseño atractivo y una edición rigurosa. La revista incluye géneros de creación –cuento, poesía, ensayo–, así como otros de corte periodístico –entrevistas, artículos de opinión y reseñas–. Podés ver el PDF de nuestra primera edición en este enlace: http://buensalvaje.com/buensalvaje-costa-rica/

Pese a no contar con apoyo económico de terceros, quisimos que la revista fuese gratuita y así pudiese ser disfrutada por cualquier persona. Hicimos una apuesta y el resultado excedió todas nuestras expectativas. Llegamos a tantos lectores como fue posible, y entre ellos y nosotros solo medió un gesto de complicidad. Una conexión invisible pero poderosa que deseamos continúe por mucho tiempo.

¿Por qué necesitamos el dinero?

La producción de nuestro segundo número está en marcha, y queremos verlo impreso a comienzos de abril. Nos enfrentamos a un gran obstáculo: los ahorros se agotan. Mientras seguimos afinando el plan que hará sostenible el proyecto a futuro (publicidad y suscripciones), necesitamos el dinero para costear este segundo número.

Los $4000 dólares que nos hemos puesto como meta nos permitirán cubrir todos los costos asociados:

  • Impresión
  • Diseño
  • Distribución
  • Gastos de Indiegogo y recompensas

Si en esta ocasión no podés contribuir con dinero, echanos una mano compartiendo esta página e invitando a tus amigos y conocidos a unirse a la campaña. ¡Ayudanos a aumentar esta creciente legión de cómplices salvajes!

Sobre el equipo

Alberto Calvo (San José, 1988), editor. Tras abandonar una gris carrera de ingeniería, se embarcó en el periodismo. Fue redactor y editor encubierto en la revista digital 89decibeles.com. Entre 2010 y 2013, fue redactor de planta y posteriormente editor de textos en la desaparecida revista SoHo. En la actualidad, está vinculado a la Unidad de Revistas de Grupo Nación como editor freelance, al tiempo que dirige Buensalvaje desde la comodidad de su habitación. Dos veces por semana sale de su encierro para atender una librería en el centro de San José.

Diego Jiménez F. (San José, 1989), coeditor. Periodista, estudiante de Filología Española y músico frustrado. Fue redactor por un año en el suplemento cultural Áncora del diario La Nación, donde luego ocupó una plaza en la sección "El mundo" entre enero del 2013 y febrero del 2014. Actualmente, se mantiene como colaborador del diario y también edita la serie Leer para Disfrutar, que publica obras de literatura a bajo costo.

__________________________________________

What's Buensalvaje?

Buensalvaje is a literary magazine born in Peru in September, 2012. When it found its way to Costa Rica, we decided to publish our own version.

How did this project begin?

We're a group of friends from Costa Rica, passionate about books and driven by the desire to share this obsession with other readers.

After months of hard work, in late January we released 1.000 copies of our very first edition: a 32-page carefully-curated selection of the best literature in Ibero-America, with an attractive design and rigorous editing. The magazine features creative genres (short story, poetry, essay), and others closer to journalism (interviews, op-eds and book reviews). You can check out the PDF of the first edition here: http://buensalvaje.com/buensalvaje-costa-rica/

Despite not having financial support, we decided not to charge for the magazine so that anyone could enjoy it. Yes, it is free. It was a gamble for us and the result exceeded all of our expectations. We reached as many readers as possible with a simple gesture of complicity. An invisible but powerful connection which we intend to make last.

Why do we need the money?

The production for our second edition is in progress and we want to print it in early April. However, we are facing a huge obstacle: our savings are drained. As we continue to fine-tune the financial plan that would make the project sustainable (advertising and subscriptions), we still need the money to afford this second edition.

Our goal is to raise $4000 to cover our expenses:

  • Printing
  • Design
  • Distribution
  • Indiedogo’s fees and perks

If you can't contribute financially, help us spread the word. Share this page and invite your friends to join the campaign. Help us enlarge this growing legion of “salvajes”!

story:
Short Summary

    Hello there everyone, my name is Mackey Howe and I'm a senior at Newton North High School in Newton, MA.  This campaign is all about a book I made for my senior year project (CAPStone project) at NNHS and the impact it's had on my community.  It is a book of poetry and artwork that I wrote and designed myself.

    This past school year in Newton there have been three suicides among the high school community.  I have suffered from clinical depression and anxiety for many years as well as struggling with suicidality, so these recent events shook me to the core.  One of the girls was a friend of mine who sat three seats to my right in english class this year.  I had planned to take part in the CAPStone program since the spring of my junior year, but my project had seemed nebulous even to me up until this winter.  Before then I had wanted to write my own book, as I have been writing on my own for many years, but in my head there was no focus, message, or theme that could give any shape to my project.  I found my inspiration during our school's darkest time and decided to turn it into a light.

    This campaign has a couple central goals that I could use some help with.  The book already exists, so this is not about funding a hollow promise for something in the future.  This is about spreading a message of hope.  All I want is to be able to share my work and message with anyone and everyone who need to hear it, starting with my community and then spreading outward.  Your donations will go directly towards printing and disseminating my book, both to my supporters on Indiegogo and in Newton.  I used a service called "Blurb" to print my book personally, but I feel the cost is too high to ask the general public to pay.  A basic softcover copy costs about $40 to print, and that is not conducive to sharing in any meaningful way.  This is not about making money, this is about healing and spreading a message.  All of the money goes towards printing, and if you donate a certain amount half of it will go towards printing you a copy and the other half will print a copy for someone else.  I keep 0% of the donations.


What I Need & What You Get


Ok so more in detail:

-My fundraising goal is $500.

-Everyone who donates $5 or more will receive a link to download the PDF version of my book.  The point of this perk is to share what I've done in the hope that you will in turn share it with the people in your life.  I want this to get out into the world and not just live in my computer or at my school, and you can help with that.  Keep it for yourself or share it with all your friends and family, do whatever you want it's as much yours as it is mine.

-Every other perk is designed so that it is just about double the cost it is to me to print physical copies of the book.  You will receive a copy in the mail and I will print another to send out to people in my community, the publishing world, those suffering from mental illness, and anyone else who wants or needs some hope.  I do not know at this point who specifically will be receiving each of the other copies, but I will let people know once I have a better idea.  The slight increase in the donation amount from the printing cost is to cover the shipping costs to make sure everyone receives their book sooner rather than later.

-Each book (soft cover, hard cover dust jacket, and hard cover image wrap) will be printed on premium paper for lasting quality and deep contrast in the images.

-If I do not reach my goal of $500 the money I have raised will still go towards printing however many books I can, and anyone who donated will still be guaranteed a copy (I promise!).

-If I somehow exceed my fundraising goal then nothing will change (except I will be off the walls with excitement), everyone will get their copy and I will simply print more books.


***The book is 52 pages long, landscape orientation, length of 10 inches, height of 8 inches, professionally printed and bound using premium paper.


The Impact


    I will admit up front, I have never tried a project like this before.  That being said, I've committed the entire second half of my senior year in high school to making this book a reality, and I plan on continuing that devotion with this campaign.  For me, depression and suicide are two of the most tragic realities we face in our world today.  There has been lots of talk about excessive diagnosing and over-medicating and social stigma and the change that must occur, but few grassroots initiatives to truly make a change in how our society views mental illness.  This book is raw and emotional, that's the way I meant for it to be, but I believe that is what we need to even begin any sort of change.  My city lost three teenagers who had barely even started living their lives yet, and this is the best way I could conceive to honor them.  If you believe in life and you believe it is possible to heal, then please consider donating to this cause.


Other Ways You Can Help


Please also remember that if you feel you cannot donate, for whatever reason, you can still share this campaign with your friends and family.  Every little bit helps immensely!  Also remember to share the PDF freely and generously if you wish, the link will be good for anyone to download from if you choose to share it on social media or any website, blog, chat room, channel, or anything else on the internet!

Thank you everyone for just taking the time to read this!  I know it is a lot of text to look at.

(Just as a side note - my tumblr website link is not directly for my book, it is related mostly to the research aspect of my CAPS project, but feel free to check it out if you are interested.)


Email:  howeartandwriting@gmail.com

For questions/comments concerning my work.

story:
Ξεκινήσαμε μια ωραία μέρα και είπαμε να βγάλουμε την κακία από μέσα μας απέναντι σε ότι μας σπάει τα νεύρα, μας χαλάει την αισθητική, καταστρέφει την ηρεμία μας και κάνει αυτό τον τόπο λίγο χειρότερο απ'την κόλαση.


Έτσι λοιπόν, μαζευτήκαμε τέσσερις άνθρωποι, φτιάξαμε μυστικές ταυτότητες και στολές και βγήκαμε στον χαοτικό κόσμο του internet. Η Κακιοτάτη, ο μικρός Στάλιν, ο Nikon και η Μολότοφ καθημερινά σας τροφοδοτούν με κακίες που αφορούν τους πάντες και τα πάντα.

Και εσείς τι κάνατε για αυτό; Αυτό που έπρεπε. Πέσατε με τα μούτρα στο ψητό. Δηλαδή κατακαρακλικάρατε τις αναρτήσεις μας, ρίξατε το site από τις επισκέψεις σας, μας βομβαρδίσατε με σχόλια και καταφέρατε μέσα σε ένα μήνα να χρειαστούμε server. Να είστε καλά να μας ρίχνετε και να είμαστε καλά να ξανανεβαίνουμε.

Για το λόγο αυτό ζητάμε τη συνδρομή σας εάν θέλετε να συνεχίσετε να διαβάζετε την Κακία, η οποία μεγαλώνει και κακιώνει όλο και περισσότερο. Από εμάς για εσάς και από εσάς για εμάς, μια σχέση αμφίδρομη η οποία θέλουμε να παραμείνει σταθερή στο μέλλον.

1€=Μας χαρίζετε μια κακιούλα
5€=Μας δωρίζετε τη κακία σας
10€=Μας προσφέρετε ατόφιο μίσος

Ευχαριστούμε.

Η Κακιοτάτη, ο μικρός Στάλιν, ο Nikon και η Μολότοφ καθημερινά σας τροφοδοτούν με κακίες που αφορούν τους πάντες και τα πάντα. Και εσείς τι κάνατε για αυτό; Αυτό που έπρεπε. Πέσατε με τα μούτρα στο ψητό. Δηλαδή κατακαρακλικάρατε τις αναρτήσεις μας, ρίξατε το site από τις επισκέψεις σας, μας βομβαρδίσατε με σχόλια και καταφέρατε μέσα σε ένα μήνα να χρειαστούμε server. Να είστε καλά να μας ρίχνετε και να είμαστε καλά να ξανανεβαίνουμε.Για το λόγο αυτό ζητάμε τη συνδρομή σας εάν θέλετε να συνεχίσετε να διαβάζετε την Κακία, η οποία μεγαλώνει και κακιώνει όλο και περισσότερο. Από εμάς για εσάς και από εσάς για εμάς, μια σχέση αμφίδρομη η οποία θέλουμε να παραμείνει σταθερή στο μέλλον.1€=Μας χαρίζετε μια κακιούλα5€=Μας δωρίζετε τη κακία σας10€=Μας προσφέρετε ατόφιο μίσοςΕυχαριστούμε.

story:
With the coming published efforts of Taboo 4: Angle of the Angels and the Omnibus Generalis volume 1 comes Project 5: In Search For More Funding!

As of the previous funding, many inroads have been made into publication (namely Taboos 0-2 and the newest offering, Taboo 3), and soon editing of Taboo 5 will occur.

Aside from that, there's also the support needed for the upcoming Rose City Comic Con.  Supplies and stock is necessary to sell, and this time around a paltry $500 investment is needed!  Books, books, and more books are needed to sell, sell, and sell!

Things have been happening at an insane speed but we've been keepin' up and keepin' it transparent!

Currently the facebook event to support Project 5 (The Internuggetathon 2.0: Electric Boogaloo) can be found at the following event page: https://www.facebook.com/events/1444641639149005/

PROJECT 5 NOW FEATURES THE LEVEL UP SYSTEM!

Did you help in the last fundraiser, Project 4?  Then by all means, when you donate THIS time around you'll automatically be upgraded to the next level of perk!

Because we remember you, our donators, and are simply that grateful for your generosity.

Do keep in mind that it's the next level of perks presented in Project 5.  Further, this only affects donations of $25-$100.

But hey, GIT YOU SOME!

As always, you can find out more about Thomas Duder, Author of the Things or The Generalist at the following websites:

The Pen Is My Sword - http://www.thepenismysword.com
Duder's Army - http://www.dudersarmy.com
Facebook Author Page - http://www.facebook.com/AuthorOfTheThings

story:
Short Summary

every photo and screenshot featured in this campaign was captured by me of an actual 3D model I've made. These are not mockups. Actual stl files.

The goal is to create a platform for cost effective one-of-a-kind pop culture gifts, grinders, bowls. [and sunglasses someday]. All being made with a day one goal of 11 day idea to arrival system

printed nostalgia for the masses. functional items designed around familar objects and brands. Advertising and quirky innovation by a college freshman drinking Pepsi lined with coffee. Parody logos and the reexamination of product norms. All my previous work is available to the public for free over here.

I just make the weird things that other people choose not to. I want to design more awesome things like tools and a tableware line. The ultimate goal is to 3D print wearable sneakers. This campaign is in the hopes of getting a printer to get the ball rolling on these things. 

Currently going to a school that's in the middle of nowhere with zero makerspaces accessible on foot. My school has a few but they're not for "recreational" use.

What We Need & What You Get

simple

I am broke

i have student loans

the printer that I need is ---> 

  • I need about $250 realistically (not the $500 fundraising minimum imposed by indiegogo). Anything above $255 (in increments of 50) will upgrade EVERY perk >$20 to recieve an extra keychain
  • every contribution counts, no matter how small
  • PERKS ARE ON THE RIGHT :) (i don't know about mobile)

The Impact

HELP MAKE A DREAM COME TRUE :)

Risks & Challenges

Building the machine itself. Luckily there is a build guide and wealth of videos online. I have a team of students willing to help me construct the machine to proper calibrations.


RISK - these part are from china and can break during shipping but extra funding can help insure the bulk ordering of extra Kossel Mini parts.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • share the campaign on social media things.
  • if you have a kossel mini, please send me spare parts or advice

/
/
v

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Thank you for taking a look at my campaign!

The story of the New Amazing Nightmare follows the protantagonist ( ;) ) Amondire and several other major characters, whose lives begin to intertwine as the circumstances push them towards each other.

When people learnt to use magical energies to create harmful afflicitons - curses - others had to learn how to cure them. Amondire is one of the latter - a medic specializing in cleansing souls. Together with a small group he's working on a research project that could reduce the amount of destructive magical experiments carried out on humans. Things get complicated when a member of the group is murdered just weeks before the night on which the project could be finalized. They have to ask help from an old friend, a prophetess named Asantra. As she leaves the serene Sanctuary to come assist them, her supressed visions start to surface.

In the future seen by the prophets, Amondire becomes the Sinhail, a feared man who broke the biggest taboo - he learned how to destroy immortal human souls. And Asantra becomes his first victim - the Half-gone, stuck between life and death, trapped by her own wounded soul.

The question is - is that future the reality, or merely visions of possibilities that can be changed and prevented?

The problem is - sometimes the nightmare of one man is the salvation of another.

The New Amazing Nightmare is a story about generally good people in a generally bad world.

And skeletons stuffed into closets with wacky doors...

Creek.

Chapter 1
Chapter 2
Chapter 3

I'm hesitant to slap the 'fantasy' label onto this novel, because while at a glance the New Amazing Nightmare is a fantasy novel, the genre lines get blurry. Nibbling on the sci-fi here, rubbing against drama there. No heroes, no quests, no big evil to vanquish with righteous vengeance.

Nowadays the definition of fantasy is broad, and its subgenres plentiful, but with some help from my friends I concluded that the "new weird", even though... weird, is still better than an "epic low gaslight but also electricity turning into sci-fi psychological social drama fantasy city not-quite-adventure." Or is it?

Here is an image showing the concept behind the covers. The actual covers will of course all be fully painted characters, but for the sake of avoiding spoilers, they will come one at a time.

And here are the book spines for the entire story - in the end they will look a bit different as the thickness will vary between the volumes.




The main reason I'm self-publishing is that the New Amazing Nightmare is a continuous story composed of five volumes, and none of them is a standalone. Everyone and their kittens (agents and writers on their blogs, people in the know visiting writing forums, publisher websites) agree that trying to query something like that as a debuting author is doomed to fail. So I decided to save time, mine and the agents', and publish on my own.

It's not an easy process, and I'm not sure it's any less stressful than trade publishing, because without guidance from industry professionals I also run around biting cables and worrying about what I could've done better, what I missed, what should be different. It's difficult to finally say STOP and move forward. That's why I've been sitting on this for about six years now :) I also have to take care of technical things as well (cover, e-book, formatting). But I'm doing my best, and I hope I will not disappoint.





I did everything I could on my own - the cover, the perks, the trailer, the website (amazing it is not, but it does its job for now). But one thing I cannot do, is cleanse my manuscript of various linguistic errors. It takes a special eye and experience I simply don't possess. Hence I'm asking for help in funding the line-edit for the first book, so I can deliver a quality book that readers deserve.

All of the perk prizes will be ordered and delivered after the campaign is over, because I need to know the exact amounts of prizes to order. But I will not leave you in the dark - I will keep updates on my Twitter, Facebook and Website so you can rest assured everything will be A okay. I made sure to check the quality of every prize and designed all of them before launching this campaign to avoid any nasty surprises - there's only a good one, and it's lurking in the mystery gift!

1$ - I will write the remaining four books! ;)

3000$ - I will have the cards printed in an offset print technique. To do that, I need to order a solid batch - the price then goes down considerably, and the machine has a lot more precision, which means I'll be able to add thin bright frames around the cards as I originally planned, and sell the decks at a reasonable price on my website.

4000$ - I will record an audiobook of the novel and make it available for free download by the end of summer (or release it in chapters).

Any funds left after realizing the goals will go towards the marketing - I'd like to support artists I like by ordering some images, organize contests with prizes on Facebook. Perhaps get a lullaby from the novel recorded by music academy students, or get the website a professional facelift. A lack of ideas is definitely not the problem here! :)

(not an elf... just sayin')

Everyone who donates even 1$ will receive the New Amazing Nightmare - Symmetry of Sins e-book. Thank you for your support!

If you can't donate, but would want to support my project, come visit me on Facebook, spread the word about the campaign, or drop a note on my website.

Though I plan to sell the book for 2.99$ in the on-line book shops, I will send it to people who honestly can't afford it and ask to receive a copy. I would love to live from writing, but even more so, I'd hate for money to stand in the way of someone who'd want to explore the story I write :)

I would love to live from writing, but even more so, I'd hate for money to stand in the way of someone who'd want to explore the story I write :)

story:
Summary  

“Jesus is my Hero, I am not a Christian.... Letting Go of Labels and Living From the Heart” is a book for anyone interested in spiritual awakening.  With timeless content it empowers the reader to connect to the well of love that can only be found within. It is inspired reading for anyone interested in understanding the mind of Christ and how the principles that Jesus taught may be applied to daily life in order to find their own strength and authenticity in the human experience.

The objective of the book is to reach the many people who wish to connect to the Christ Consciousness, the path of non- judgment and unconditional love, whether they are Christian or not, in order to more fully realize their own Christ nature and enlivening the awareness of the One love that connects all humans.

The goal is to have the book completed and available to the world in January 2013. 

How will these funds be used? 

The funds will be used to self-publish copies of the book, and also to pay for editing, layout, publicity, and order fulfillment. We also intend to donate copies of the book to institutions such a prisons and addiction recovery programs.

Read about Kimberly Wright

Read about the book 

 

Why IndieGogo?

I have been working with Kimberly Wright for several months.  While working with Kimberly, I volunteered to begin editing her book “Jesus is my Hero, I am not a Christian”. 

Working with Kimberly has been such a powerful and life saving experience.  While reading the content of this book, I have had shifts in my life, in my own awakening and connection to the Christ Consciousness that are beyond what any words can describe. 

Experiencing the impact of working with Kimberly Wright, and the power of this book, I can confidently say that reading this book will shift your life, wherever you are at, in the most amazing ways.  

This book must be published and available to the world, which is why I have created this fundraiser.  Your pledges are a significant contribution to this amazing piece of work, and thus also to the shift in humanity that is happening now.     

 

What is Christ Consciousness? 

Excerpts from the book "Jesus is my Hero, I am not a Christian"

“The experience of Christ consciousness waking up is an experience that can only happen within the awareness and within the heart that is truly seeking to know the truth within.”

“Christ consciousness is the awareness of love in all beings and circumstances.  It sees no colors or wrong doing. It is the awareness of what is as perfection.  It is the awareness of love as the only thing that is real and as that which has created all that is for the purpose of awakening the One being that is all to itself.”

“Jesus was one of many who have come to be the embodiment of this message in the human form.  While he was not the only one, he was indeed the one that embodied the energy of the Christ Consciousness structure in order to bring it to modern day man and save the world from it's own destruction.”

“The Christ Consciousness can happen without the intention of giving one's life to Jesus. It can happen, through meditation and devotion to finding the truth within.  But devotion to God, and devotion to finding the truth within, is Christ Consciousness emerging in the seeker... whether they see it as that or not.  The CC does not seek to define the seeker by what means they arrive there. It receives any seeker who is genuine of heart and intention.  And in the structure of consciousness that we now refer to as Christ Consciousness many will eventually find themselves in relation with Jesus or with the other forms of Christ, such as Mother Mary, Kuan Yin or Buddha, all expressions of this consciousness.” 

“When you are in Christ Consciousness you will see only love in all beings and in all circumstances.  Fear will melt away and love will prevail in your awareness.  Great love swells the heart as it breaths in the awareness of the Universal heart, knowing and feeling and experiencing the Oneness of all, the greatest love there is.”

The Christ consciousness is the aspect of the collective universal consciousness that is centered in the heart that is awake to love, or light, in all beings, reaching beyond all boundaries related to the material world such as race or religion. In Christ consciousness all paths and all humans are equal and created in love. In realizing the Christ consciousness through awakening the individual, then experiences the unity of himself with all other beings, recognizing as well that all creation exists within one's own consciousness, and the result is a life of grace, ease, and unconditional love for all. One recognizes there is only love in all circumstances.  The essence of this path is grace. 

You are invited to join the awakening of the Christ within the collective through your active choice that you will now begin to wake up to this in your own life. 

It does not matter what religion you practice, or don't practice. It matters only that you make the choice each day to know the truth from within you – that you actively choose this is all that matters. That choice, your determination to know the truth, within yourself, for yourself, by your own path of choice – THAT is the path of Christ. It is a path of following only what speaks true to your heart in the moment. It is the path of the individual who wants answers, but not from books or dogma or doctrine of the world. Those things may inspire at best, but the real work is done internally, through intention, choice and a dedication to knowing the truth by no other means than this. 

As for the great love that is available in the Christ consciousness, please don't take my word for it.   Find out for yourself. Decide to know the truth. All you have to do is ask.   And in the mire of the current collective energetic structures and paradigms that currently exist in the world and therefore in the mind of most humans, there is a need to be diligent in this intention.  It has to be a priority on your list.  Otherwise you will find yourself living a life on auto pilot, caught in the mire, and wondering what's missing, or why you can't seem to make the law of attraction work for you.  How can you make the law of attraction work for you when you are 99% asleep to who you really are?

Your contribution is appreciated!

Other ways to help...

TELL your friends, family, colleagues, neighbours, students about this campaign and share this page: www.indiegogo.com/JesusismyHero

SHARE it through Facebook  

SHARE through Twitter 

BLOG, TWEET, RETWEET.

Get in touch...

For more information email us! 

Inquiry@KimberlyWright.com

Your contribution is appreciated!
Other ways to help...
TELL your friends, family, colleagues, neighbours, students about this campaign and share this page: www.indiegogo.com/JesusismyHero
SHARE it through Facebook  
SHARE through Twitter 
BLOG, TWEET, RETWEET.
Get in touch...
For more information email us! 
Inquiry@KimberlyWright.com

story:
"...a long time ago

we named things at random
now we are paying for it

we don’t see a soul like we see the moon rising
we don’t understand simple facts

where are we going
why do the seagulls cry    I have these words

sometimes I feel like touching their flesh
the roundness

and then I let them fall
one by one into your mouth, Mr. Nothing

make me an offer
I will buy your big and burning eyes"

-Stella Vinitchi Radulescu, from I Scrape the Window of Nothingness: New & Selected Poems (Orison Books, 2015)
***
New Perks!
1. Malaprop's Bookstore in Asheville, NC has generously donated three $25 gift certificates! For a $25 contribution, you will receive, dollar for dollar, a $25 gift certificate. Select the "Malaprop's Gift Certificate" perk to claim yours today!

2. The first fiction manuscript critique by Kevin McIlvoy has been claimed, but he has generously offered a second one! Kevin McIlvoy is the author of numerous books, including The Fifth Station, Little Peg, Hyssop, and The Complete History of New Mexico: Stories; he is a faculty member in the Warren Wilson MFA Program for Writers; and he is a former board member of The Council of Literary Magazines & Presses and The Association of Writers & Writing Programs. Mcilvoy is offering a critique session for a short story manuscript up to 30 double-spaced pages in exchange for a contribution of $200 to the Orison Books Indiegogo campaign. Select the "Fiction Manuscript Critique 2" perk to take advantage of this superb opportunity!

3. We're now also offering poetry manuscript critiques by M. E. Silverman and Philip Metres. Silverman is co-editor of The Bloomsbury Anthology of Jewish American Poetry and editor of Blue Lyra Review. Metres is the recipient of the Arab American Book Award for his collection abu ghraib arias and the Beatrice Hawley Book Award from Alice James Books for his forthcoming collection Sand Opera. Select the "Poetry Manuscript Critique" or "Poetry Manuscript Critique 2" perk to claim one of these opportunities!
***

You can now see a sample from Orison Books' first title, I Scrape the Window of Nothingness, by Stella Vinitchi Radulescu, at the bottom of the following page on our website: http://orisonbooks.com/product/radulescupaperback/

***

Overview

Today, a significant gap exists between literary publishers and strictly religious publishers. Literary publishers occasionally publish books of spiritual depth, but few, if any, set out to do so as a mission and raison d’être. Religious publishers, on the other hand, tend to publish work that offers little appeal to readers outside a particular ideological group. Orison Books, a new non-profit (501(c)(3)) literary press, aims to address this gap through its focus on the life of the spirit from a non-ideological standpoint. 

We are conducting a fundraiser to enable a successful launch. Through behind-the-scenes efforts, Orison Books initially raised $6,500, which allowed us to incorporate, apply for tax exemption with the IRS, and create a logo and website. Our goal is to raise an additional $40,000 to enable us to begin publishing books in early 2015.

“Orison” [awr-uh-zuhn] is an archaic word that means “prayer.” We at Orison Books believe that the best spiritual art and literature call us to meditate and contemplate, rather than asking us to adopt any ideology or set of propositions.  As Simone Weil wrote, “The mysteries of faith are degraded if they are made into an object of affirmation and negation, when in reality they should be an object of contemplation” (Gravity and Grace). This type of art evokes the human experience of transcendence and explores the mysteries of being, and in so doing opens our minds and hearts to the divine and the possibility of becoming the fullest humans we can be. In our view, spiritual writing has little to do with subject matter. Rather, the kind of work we seek to publish has a transcendent aesthetic effect on the reader, and reading it can itself be a spiritual experience. Such work is not merely about spiritual contemplation, but itself leads the reader into profound contemplation. It is not merely about the sublime, but itself has a sublime effect on the reader. It is not merely about the mystery of being, but itself heightens the reader’s sense of the mystery underlying the fabric of our daily lives.

Orison Books will serve as a home for writers and readers of all backgrounds, religious and non-religious. In addition to publishing spiritually-engaged poetry, fiction, and non-fiction books of exceptional literary merit, each year we will publish The Orison Anthology—a collection of the best spiritual writing in all genres published in periodicals the preceding year.

Our titles will be released in beautifully-designed hardcover and paperback formats, and many will also be released as e-books.

Additionally, Orison Books aims to contribute to the cultural conversations around spirituality and literature by hosting classes, readings, symposia, and other public events.

We cannot succeed without the contributions of those who support our mission of publishing exceptional literature that engages the life of the spirit, and of fostering cultural conversation around spirituality and literature. Please consider making a tax-deductible contribution today.

Since Orison Books is a non-profit, Indiegogo does not require us to reach our goal in order for us to collect donated funds. All funds are collected in real time, and we at Orison will use whatever amount we're able to raise first of all on expenses related to releasing and promoting our first title. If we raise more than is necessary for that, then we will be able to more quickly acquire and release additional titles and plan public events. If we reach our $40,000 goal, we have budgeted for a small salary for the Editor in order to allow him to create the time necessary for shepherding Orison Books into a successful and impactful future. (This will be more than a full-time job!) So, even if you're able to donate $10, or $50, or $250, it will support the mission of Orison Books, and our promise to you is that we will use all funds raised in a responsible and thoughtful way, always in order to further our mission of publishing the finest new spiritually-engaged literature, and promoting cultural conversation around spirituality and literature. Thank you for any support you're able to offer. And if you're unable to support us monetarily but you feel compelled by our mission, please consider helping spread the word about our fundraising effort, which is a vital aspect of any fundraising campaign. 

Please also visit our website at www.orisonbooks.com.

Our First Title

Orison Books is pleased to announce its first title:

I Scrape The Window of Nothingness: New & Selected Poems

by Stella Vinitchi Radulescu


Release date: March, 2015

“Stella Vinitchi Radulescu’s poems are rich in connotations, metaphysically profound in some great unlocatable fashion. Surreal, ethereal, some of the poems enact ghostly things, and a very powerful world view glitters and solidifies…. It’s a dark poetry shining with the ecstasy of the imagination let loose, a triumph of being, a war against banality.” 

—David Dodd Lee, author of The Nervous Filaments

"Daunting to even try to put into a few words a poetry that is sui generis, whose moving language of images, displaced from any single set of cultural signs, seems the distillation of a thousand occasions, a legion of losses—a universal language 'at the edge of spoken time,' a vision 'wildly sad, diffused, beautiful, a tactile absence.' In this poetry of passionate paradox, embodied thought becomes the solid clarity through which what we can’t see is glimpsed."            

—Eleanor Wilner, MacArthur Fellow and author of Tourist in Hell

"Stella Vinitchi Radulescu’s poetry irradiates, like a magnetic field charged with mysteries, the movements and the rituals of her bright vision. One of the strongest characteristics of her poems consists in the unabridged relationship she establishes with words, a pact that sends us to their origins. The poet dares to carry the shadow of her own loneliness, keeping pace with that of her words, up to the line of a horizon where sky and earth, life and death merge." 

—Alexandru Lungu, editor of Zarathustra and Argo

"With constancy and felicity Stella Vinitchi Radulescu pursues her poetic course in a pertinent and already important trilingual oeuvre. [. . .] She remains faithful to a certain hermeticism that breathes more force into her work, whose mysterious form beats with the rhythm of life." 

—Michel Bénard, laureate of l’Académie Française and Chevalier de l’Ordre des Arts & des Lettres

About the Author: Stella Vinitchi Radulescu was born in Romania in 1946 and left the country permanently in 1983, at the height of Ceausescu’s communist regime. She holds a Ph.D. in French Language & Literature from the University of Bucharest. Since 1989, she has taught French, first at Loyola University, and subsequently at Northwestern University. She writes poetry in English, French, and Romanian and is the author of numerous collections of poetry published in the United States, France, and Romania. She has received several prizes for her French books, including the Grand Prix de Poésie Henri-Noël Villard and the Prix Amélie Murat. I Scrape the Window of Nothingness: New & Selected Poems is a collection of work selected from Radulescu's English-language poetry published over several decades, along with a substantial collection of previously unpublished work.

story:
Be the Vessel: Help Provide Scholarships for Brave Voice, and Help Us Create New Work

  • For the Sake of the Song: Kelley Hunt and Caryn Mirriam-Goldberg were brought together in 2004 to write a song. Neither of us have been the same since! We experienced such thrills and joy in creating songs together that we've gone on to write over 30 songs, some of which Kelley has recorded and performed around the world.
  • When Music and Poetry Meet: For the last eight years, we have created performances that join song, poetry, and even on occasion, dance. Each performance focuses on a theme close to the hearts of our community, such as healing through the arts, redefining beauty, coming home to the soul, and connecting with community, earth and sky. 
  • Finding Our Brave Voice: Since 2006, we've co-led "Brave Voice: Writing & Singing For Your Life" 6-day workshops in the Flint Hills of Kansas, helping professional and emerging writers, musicians, singers, songwriters, artists, educators and others find new art, right livelihood, and enduring community.
  • This Campaign: We ask you to support 1) the creation of new songs and poems, which we will perform with dancer Laura Ramberg in Lawrence, Council Grove and other venues in 2014; and 2) the scholarship fund for Brave Voice.

Help us be the vessel for new work, and help us create opportunities for others to be the vessel too!

What We Need & What You Get

Our Fundraising Plan: We ultimately are raising $4,000 ($1,500 for creation of new work; $2,500 for scholarships to Brave Voice), $2,500 of which will be raised through this Indiegogo campaign:

  • Scholarship Funds: Help support up to five people attending the event, which costs approximately $700/participant for room, board, and the workshop. We meet you part-way by lowering fees for scholarship recipients.
  • New Work Fund: Support our work together unearthing or catching new songs, developing the lyrics and music, Kelley arranging each song, Caryn creating new poetry -- all toward a collaborative performance that also features Laura Ramberg.
  • What You Get: We offer wonderful perks, from signed CDs and books, to a poem or song written especially for you or a loved one, to other surprises betwix and between. Enjoy!

The Impact

"You Gotta Be the Vessel," one of our early songs, reminds us that "The more you pour, the more you receive/ in the great by and by." We invite you to pour the love. Here are some testimonials about our work:

  • "Kelley and Caryn's workshops for writers, musicians and songwriters, created for the Lied Center of Kansas, was phenomenal. Great artists in their own rights, the creative space they created for our local artists was expansive. They brought participants to a new level of expression, allowing them to explore their creativity in a safe and supportive environment." ~ Anthea Scouffas, Engagement-Educator Director, Lied Center of Kansas
  • "Renowned rhythm and blues artist Kelley Hunt and star poet Caryn Mirriam-Goldberg celebrate the coupled power of word and music in the tradition of great poet/musician collaborators such as Mingus and Hughes. Full of heart and soul, Hunt and Mirriam-Goldberg are the perfect pairing of the word and the song." ~ Kevin Rabas, Co-Director, Creative Writing Program, Emporia State University
  • "It was a true gift to be able to spend time learning from these two very gifted artists. The combination of Kelley’s experience as a performing singer/songwriter and Caryn’s literary expertise provided an especially unique environment in which to explore creative expression. The workshop was both validating and inspiring, in deeply meaningful ways.”  – Cindy Novelo, singer/songwriter and performing musician, Lawrence, KS.
  • "Every year, I am riveted to implement but a fraction of the wisdom and support I receive from this six-day creative cocoon that is Brave Voice. Every year, I take in the next steps needed for myself to move forward and release those things that hold me back. Caryn and Kelley are guardian angels of the divine.” — Dianna Burrup, singer/songwriter, graphic designer, Broken Arrow, OK.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute money-wise, you can help us otherwise.

  • Please share this link on Facebook and click on other Indiegogo share tools.
  • Tell your friends about this campaign, and pass the word.

"What you gonna do when the light wants through? If not through you, then tell me who." 

Big thanks to Ken Lassman and Al Berman, photographers and husbands extraordinaire, and for the use of their photos: Tom Parker (see his wonderful site here), Joanne Hickey, Diana Burrup, Maria Johnson, and for our website graphics, Alexandra Porsi

graphic designer, Broken Arrow, OK.









Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute money-wise, you can help us otherwise.

Please share this link on Facebook and click on other Indiegogo share tools.
Tell your friends about this campaign, and pass the word.

the light wants through? If  not through you,
then tell me who." 
Big thanks to Ken Lassman and Al Berman, photographers and husbands extraordinaire, and for the use of their photos: Tom Parker (see his wonderful site here), Joanne Hickey, Diana Burrup, Maria Johnson, and for our website graphics, Alexandra Porsi

story:
The stories of Zebra Zalika immerse the reader in tales of idealistic childhood adventures. Written in the form of simple rhymes, these poetic stories speak the language of the heart and invoke the simple joys of companionship and personal discovery.

This first book is the result of a collaborative effort between two creative individuals seeking to exercise their abilities and create a story that will excite young readers and inspire them to see the world as a smaller place, full of different types of people to discover and interact with.

We are seeking to raise the funding neccessary to cover the costs of self-publishing. We need to purchase our own ISBN number, illustration materials, and marketing materials. We are planning to -self-publish using Amazon's CreateSpace service, and in order to do that we need to find support from crowdfunding contributors like you!

 

Leaving Her Home

Zebra Zalika has left her home and is ready to explore a new frontier. Who will she meet along the way, and what will she see?

 

Exploring the Jungle

She is venturing into the unknown -- what stands before her is a vast, vibrant jungle. The lush environment is home to many new and exciting animals.

 

Mysterious New Companions

Bright, colorful birds follow at a distance. Why is there a zebra in the jungle? Is she lost or is she looking for a friend? Perhaps they'll make an approach.

 

Illustrator Sarah Stovalosky graduated from the School of Visual Arts with a BFA in Illustation. After graduation, Sarah spent a year living in China where she taught English to primary school-aged children and learned the art of communicating with children.

http://www.sarahstovalosky.com/

Author Ryan C. Jones, is an alumni of The Ohio State University and Returned Peace Corps Volunteer. He has studied abroad in Germany and served for nearly two years in Antigua Barbuda, where he volunteered in youth literacy programs.

http://about.me/ryancjones

The stories of Zebra Zalika immerse the reader in tales of idealistic childhood adventures. Written in the form of simple rhymes, these poetic stories speak the language of the heart and invoke the simple joys of companionship and personal discovery.This first book is the result of a collaborative effort between two creative individuals seeking to exercise their abilities and create a story that will excite young readers and inspire them to see the world as a smaller place, full of different types of people to discover and interact with.
We are seeking to raise the funding neccessary to cover the costs of self-publishing. We need to purchase our own ISBN number, illustration materials, and marketing materials. We are planning to -self-publish using Amazon's CreateSpace service, and in order to do that we need to find support from crowdfunding contributors like you!
 
Leaving Her Home

Zebra Zalika has left her home and is ready to explore a new frontier. Who will she meet along the way, and what will she see?
 
Exploring the Jungle

She is venturing into the unknown -- what stands before her is a vast, vibrant jungle. The lush environment is home to many new and exciting animals.
 
Mysterious New Companions

Bright, colorful birds follow at a distance. Why is there a zebra in the jungle? Is she lost or is she looking for a friend? Perhaps they'll make an approach.
 
Illustrator Sarah Stovalosky graduated from the School of Visual Arts with a BFA in Illustation. After graduation, Sarah spent a year living in China where she taught English to primary school-aged children and learned the art of communicating with children.
http://www.sarahstovalosky.com/
Author Ryan C. Jones, is an alumni of The Ohio State University and Returned Peace Corps Volunteer. He has studied abroad in Germany and served for nearly two years in Antigua Barbuda, where he volunteered in youth literacy programs.
http://about.me/ryancjones

story:
**Very sincere thanks to everyone who funded, advised and supported this Indiegogo project! The book is on track for August mailing, following which proof and then final copies will be mailed to contributors. Visit the James Bond's Cuisine site to order your copies today!**

**

A Book With All The Food And Drink

From Every James Bond Film and Book


**Draft Design Front/Rear Cover: Not Final**

**Draft Design Front Rear/Cover: Not Final**

 You know his Name and Number... A unique

JAMES BOND MOVIE AND BOOK GUIDE

*Now titled "James Bond's Cuisine!"
*Covers every last James Bond book and movie
*Compiled after years of research by a top Bondologist
*Index of real world eateries so fans can eat where Bond eats, what Bond eats

Learn about everything everyone has eaten or drunk in
every Bond book and every Bond movie:

Recipes * Food and Non-Food Trivia Not Found Elsewhere * Food Used As Weapons * Food Used To Smuggle * Food Hiding Secret Lairs * Villains and Allies Killed With Food * Quips and Puns About Food * Insider Stories * Chef's Notes * Cocktails and Fine Wines * Gourmet Meals * Influences on Culture and Restaurants * Thousands of Menu Items * Signature Meals for Every Last Book and Film

At once a work of serious scholarship, oodles of fun and a culinary tour de force, James Bond’s Cuisine: OO7’s Every Last Meal is the story of James Bond’s turbulent and indulgent relationship with the world’s finest food and drink, as Bond’s food is bartered, stolen, weaponized, used for rewards, threats, tortures and seductions, and ultimately, savored.

OO1: All the food, drink and food production of all the James Bond novels and movies

OO2: Over 500 real-world locations with menus so fans can eat what Bond eats, where Bond eats

OO3: Hundreds of chef’s notes and “Pay attention, OO7!” tidbits of food and non-food Bond trivia

OO4: James Bond’s quips about food, and Bond’s world of bizarre eating and predatory bites

OO5: Signature meals from each film and book featuring over 30 different international cuisines

OO6: Bonus section with over 600 trivia questions

OO7: Part travelogue, part foodies journal, all action, as exciting as the Bond books and films

You need a hearty breakfast, lunch and dinner if you're going to save the world. An exploration of James Bond's food and drink. Whether you're a Bond book or Bond film fan you'll find plenty to savor inside this delicious volume.

The author has long wanted to satisfy his curiosity and that of Bond fans everywhere. Why does Bond reject a Robolo wine for a dry white Theotoky with his Corfu bourdeto? What does Bond have in that case of food that flashes on screen besides caviar? How do executive chefs and barmen everywhere know he likes his Szechuan extra spicy and his martinis medium dry?

**Draft Page Design: Not Final**

**Draft Page Design: Not Final**

James Bond? Women want him. Men want to be him.
And the author wants readers to eat him—or at least eat like him...

**Watch for updates on this IndieGoGo page!**


Perks & Quirks

  • I'd love for you to pre-buy a book or two (or seven)! If you're new to IndieGoGo, you simply get books and/or other perks based on your contributions. I've got oh-oh-7 perks to choose from including proof books, signed books, your name in the books as a contributor, a unique Caribbean cruise and tickets to my latest spy fan event, Live and Let 'Leans. I've written or edited over a million words about James Bond and entertained more than 120 actors, authors and film production team members, along with intelligence officers (spies!) from the FBI, CIA, NSA and KGB at my fan events, and have appeared on C-SPAN, DISCOVERY, HGTV, VH-1, TLC, TNN and in Ripley's Believe It or Not!,The Chicago Tribune, The Los Angeles Times, The New York Times, The Washington Post, Parade Magazine, Time andTime Europe.

  • While donations of any amount are appreciated, what happens if I get over funded past the $20,000 book goal? Can you say, "Double Jeroboams of Dom Pérignon '53?" Actually, it means more people get to learn how to eat like Bond!

  • What happens if the $20,000 goal isn't reached? I pledge I will honor all perks even if funding falls short. Everyone donating $25 or more receives a glossy 100% FULL COLOR BOOK INSIDE AND OUT. This even if the color version in print costs over $25 in stores. The free world is counting on your contributions, Mr. and Mrs. Bond!

Sudden Impact

IndieGoGo makes a difference:

  • Why a book on every last meal in every OO7 book and film? Because nothing of importance happens to Bond without food or drink nearby. He proposes marriage in a restaurant, meets villains over dining tables, drinks before he kills and steals caviar, vodka or a grape after a melee. A Bond movie has 20 food, drinking and eating scenes and a villain eating from a massive table laden with silver, crystal and gold. A Bond novel details 20-40 meals or more. Ian Fleming's novels grew world famous for their travelogues including exotic, gourmet and just plain delicious food.

  • Please help me get lush full color printing on each and every page to the public. Filet mignon and lobster look better not printed in grayscale. Money raised from book sales and perks add to professional photography, layout and advertising.

  • Help Eating James Bond look as sharp as possible with modern, clean illustrations and publishing, and please help me get word out with advertising and samples to tell the world what a cool book this will be.

  • Thanks for using IndieGoGo tools and social media to get Eating James Bond to friends (and enemies). Please help me finish this fattening book!

Licensed to Munch:

I'm Matt Sherman, author of or contributor to a dozen books in print. I've led James Bond and spy projects including the world's largest spy fan convention, museum and library shows, seminars, author signings, movie premieres and screenings and themed OO7 tours on location--bringing fans to hundreds of locations including film and book restaurants and hotels. I've created Q&As with actors, CDs, DVDs, books and magazines, and I've also managed four restaurants. I'm the world's leading expert on the food and beverages of the world's leading secret agent.

I'm bringing it all together for my unofficial guidebook, Eating James Bond: OO7's Every Last Meal, a delicious volume with every bite and sip Bond has devoured in more than 70 books and films, notes on food and food production, trivia, recipes, who-eats-what-with-whom-then-kills-whom and all those important kinds of things.

**

Matt Sherman, former MI6 operative, has killed dozens, never in cold blood. Born in New York City before moving to Florida in the 1980’s, Sherman has collected rare James Bond books and movie props for more than 35 years. His Bond memorabilia collection and his spy fan meets in Chicago, Jamaica, Key West, Las Vegas, Los Angeles, Miami, New Orleans, New York, San Francisco and The Bahamas have featured on C-SPAN, DISCOVERY, HGTV, VH-1, TLC, TNN and in Ripley’s Believe It or Not!

More than 120 special guests have appeared at Sherman’s events including Bond actors, authors, musicians and production team members, and also
real world intelligence officers (the preferred euphemism for secret agents) from the FBI, CIA, NSA and the KGB. A Bond locations maven, Sherman has also led fan tours to hundreds of James Bond hotspots including numerous eateries from the novels and films as they appear in James Bond's Cuisine.

Sherman’s contributions have appeared in The Chicago Tribune, The Los Angeles Times, The New York Times, The Washington Post, Parade Magazine, Time and Time Europe. He has written, edited or contributed to more than a dozen books in print and is the Pool, Billiards & Snooker resident expert at About.com, one of the world’s most popular websites. He has managed four restaurants and a canteen and has hors d’oeuvres for readers now at  BondFanEvents.com. Matt and Janine Sherman reside in Gainesville, Florida and have two field agents, Alexandria and Benjamin.
