story:
My name is Vanessa Martir and I am a mother, writer and educator who is completing the first draft of my first memoir, A Dim Capacity for Wings. I now have the opportunity to edit and revise my memoir in a residency with a master writer at VONA’s summer workshops.  

I’ve been cocooned for many months writing my memoir. The venture began over a decade ago when I first put it out into the ether that I wanted to, had to write a pentagonia (five part series) of memoirs. I had to share the story of this girl, raised in Bushwick by two moms long before the lifestyle was discussed in the mainstream, other than to curl lips in disgust and rail about how unnatural it is. I had to share how it felt to be raised by a mentally ill parent. I had to share the story of how and why I left my mother’s home when I was thirteen and never returned. I had to share what happened to me in boarding school, when I realized that I was “the other,” the time a lit cigarette was thrown from a passing truck at me and my St. Lucian friend, followed by the words, “Nigg*s, go home.” I had to share how I ended up with a drug dealer for six years while a student at Columbia University, and how as a result of that relationship, I emotionally incarcerated myself for more than ten years in a desperate attempt to protect my heart (of course I ended up doing more damage to myself than anyone could.) But it’s in the writing that you realize all these things, and that’s what the past decade+ of writing has helped me see. It wasn’t until I went to VONA in 2009 that I really started believing that my stories do indeed matter and should be, need to be heard. In a word, VONA gave me permission.

There was a time when I resisted the stories that cracked my spine, bent me over into impossible positions. I'm not that limber. There is no human who is. It's why it's taken me over a decade to work through this first memoir. I was on my knees; now I'm on my tippy toes showing the world how tall 5 feet 2 inches can be.

In January, after feeling stuck because I couldn’t find the thread in the dozens of stories, something shook loose after a grueling, what-are-you-afraid-of-kind-of conversation. I realized that this book is about my relationship with my mother and what happened that I left at 13. Once I had that, I went in because I’m from the school of: the only way out is in. I knew the first story and I knew the last. I gathered those I had in the middle and started filling in the gaps. And that is why and how today I am now compiling the stories that surfaced in my nightly ritual writing process.

I can feel the book in my hands. I can see the chapters. I can feel my fingers caressing it. I can see the epigraph and the quotes that start the chapters. I can see it all, for the first time in this years-long memoir process, I can finally see the first of the pentagonia.

And now I have an opportunity to have a master writer work through the book with me, help me see where it is strong and where it is weak, help me see the book in its entirety. The thing is, as a teaching artist who quit her job two years ago to work with urban youth, I cannot afford to go to VONA on my current income. I need help. And if there’s anything I’ve learned from memoir, it’s that I have to humble myself and learn to ask for help and accept it when I need it. So I need it now. And so, I’m asking that you help me raise $2000 to attend VONA.

The fees include $700 for the residency + $650 for housing + airfare (which last time I checked was about $550) and all the particulars like cab fare and luggage fees.

 

What do you get?

I’ll gladly share an excerpt of my memoir along with a public recognition (unless you choose to remain anonymous, of course) of your help.

You can also help by sharing with your friends, family, network, etc.

Thank you for helping me live this dream!

story:
The Story...

 

"I want to say it's a Thursday, and the middle of January. I'm not sure exactly because I haven't seen a calendar since the end of October. The one we kept in the apartment ran out, and all of the others have been destroyed in the effort to make sure all of us poor, inferior, humans, submit to the ways of the Achlivan. 
 
It took some time, but I think I'm finally able to accurately document everything that's happened in the past three months. For a while, I wasn't sure if I'd ever be ready.
 
I've seen things I wish I could forget, and as much as I want to just go along with the way of these aliens, I can't. Letting go of my past life is not easy, and I'm terrified of forgetting it.
 
Someday, the human race will be free from captivity, and when that day comes, they'll need to know what happened and how life used to be. They'll need to know that our species was once part of a thriving civilization. That's why I'm writing this."

 

A New Adult, Science Fiction, Adventure novel like no other.

Chevelle Donahue thought going into work would be just like any other boring day at the mall. Sure, there was her annoying co-worker Wicken Lyle, and a promotional visit from teen hearth-throb Timber Hudson to watch to keep her entertained. But who was she kidding? Retail was lame no matter what happened.

A terrorist attack changes everything - an attack from aliens of all things. The patrons are given two options: comply, or else. Complying means giving in to a new set of rules and changing her entire life. "Or else" means she has no chance of going home again.

With the help of Wicken and Timber, she must figure out the truth behind why the aliens are holding them hostage. In doing so, they risk their chance at freedom - but by then they might not want it.

 

Funding Updates:

 

4/3/13

Funds are coming in slow and steady. Thank you everyone for your support! I'm hoping to find some great perks to add to all of the funding levels! Keep sharing, and if you can give even just a little something, it'll go a long way!

 

What I hope to add:

 

- Stickers, bookmarks, and other small swag.

- The opportunity to give print books of my other works away.

- I'm a big fan of jewelry, plushies, and other random swag.

- Giftcards!

 

I'm also looking for street team volunteers! Ideally, there will be some kind of perk for doing that as well, like a copy of the book or something. :) People who are willing to help spread the word on the project, the funding, and after it is released get it promoted as well. Send an email my way if this is something you're interested in doing!

 

Now time to start a newsletter or something along those lines. :)

 

4/6

 

I'm not sure I'm updating this thing right. Hopefully? Not much else to share outside of the production aspect of the project is going very, very, well. I've got my editors all lined up, as well an amazing formatter! Everything is currently on schedule.

 

 

What happens with the funds and what you get:

 

So what is all this money going for:

Editing. Editing. Editing. (it's expensive! I'm estimating about $200-$300 will go to this alone)

Promo. Promo. Promo. (also expensive! This is also about $200 if I'm going to get good quality stuff)

 

I have some amazing people I will be working with to get this book finished and polished. Compensating them for their hard work is very important to me. The rest of the money is going to go towards making swag, getting print copies for giveaways, swag, swag, oh and swag! Also paying for book tours so people can win the swag! Lots of great things that cost a lot of money.

 

What's in it for you?

  • A copy of the ebook, no matter how much you contribute!
  • A chance to get a signed print copy.
  • Cool swag like bookmarks, t-shirts, and other e-books from my collection of works.
  • Whatever else I can come up with as the campaign goes on depending on how much funding I get.

 

Impact

Every little bit helps. If I don't make my goal, you'll still get all of your perks of course, and I'm still going to get this book done. However, it would mean the world to me to be able to do this and give back to everyone who's working so hard to make this happen. I want to pay it forward, pay it back. The book is a truly unique story, and dear to my heart. Basically, you'll be making someone's dream come true. And that's powerful, no matter how small the dream. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share. Share. Share. Tweet it, facebook it, blog about it. Oh, and I'm looking for hosts for blog stops for promotion and a street team. Anyone who wants to offer those things, or other services, is more than welcome to email me for more information at jfjenkinswrites(at)gmail(dot)com.

Funds are coming in slow and steady. Thank you everyone for your support! I'm hoping to find some great perks to add to all of the funding levels! Keep sharing, and if you can give even just a little something, it'll go a long way!
 
What I hope to add:
 
- Stickers, bookmarks, and other small swag.
- The opportunity to give print books of my other works away.
- I'm a big fan of jewelry, plushies, and other random swag.
- Giftcards!
 
I'm also looking for street team volunteers! Ideally, there will be some kind of perk for doing that as well, like a copy of the book or something. :) People who are willing to help spread the word on the project, the funding, and after it is released get it promoted as well. Send an email my way if this is something you're interested in doing!
 
Now time to start a newsletter or something along those lines. :)
 
4/6
 
I'm not sure I'm updating this thing right. Hopefully? Not much else to share outside of the production aspect of the project is going very, very, well. I've got my editors all lined up, as well an amazing formatter! Everything is currently on schedule.
 
 
What happens with the funds and what you get:
 

So what is all this money going for:
Editing. Editing. Editing. (it's expensive! I'm estimating about $200-$300 will go to this alone)
Promo. Promo. Promo. (also expensive! This is also about $200 if I'm going to get good quality stuff)
 
I have some amazing people I will be working with to get this book finished and polished. Compensating them for their hard work is very important to me. The rest of the money is going to go towards making swag, getting print copies for giveaways, swag, swag, oh and swag! Also paying for book tours so people can win the swag! Lots of great things that cost a lot of money.
 
What's in it for you?

A copy of the ebook, no matter how much you contribute!
A chance to get a signed print copy.
Cool swag like bookmarks, t-shirts, and other e-books from my collection of works.
Whatever else I can come up with as the campaign goes on depending on how much funding I get.

 
Impact


Every little bit helps. If I don't make my goal, you'll still get all of your perks of course, and I'm still going to get this book done. However, it would mean the world to me to be able to do this and give back to everyone who's working so hard to make this happen. I want to pay it forward, pay it back. The book is a truly unique story, and dear to my heart. Basically, you'll be making someone's dream come true. And that's powerful, no matter how small the dream. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Share. Share. Share. Tweet it, facebook it, blog about it. Oh, and I'm looking for hosts for blog stops for promotion and a street team. Anyone who wants to offer those things, or other services, is more than welcome to email me for more information at jfjenkinswrites(at)gmail(dot)com.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Mega. I'm an Afro-Caribbean writer from Brooklyn, NY.

Working ostensibly in spoken-word/performance poetry for going on three years, this year, I've been in consideration for a number of writer's retreats, most notably acceptance into the Cave Canem Retreat at the University of Pittsburg in June.

Recently, I've been selected to attend the Minnesota Northwoods Writers Conference for POETRY!

I need help raising $1,000 to pay for the conference fee of $585, room-and-board, which is estimated at $55, and my round-trip plane ticket should be around $400-$500.

This undertaking will help further my progress as a writer, taking instruction from renowed poet Camille Dungy, an American Book Award winner. 

Your contribution is greatly appreciated!

 

- Mega

story:
IN THE MEDIA:

My Guest Blog at ChickLitPlus.com talking about the inspiration and process for Coulda, Woulda, Shoulda.

My Guest Blog at DateDaily.com: "Great Dating Advice: Coulda, Woulda, Shoulda Author Shares Her Best Tips."

Chicklitplus.com hosts Coulda, Woulda, Shoulda First Look.

DateDaily.com hosts first look of Coulda, Woulda, Shoulda here. 

REFERRAL PRIZE: Be sure to log into indiegogo before sharing the page if you want a chance at winning the prize for most referrals to the campaign. The prize is the $1,000 perk and a 3 month online fitness and nutrition program from Nathane Jackson Fitness.

Once upon a time…

Once upon a time, there was a series of books that took young readers on exciting adventures. What made these books truly special was the fact they let readers make choices about how their stories would unfold. And if their tales ended in sadness or tragedy, the readers could go back to any point in the story and do things differently. 

Decades later, in another land, there was a young woman who often found herself distraught when it came to matters of the heart. And like many before her, she turned to the written word for help in avoiding heartbreak. 

She soon found herself overwhelmed with the sundry of books and articles promising magical elixirs to cure her romantic ailments. There were so many rules. So many do’s. So many don’ts. So many contradictory and outdated opinions. How was she to keep everything straight, let alone apply it to her own, unique life?

And then one day, fate waved its magic wand and inspired the young woman to combine her favourite childhood stories with the advice books of her adulthood. The result was enchanting. 

The reader could make her own decisions about her romantic future.  If she should make mistakes, she would start over again. It would offer true-to-life dating dilemmas. It would represent the varied wants and desires of the modern woman.  There would be pop culture references, sex, and shenanigans. Hilarity would ensue.

And Coulda, Woulda, Shoulda was born.

Present day…

As you may have gleaned from the fairytale above, I am that young woman from the far off land (of Toronto, Canada).

I, Tara Reed, hereby announce to the world that I have read my share of dating advice books. I’m betting you have, too. At least one. Come on. You’ve got a copy of He’s Just Not That Into You. Admit it. Just between us girls? I knew it!

So you know as well as I do that some dating advice sends our love soaring to new altitudes, while some of it leaves us searching for the relationship black box, desperate to know where it all went wrong. Why is that? It’s because we’re all different. Male or female, each of us is the sum total our unique experiences, which dictate our choices in all areas of our lives.

Even if we don’t actively look to books, magazines, friends, or tarot cards for advice, it finds us. Social circles, officemates, and know-it-all relatives desperate for us to have babies, frequently have something to say.  We even get it subliminally through music, TV and movies. (Yeah, yeah. Romantic comedies are the root of all evil and Rachel McAdams is the incredibly beautiful devil.  We get it.) All of this contributes to the time-honoured tradition known as “playing games.”

We all do it. For every girl wondering why a guy hasn’t called her after a great date, there’s a guy discouraging his buddy from calling a girl so he can keep the upper hand.

That's never going to change.  Ever. Of course, that doesn’t mean we have to take dating too seriously or transport ourselves to the 1950s in search of some mysterious quality supposed to help us catch and keep a man. We don’t even have to want to keep a man. Hear us roar!

You should seek out all the advice your heart desires, but it’s important to heed only the advice that sounds right for you, and to make choices that are going to make you happy - whatever happy looks like to you. See a theme? Whether you want to marry (or not), have kids (or not), juggle two guys at a time (or at once), it should be fun, right?

So where to start? Hmm. Oh! Hey! I know. You could help me fund the production of my awesome novel, Coulda, Woulda, Shoulda, which I'm hoping to publish by September of this year.

Tell me more!

Whether you think you're a dating disaster or a certified courtship champion, Coulda, Woulda Shoulda offers you a fun platform to test your technique throughout hundreds of true-to-life dating scenarios and over 60 different endings. Stepping into the role of Hannah, you’ll have to carefully balance your heart and your head to maneuver your relationship from frisky Friday nights to plans for a June wedding. If you want to get married, that is.   

It doesn’t matter if you’ve read all the books, or none of them.  Why?  Because while it was inspired by countless books like The Rules and He’s Just Not That Into You, this is not an advice book.  It doesn’t matter if you’re an old-fashioned gal or a true-feminista, this novel has something for you! You’ll also have great friends, Rachel and Valerie, who put the antics in romantics, and are always ready to help you get out of, and into, guy trouble.

How will you handle your first fight? What do you do about his way-too-close-and-attractive-for-your-liking gal pal? What do you say when he suggests the dreaded threesome? What’s a girl to do about that cute, charming guy she keeps running into who won’t take no for an answer? How about when you’re faced with unexpected pregnancies, suspicious behaviour, those three biggest of little words, and the minefield that is the topic of marriage? I don’t know what you’ll do, but I do know that you’ll always have a choice, and a chance to start over if you fall flat on your face. And you don’t even have to put on make up to do it.

Okay. Neat-O idea, Tara, but why should you write it?

What qualifies me to write this book? Other than the fact I did? I’m just kinda like you!  I’m a hapless romantic. I’ve been guilty of premature infatuation.  I’ve juggled candlelit dinners and clandestine meetings. I’m really more of a dating inexpert - who just happens to be a pretty good writer. I also spent a ludicrous amount of time reading all the dating and relationship books and articles I could get my hands on to make the content in the book as comprehensive as possible.

I’m no longer a single gal, but my guy (who you might recognize from such films as the video for this campaign) appears on the covers of 75 Harlequin romance novels, so that’s kind of like a rom-com, right?   

Go on…

I spent 10 years working in public relations, writing for and promoting everything from video games to shoes to dolls - including one particularly well-known plastic blonde!  Unfortunately, I was forced to stop working five years ago when I was diagnosed with fibromyalgia.  So in between doctor’s appointments, side effects and treatments, I chipped away at this book a little bit a time to keep myself sane. It soon took on a life of its own, and hopefully will provide me with the means to support myself in the future.

I’ve also published many columns on consumer technology in SNAP, a Toronto-based newspaper, and studied improvisation with The Second City here in Toronto. I also not-so-secretly wish I were a Muppet, I’m a Gemini, and I like short walks on the beach.

Why self-publish?

The completion of the original manuscript coincided with the lowest point of the recent financial crisis. After querying a group of agents, I received wonderful responses to the story and the fresh concept. Unfortunately, and understandably, the economy and unpredictable fiction market made taking on debut authors with niche projects challenging for agents. However, a handful of them encouraged me to leverage my PR expertise and publish it myself, and I am so grateful to them. 

And if I help you raise all that money?

First, I suspect you would be handsomely rewarded by Karma - she loves love and when people get to fulfill their dreams (but no pressure!). Mostly, you’d be helping me launch this book with the full integrity of a traditionally published novel.   

That means professional editing, formatting, and cover design, and a kick-ass, interactive website. Let me emphasize the word “professional” here. I’ve got a great team of talented colleagues who are ready to put in the work (as soon as I can pay them).

What’s more? Aside of from the book in multiple formats, you could score some sweet extras, like official temporary tattoos, a place in the book's acknowledgements or have a character named after you. You can find a full list of perks to the right of the screen.

I'm working with financial expert, Shannon Lee Simmons to make sure funds are distributed properly.

And if you don’t meet your goal?

Well, let's hope that doesn't happen. If we don't make it, the money will be used on the highest priority initiatives - editing, formatting, cover design and a website - in that order - as well as getting the book to you. I'll do everything in my power to make sure you get a professional product. That's priority one! 

What if you exceed your goal?

From your fingertips to God's ears! The more money we raise, the more we can do! We'll do a book trailer, a series of fun promotional videos and illustrations to bring the book to life. I've prepared a fun package of bonus incentives that will enhance the Coulda, Woulda, Shoulda experience, including a retro (but oh, so grown up) cootie-catcher to give you insight into your love life, a specialty bookmark that has as many fingers as you do, a glossy story map to let you trace your steps along the way, and more!

And if things get insane up in here, Coulda, Woulda, Shoulda could become a full-colour, interactive iBook. It could be an app. It could be a full-fledged video game!

 

You just met me, and this is crazy…

Okay, for a first meeting this is a lot of information. But “they” say you know you’re interested in someone within a few minutes of meeting them, so….


If you’re feeling a spark, go to paragraph i.

If you’re just not feeling it, go to paragraph ii.

i) Wow. Okay. I’m totally blushing.  While I compose myself, check out those perks we talked about and decide just how involved with me you want to get.

ii) That’s a shame, but I get it. You can’t force a connection. But maybe you have some awesome friends you think I’d click with?  I’d love it if you’d share this page with them using Indiegogo's share tools. I bet they’d love you for it, too!

You can learn more about the book and stay up to date at my blog, CouldaWouldaShouldaBook.com. You can also watch me on YouTube, join Coulda, Woulda, Shoulda’s official Facebook page, or follow me on Twitter @wordsmithwesson. If you want to get to know Hannah, Rachel and Valerie a little better, check them out on Pinterest!

Many thanks,

Tara Reed

(AKA: Wordsmith & Wesson)

Special thanks to Sally Jacquart and Russ Visch for letting Istvan Dugalin direct this video in their basement!

Also, credit to www.freestock.ca for use of the image on the book in the campaign video.

story:
The Deal

 

Coming of Mage started as an idea for an entry in a short story contest.  Quickly it outgrew the 'short story' realm and grew into a novella, which, in turn, was picked up by some very wise folks over at North Star Press.  Doubling in size (and richness), Mage has become a full-blown novel.  My full-blown novel.  And, if you've ever spent more than a 3 minutes talking to me, you probably know how bad I've wanted this.  This is a dream 29 years in the making.

 

*Read a great interview about it here.

 

The Catch

 

As part of the "book buy" portion of my contract, I'm required to purchase so many copies of my own novel out of my own pocket.  The amount I purchase allows the publisher to gauge how serious I am about getting my novel out there.

 

I agreed to buy 100 copies. Pretty serious, right?

 

Even at a fair rate, this purchase is more than I have under my mattress. As many of you know, when not writing, I moonlight as a server at a restaurant attached to a ski resort. And unfortunately this “book buy” comes smack dab in the middle of the off-season.

 

Yeah. Ouch.

 

The Fix

 

I've finished the novel. Mage is happening as we speak. Funding for all the early morning coffee, late night energy drinks, laptops, pens, pencils, sweat, and tears that goes into the writing process is not what I'm asking for.  Don't worry.

 

But I do need a little help from my friends.

 

A hundred copies sold in stores would fetch $1300. That's what I'm asking for here. Good ol' market value. That'll cover my dues with North Star Press, transport and shipping, and put a dent in some of the press stuff I have planned: book signings, readings, tours, etc.

 

One of the bigger events on the docket is attending a Creative Writing Workshop at my alma mater, SCSU. Not only will I get to sharpen my writing skills, but I'll get to network with big-time authors—scoring some pointers on how do this professionally. I'm also lining up interviews with the campus newspaper—as well as other publications—so I can spread the word about my book around campus.

 

And do some research for the sequel at the same time! Hint hint!)

 

The Payoff

Specifics aside, this is a good deal for you too. A lot of you have been asking When can I get a copy? Can I pre-order one? Can I get a signed copy?

Is it on Goodreads?

How 'bout right here? Just pick a donation level that works for you and BAM! You'll get the book and I'll fulfill my contract! Swish! PLUS with these “perks” I've put together, you'll get a lot more than just the book—check'em out! This is one of those rare opportunities from which we can both benefit.

 

And even though it might seem like you're just buying a copy from me, you're truly coming to my rescue. You're making my dream happen. You're helping me fulfill my contract. And when I say contract, I also mean destiny.

 

Thank you. So much.

 

—Mikel

And do some research for the sequel at the same time! Hint hint!)
 
The Payoff
Specifics aside, this is a good deal for you too. A lot of you have been asking When can I get a copy? Can I pre-order one? Can I get a signed copy?
Is it on Goodreads?
How 'bout right here? Just pick a donation level that works for you and BAM! You'll get the book and I'll fulfill my contract! Swish! PLUS with these “perks” I've put together, you'll get a lot more than just the book—check'em out! This is one of those rare opportunities from which we can both benefit. 
 
And even though it might seem like you're just buying a copy from me, you're truly coming to my rescue. You're making my dream happen. You're helping me fulfill my contract. And when I say contract, I also mean destiny. 
 
Thank you. So much. 
 
—Mikel

story:
Writer and former sex worker needs only her own iron will and a little help from her friends...

I'm an essayist, poet, and newly retired sex worker.
For months sex work funded my writing, but I retired to make way for new things in my life and am in need of a new laptop to keep going with my dream of making writing a sustainable gig. 
My beloved laptop died bak in March taking hours of uninterupted writing time with it. Since then I've been working on a faulty, unreliable netbook (which crashed while I was writing this) and sometimes on my kindle (which I'm writing on now). Neither is perfect, both impede my writing, and their teeny tiny keyboards cause me physical pain when I write for too long. 
I am working on two fiction projects, a mountain of poetry, and have several essays to pitch to editors, but my lack of a good laptop is preveting the progress of all of these efforts at a critical juncture in my life. 
I'm raising $500 for:
1) a new reliable laptop
2) a copy of Microsoft Office
3) virus protection to keep my new laptop humming

Now for the Perks!

Anyone who donates a minimum of $10 gets a super secret, final edition of my autobiographical Tiny Letter Silvertown. It's scandalous, seering, impactful. Or, you can choose an ebook or physical copy of a chapbook of my poetry. 

NEW PERK: A donation of $30 or more will give you the option of choosing between the last edition of my Tiny Letter, an ebook or physical copy of my poetry chapbook, OR  a love letter from me to you. Ask anyone, my emails are emotive and memorable. I would love to send you one in which I wax poetic on my feelings of lush gratitude for you. You can choose between an electronic version (email) or an actual physical love letter. Worldwide shipping. 


To say this would help me is like saying the Pacific Ocean contains a certain amount of beauty and power....

A new laptop is literally all I need to make a real go at my dream life. Your help would mean more than the world. It would mean the infinity stretching out past this universe and the next. Anne Rice said writing is the most egalitarian art form because the barriers to entry are so low. She's right about that. Help me remove this final barrier and you'll get to see a sex worker transition gracefully and beautifully. 

If you can't help financially send me good vibes, spread the word about the campaign, read my work, visualize good fortune coming my way, help another sex worker, or think about me in your dreams. XOXO

story:
My Name Is Lucian And It Has Been Three Years Since My Last Book

With your generosity and tireless enthusiasm, I was able to produce my illustrated edition of the Ars Goetia back in 2014, and by the grace of the gods I was able to publish my (200% gayer by net weight) Salome in 2015.  This left me creatively reeling, cut adrift from my own, uncensored impulses, and I took 2016 to recalibrate. 

By 2017, having permitted myself to luxuriate in illustrative magic, I had gone very wild indeed. I rejoiced in my newfound mental freedom, and spent the entire year working my claws to nubs to finally enact a piece of original work I have spent my entire life dreaming about: an exposition of the world inside my spirit, and the people that live there.

That brings me to this: An Ode To Divine & Dirt, an original grimoire, lovingly illustrated by me as a result of years of spiritual exploration and gnosis.  With 106 full colour illustrations of a veritable cavalcade of divine spirits and monstrous beings, An Ode reflects the inside of my heart without censorship.  I will introduce you to this world through its inhabitants, and the deities they worship.  My portraiture is uncompromising, and showcases people of a wide range appearances.  I cannot be bothered with the cis- and heteronormative portrayals of deities, and neither should you.  Let us explore other ways of illustrating the divine, and celebrating the monstrous.

I did not compromise on my artistic work in this book, and I did not want to quickly pay out for a run of paperbacks and then regret not seeing my work fully-fashioned as I imagined it, so that is why I need your help: to print (at first) 50 copies of An Ode to Divine & Dirt in glorious luxury hardback.

Preview the content HERE!

Making Gorgeous Books Is Expensive

I cannot produce this book without your help.

  • A run of 50 hardback books will set me back a princely £1,352, and you can pre-order your copy RIGHT here.  The specifications I have for the books are: white library cloth binding, gold foiling on the cover, antique gold headbands and gorgeous heavyweight natural uncoated recycled paper, so that the printed ink "sinks" into the page.  They will all be turned out by my favourite independent printer in the UK with whom I have worked numerous times before and so can vouch for their craftsmanship and the quality of their work.
  • I know not everyone can afford to splurge on a gorgeous book.  As such, I am also funding a run of 50 paperbacks, also pre-orderable through this campaign.  Also beautifully designed and printed in the UK, the paperbacks will feature a velvety matte cover, custom cover inners and that same sexy uncoated off-white recycled paper.  These will cost me a much more digestable £517.

This is what you can order through this tasty crowdfunder:

  • Firstly, you can literally pre-order your very own copy of An Ode to Divine and Dirt right here, right now, and get it before anyone else, shipped directly into your eager hands by a little man in a car (the postal service).  All books ordered through this campaign will come furnished with a limited bookplate, available only to funders of the campaign, and of course, signed and scribbled in by my very own paws.  What more could you want?
  • Handmade A4 prints on the tastiest paper I could source of never-before-seen uncut illustrations as they were when I drew them, before eventually being edited into book-ready form.  There is a choice of four!  Four!  Wow.  That's one for every mouth you'll ever grow in your life.
  • Stickers!  You like the cover glyph, huh?  Do you wish one side of it was gummier than the other, yeah?  You want to put one gummy side onto a surface and/or thing and for it to stay there?  Well, you can have that dream realised with full adhesive function, ready to adorn your laptop or phone or face or dog. (NOTE: sticker not suitable for animal adhesion)
  • Oh you wanted some enamel pins?  We've got enamel pins! The first illustrative enamel pin I have ever made, and you get to order them first.  The cover glyph features, colours inverted, in Goth Standard black and silver hard enamel.  I wouldn't produce anything I personally wouldn't wear, and I'm a big fan of enamel pins.  These are sweet as and I can't wait to get my hands on them!

So, I want to raise £2200 in the first instance to cover the perks, the fees and, of course, fund the books properly.  This is basically a riskless funder - the book is already completed (hell, I've even already registered the ISBN pending publication on the 1st of October) and even the enamel pins are already ordered!  Any surplus funds go directly into making yet more books.  The better funded this project gets, the more people get to own a copy of a unique piece of magic, and the longer I live.  It's a win-win.

"But Lucian, I Don't Understand Magic Or Art And Don't Get Why I Should Care"

You should care because art makes us who we are.  I'm not going to tell you that my work is going to make a sizeable social difference, teach you how to be a better person, or even pretend it will be very popular.  I merrily punch windows into weird places, filled with monsters, danger and nightmarish things, and I wouldn't for a moment pretend that I have Cool Mass-Market Appeal.  I'm weird, and so is this.  You knew that.  But what I can guarantee is this:

  • Good luck finding an illustrated grimoire like this one.  Is anyone else bored of physical disability, transness, and body modification being shorthand for "monstrosity"?  Yeah, me too.  In my work, variant bodies live peacefully alongside the actually non-human and actually monstrous, because they're normal.  My people and their appearances are real.  They get to enjoy their own sensuality and beauty, unfetishised and as decorated as the gods.  I wanted to create a magical art book that people like me, an extensively modified, scarred and unusually-gendered trans person, could enjoy without feeling alienated.  And I have.
  • I have created two gorgeous art books before this, and I see An Ode as being a continuation of my (bafflingly popular) 2016 magical landscape and psychogeography project Where Am I, If Not Here?  This is part of the Lucian Canon, sure, but I see it as my personal graduation into a space where I can share purely original content with you.  This crowd funder will have repercussions next year, for example.  This does not stop here.

Every Day, I Take Out My Own Brain And Beat It With A Tube

I have worked my fingers to the bone to create this book.  It is significantly larger than the Ars Goetia, and Salome, as well as not having the luxury of following pre-existing guides of a source text.  I have overcome all the risks already.  But for the sake of transparency, here's what could go wrong:

  • The enamel pins explode in transit and we never get them.
  • My six backup locations all simultaneously melt and I lose my work (this includes the whole of Microsoft OneDrive)
  • I have no plan for overcoming these theoretical obstacles because they're absurd.

If we don't complete the £2200 funding, then I can put in a bit from my accounts that I've earned from doing cons twice a year, every year, since 2011, but basically it means fewer books.  This is happening.  But it's mostly happening because of your generosity and belief in my work.

"O Lucian I Have No Money And Must Scream"

As long as you're screaming on the internet to tell people who do have money to come and help out, then I'm cool with that.

  • Indiegogo has share tools!  Why not use those to share this campaign with your richer mates?  I believe in you!  You can do it!

I love you.  I want you to have this.  Let's get some.

story:
What we need to check-up on

Mayor Brian Bowman has now been in office since November. Winnipeg has made national headlines on racial controversies, government transparency and water quality.

The new Mayor has been locked in a dispute with local business and agency leaders over a downtown property development. A new City Council is getting ready to draft a controversial new budget.

Whose side is the public on? At this critical time, we think knowing where voters stand on these key issues will help to inform this debate.

How we are going to check-up on Winnipeg

Help us commission a city wide poll asking residents to rate their approval of Mayor Bowman's first few months in office, their approval of CentreVenture and their views on city land sales. 

What we need from you

Help us raise $2,500 to purchase a poll, buy a custom URL (see www.winnipegcheckup.ca), produce a presentation of the results, release the presentation to the media and cover any processing fees. 

This poll will be a five question, Winnipeg wide survey, conducted by a professional firm accredited by the Market Research and Intelligence Association, using IVR technology. Two of these questions will be used to confirm respondents demographics, to assist the pollster in weighting the results and obtaining a representative sample.


If sufficient funds are not raised, we will adjust the number of questions, make up the difference or provied refunds.

story:
Saving the Guinea Hogs: The Recovery of an American Homestead Breed

I am a former elementary teacher and former sustainable farmer with a passion for education, lifelong learning, and heritage breed animals. This is my fourth Indiegogo campaign focused on awareness and preservation of heritage breeds.

I discovered the Guinea Hog breed in 2013 and was immediately fascinated. There was so much unknown about the breed. I am curious with a strong desire to learn, so I decided to write the first book about Guinea Hogs.

Six years later I have completed the manuscript for my e-book. It will be released in mid-March. However, I need to hire talent to design the print books' interior and to produce a professional index. I will have both softcover and hardcover print editions. Adding a professional index and layout require additional expense. I would rather not incur additional credit card debt for this phase of my project. However, you can help by pre-ordering books during this fundraiser. Saving the Guinea Hogs will be a game-changer for breeders of the hogs. It has the chance to positively impact the breed for many years to come. You will want to be among the first readers to own a copy!

Will you join me?

What We Need

  • Professional Interior Book Design is $2 per page for 250 pages, estimated $500
  • Professional Indexing for easy Information Access is $3.50 per indexable page, estimated 225 pages, or $785
  • My goal of $850 is much lower than my needs, so I hope to exceed it!
  • Update April 7, 2019 - Goal is exceeded! All books ordered in March, April and May have been shipped as of May 20!

 What You Get

  • I have many choices for personalized perks at a wide variety of price points. You can pre-order either hardcover, softcover, or both print editions and get them as soon as they are printed!
  • If you want to pre-order an autographed copy of my print books, this is a great time to be among the first readers and to request a personalized, signed copy.
  • Select perks are discounted 13-46%. I have a wide variety of perks to choose from, to suit most budgets.

Risks

  •  

The Impact

  • Writing this book was a labor of love for the Guinea Hogs, and those who breed them.
  • My past campaigns made a difference in raising awareness about Guinea Hogs and other heritage breeds. They were well received, and everyone received their perks.
  • Knowledge is power. The information I am providing for breeders cannot be found anywhere else. I believe that sharing this book and my website to the world that people will make more informed decisions that will prevent Guinea Hogs from extinction in the twenty-second century.

Risks and Challenges

  • My challenge is to hire talent, proofread my manuscript, and complete all the tasks needed to get the book published.
  • I have a good support system and a plan to get each task implemented in a timely manner.
  • All risks are mine. Without assistance, I will put costs on a charge card and go a bit further in debt. With your help, the debt will be minimized. I've been one hundred percent reliable for three previous campaigns. I hope to deliver before the promised date.
  • All funds will be used for this project.
  • Regardless of the fundraiser outcome, backers will receive their perks as requested, on time.

Other Ways You Can Help

Everyone may not want to pre-order a book or be able to make a donation. However, there are other ways you can help:

  • Tell your friends about the campaign
  • Use Indiegogo's share tools to post on social media such as twitter, facebook, and Instagram

Thank you for your help and for sharing!

story:
The idea was simple.

People were getting angrier and angrier at people going on spring break or flouting restrictions so I thought it would be funny to treat them like children and adopt the "Stay The Fuck Home" sentiment to illustrate a book I hoped I'd be able to turn into a viral video and a memento of this crazy thing we're all going through.

The exact same DAY I sent the files to the printer and paid for my first copies my brother sent me Samuel L Jackson's wonderful version. But you know what, I'd spent weeks making an actual, real book AND during the last few weeks I've been looking at how to help in my local community which has the oldest population in the country and is likely to be one of the hardest hit.  

One organisation really jumped out - the Ballina Meals on Wheels organization as by delivering food to elderly and otherwise at risk people they would be helping break the social chains that help the virus spread. When I talked to them they were already well ahead with planning on additional services such as more communication over the phone with this isolated group of people now they can't chat in person, grocery shopping, craft supplies and activities on top of higher safety measures so I knew straight away that some proceeds of the book should go to help them.

I've decided that after a one dollar admin fee per sale, all proceeds will go to them.

The idea that I might spread some humour at this time and help raise a bit of money for a local charity helped me focus and move forward through the uncertainty around us. So fuck it, we'll do it live!

 

The perks

Well, are very simple. A digital eBook that will be available during the first week of the campaign and a print version that will be printed if the campaign reaches it's goal. If you purchase a print version you will get the digital version at no extra cost.

If the campaign doesn't reach it's goal to allow for printing then and physical book perks will be refunded but eBook perks will remain active.

I have the samples I am ready to click the Print button if the goals are met!

Some uncertainties

The biggest risk to this campaign is the ongoing COVID-19 situation. I have been speaking to the printer for the last week and they are confident it should take about 10-12 weeks to print and ship allowing for some delay time due to the virus. I will be using a fulfillment provider to ship the books once they're printed on the advice that even though the cost is greater it ensures a professional delivery service by a company with experience ensuring people get their orders.

So although there is some slack, in case things got worse it may add some time.

Another is the exchange rate. I can only run the campaign in Australian dollarydoos which have TANKED hard. I've worked out there is about a conservative $4 profit per physical book sold. It's possible the AUD could fall further and leave no profit at all but it's already at historical lows and the Australian government is supporting the economy very well.

 

So Please

Even if you can't contribute to this campaign, please share it, or even better - share a video of you reading the book! Also.. If you know anyone in the public eye that might read it, ask them! Samuel L, I'm looking at you!
story_txt:
The idea was simple.
People were getting angrier and angrier at people going on spring break or flouting restrictions so I thought it would be funny to treat them like children and adopt the "Stay The Fuck Home" sentiment to illustrate a book I hoped I'd be able to turn into a viral video and a memento of this crazy thing we're all going through.
The exact same DAY I sent the files to the printer and paid for my first copies my brother sent me Samuel L Jackson's wonderful version. But you know what, I'd spent weeks making an actual, real book AND during the last few weeks I've been looking at how to help in my local community which has the oldest population in the country and is likely to be one of the hardest hit.  
One organisation really jumped out - the Ballina Meals on Wheels organization as by delivering food to elderly and otherwise at risk people they would be helping break the social chains that help the virus spread. When I talked to them they were already well ahead with planning on additional services such as more communication over the phone with this isolated group of people now they can't chat in person, grocery shopping, craft supplies and activities on top of higher safety measures so I knew straight away that some proceeds of the book should go to help them.
I've decided that after a one dollar admin fee per sale, all proceeds will go to them.
The idea that I might spread some humour at this time and help raise a bit of money for a local charity helped me focus and move forward through the uncertainty around us. So fuck it, we'll do it live!
 

The perks
Well, are very simple. A digital eBook that will be available during the first week of the campaign and a print version that will be printed if the campaign reaches it's goal. If you purchase a print version you will get the digital version at no extra cost.
If the campaign doesn't reach it's goal to allow for printing then and physical book perks will be refunded but eBook perks will remain active.

I have the samples I am ready to click the Print button if the goals are met!
Some uncertainties

The biggest risk to this campaign is the ongoing COVID-19 situation. I have been speaking to the printer for the last week and they are confident it should take about 10-12 weeks to print and ship allowing for some delay time due to the virus. I will be using a fulfillment provider to ship the books once they're printed on the advice that even though the cost is greater it ensures a professional delivery service by a company with experience ensuring people get their orders.
So although there is some slack, in case things got worse it may add some time.
Another is the exchange rate. I can only run the campaign in Australian dollarydoos which have TANKED hard. I've worked out there is about a conservative $4 profit per physical book sold. It's possible the AUD could fall further and leave no profit at all but it's already at historical lows and the Australian government is supporting the economy very well.
 
So Please
Even if you can't contribute to this campaign, please share it, or even better - share a video of you reading the book! Also.. If you know anyone in the public eye that might read it, ask them! Samuel L, I'm looking at you!

story:
So what's this all about?

Hi, my name is Jamie Arpin-Ricci, an author, writer and inner city Mennonite pastor.  For the last 20 years I've served full-time in ministry with Youth With A Mission (YWAM) Canada.  While I have largely served in Winnipeg, my work has also taking me to places like Haiti, Venezuela, New Zealand and beyond.  In that time, I've had some space to practice my passion- writing- but not nearly enough.  I always knew I would need to take some time off to give it the attention it deserved (and for me, the break I needed).

Given the nature of our ministry, I was not surprised to discover, recently, that I have been suffering from Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD).  While the initial trauma is likely witnessing a friend take his own life, it was triggered & diagnosed recently with the sudden death of another friend in our community.  This underscores my need to take time away from the full spectrum of my roles- pastor of our church; co-director of our mission; and director of our housing initiative.  So the time is now!

By preparing now we will be ready for the sabbatical to begin in June 2015, giving me time to "get all my affairs in order" and, hopefully, raise some funds to make it possible.  My plan is to take from June 2015 to January 2016 to dedicate myself to my writing, with several book projects planned.  It will also be a time of much needed study, personal/professional development and hopefully some time to travel.  In fact, one of my stretch goals includes a pilgrimage I've always dreamed of doing. (More on that later!)

This is where I need you.  For the past 20 years, I have relied on the support of donors to pay my salary, as well as most of my work expenses.  Given the hours my role(s) demand, that support has never come close to minimum wage.  However, we've never gone without and we've always had people like you standing shoulder to shoulder with us.  I believe that will continue here.

What I Need & What You Get

In order to cover the extra costs that this writing sabbatical will incur, I want to raise a minimum of $9000, which is around $1000 per month.  This will cover the cost of research materials, writing space, basic travel and conferences/courses.  It will also make it possible for my wife to continue in her leadership role in our work while I step away to focus on writing.  Perhaps most important, however, is for some of those funds to go towards counseling and treatment for my PTSD.

What about those perks?  Well, here they are:

  • A $10 investment will get a personal thank you online on my website & social media accounts.
  • At $20, you get the online acknowledgment of the previous perk, plus a personal (and personalized) video thank you on my Youtube channel.
  • With a $50 investment, you will get all the above, plus an autographed copy of my book "The Cost of Community: Jesus, St. Francis & Life in the Kingdom". (Shipping outside Canada & US will have addition cost).
  • At $100 you get all of the above, plus an autographed copy of my forthcoming book with Paraclete Press, tentatively titled "The Beauty of Vulnerability: Radical Obedience, Missional Living, and St. Patrick of Ireland". (Shipping outside Canada & US will have addition cost).
  • With a $500 investment, you get all previous perks, plus I will name you in the acknowledgments of any books published as a result of the sabbatical.
  • At $1000 you get all previous perks, plus I'll do a Skype workshop with a group of your choice on any topic I've written about for a least an hour.  (Shipping outside Canada & US will have addition cost).
  • For $10,000, you will get all the perks from $500, plus, we will fly you into Winnipeg for a Weekend with Little Flowers Community.  Meet our people, learn about our ministry- room & board in our community house. (North America Only)
  • Why not dream big?  Should anyone be so generous as to give $25,000, they will get everything in the $500 perk, plus I will fly to your city for two days & give a workshop to a group of your choice.

By using the "flexible funding" option, even if I don't reach my goal, I will receive all pledges made by the end of the campaign regardless.  However, I have every confidence that we will reach and surpass these goals!

The Impact

When I began this work 20 years ago, I did so knowing that I would have to put writing aside for a season.  After a decade, I was able to write more often, but even then only as a tertiary focus.  However, this campaign will allow me to maximize this rare and exciting opportunity and focus fully on the discipline for several months.

My last two books took many months to write, but when I look at how much time it actually took, counting only the time I spent on them, it was a surprisingly small amount.  In other words, given the time and means to focus, I know I can produce more in that 9 months than I've been able to in the last 10 years.  With your help.

    Risks & Challenges

    As a published author, I know what is involved in making the most of this opportunity.  The risks for supporting me in this are honestly quite low.  For me, the stakes are too high to not take advantage of this rare gift of time & resources.

    The biggest challenges, beyond raising the funds to make it possible, is doing this in such a way that makes the most of the time without leaving my community and my family in the lurch.  That is why I am taking nearly a year to plan and prepare alongside everyone involved.  In truth, the more funds I raise, the easier it will be for me to do this in ways that won't negatively impact others.  Both my community and my family believe I should do this, which is important to me.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    I know that not everyone has the means to support a campaign like this with money.  So here are other ways you can help:

    • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
    • If you have "air miles" you can donate or a connection with an airline, those are much needed.
    • Know of creative ways to make this campaign a success?  Advice & input is very welcome.
    • If you are local to us, volunteer in our ministry to help fill in the gaps my travel might leave in the community.
    • Pray for us!

    With all that said, let's do this.  Thanks & peace!

story:
The Skinny

Hoods, Hot Rods, And Hellcats is an anthology of original crime fiction set in Postwar America, the era that gave birth to our consumer driven culture. For the emergent superpower, a good consumer was a patriot. Dollars bought "happiness" and undermined the diabolical Red menace. Even more than that, a good consumer was a homogenized suburbanite—making Draper's job cake.

However, for the men and women changed by the war, accepting the lockstep didn’t come easy—if at all. If you throw in the "teen-ager" and a bunch of hillbillies singing rock'n'roll, you've got trouble...

"...the world of Hoods, Hot Rods, and Hellcats is a dirty cocktail of fact, fable, fears, and fantasies. The 1950s are recreated one more time but here it's with a savage, razor-honed edge you'll never find in Grease, Happy Days, or American Graffitti." —From the Introduction

 

 

There's murder and robbery, shootouts and knife fights, car chases and drag races, good girls and bad girls, and a lot of troubled men. Hoods opens with a brilliant introduction from counterculture icon Mick Farren, then busts you in the mush with eight lengthy tales from Eric Beetner, Chad Eagleton, Matthew Funk, Christopher Grant, Heath Lowrance, David James Keaton, Nik Korpon, and Thomas Pluck.

A young woman constructs her murderous identity from her father's stash of lurid paperbacks.

A hot rod mechanic's relationship with his troubled wife redlines when his brother returns home from the War.

Passing through a small town, a former Marine finds his girl and a whole lot of trouble.

A pair of brothers on a robbery spree cut a bloody swath through the Southwest until they encounter a little girl with a stuffed rabbit.

A young boy discovers just how far he'll go for rock 'n' roll.

A lonely girl and an emotionally scarred vet face a beachside showdown with a violent motorcycle gang.

A teenager follows the girl of his dreams into a high-octane nightmare.

Two generations of men named Jake obsess over a girl named Cherry.

What's The Big Deal?

Hoods, Hot Rods, And Hellcats is written and edited. The e-book editions are gorgeously formatted thanks to Jaye Manus' skills. And Brian Roe of RSquared Studios is completing the final formatting on the print edition now. Each edition offers its own visual experience.

So then you’re wondering, "Where do I come in?"

I'll clue you. I know it's far out, but brace for it....okay, are you ready? Here it is—

I think people deserve to actually get paid for their work.

Sounds kookie, I know, but that's where you come in. Your money will cover the cost of the donation level gifts and ensure that the contributors earn something more than a promise and a writing credit.

Patched In

No bread but still want patched in with the cool kids? Give us a share, a like, a tweet, or maybe even a blog post.

story:
Brick Desperately Needs Some New Equipment

Brick features a great many of the world’s best-loved writers, and has readers in every corner of the planet. Both up-to-date and deeply engaged with what has come before, the magazine prizes the personal voice and celebrates opinion, passion, revelation, and the occasional bad joke. Our goal is to participate, as a Canadian literary presence, in the widest and most galvanizing exploration of the arts possible.

But while our content is on the cutting edge, the equipment we work on struggles to keep up with the times. As you'll see from our picture, our publisher and managing editor currently works on an iMac G4—the model that was discontinued in 2004! Our office chairs are more than a little worse for wear, and our phone, well, we'll post a picture so you can see for yourself.

Here are some phrases you may hear as Nadia waits for a file to download onto her computer:

     "It's fine, really. It teaches me to practice patience."

     "I'll just go water the plants..."

Brickis truly a labour of love, and though there's a lot of labour, there's a lot of love. You can find out more about the magazine and read a sampling of our excellent content on our website. 

Please help us move our office into the present.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to purchase an up-to-date iMac for the office. This will allow us to work more efficiently as we put together our beloved magazine. This will cost $1,300.00 after taxes. If we raise the full $1,500.00 dollars, we plan to replace the hilariously rickety chair our publisher and managing editor spends her days in and get a new phone. 

We appreciate any and all contributions, and we will happily recognize all contributions of $10.00 or more with a special thank you in our upcoming issue, Brick 90. Those who give $25.00 will get a set of beautiful Brick postcards. For any contribution over $50.00, you can get your name on the Brick Wall, which appears at the end of every issue of Brick, and if you donate $75.00 or more, we'll give you a free two-year subscription to the magazine, too. For donations over $150.00, we'll throw in a signed copy of a book by one of our editors.

If we cannot meet our goal, the money we raise will go towards a refurbished computer (which will still, no doubt, be a vast improvement on the one we're currently using). We will continue to publish Brick as long as we possibly can, with whatever equipment we can get our hands on. Nonethless, your contribution will be an incredible help and transform the way we put the magazine together.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help. Please help us spread the word. Use the Indiegogo shares tools to tell your friends about our campaign.

story:
The Story

 

My Name is Robert Ryan, a writer who is locked in a ginger manâ€™s body. I seek your creative input and funding to feed my imagination, and help me to write two books this year. The first book, â€˜Commutinyâ€™, will be written with, and about, my local town in Ireland. The second book, 'Online Commutiny' will be a story written with you, the funders, joining in as writers and also becoming characters, depending on how much, or little, you want to be involved. (see perks on the right hand side) I hope that by offering you the chance to, not only, get your thoughts and words into my book, but giving you the opportunity to have your name in it, we can create something special together.

How the process will work:

The idea is to write the books in a similar way to Chain Novels, only with a modern day social media approach. However, it will be slightly different in that I will write the start and middle of the books myself, and work with you to create the rest of the story. For 'Commutiny' I will be looking for the people in my community to take part and to provide me with a sentence, paragraph or page of writing for the book, which I will prompt from them via email or social network. I will send the begining of the story and enough of the previous page to each person to enable them to follow on from, and subsequently, send their work back to me, in the time frame provided. The more obscure and interesting the contribution, the better the result will be. I will then add it to, and edit it into the story and bring it together as a book. It will work the same for 'Online Commutiny' except that it will be you, the generous funders, who I will be getting the material from.

 

 What the books are about:

'Commutiny': The citizens of a small town in the South of Ireland called Cobh (pronounced Cove) feel so aggrieved with the situation in the country, and the way it is being run, they decide as a community, that they want to be independent. As Cobh is only attached to the mainland by one bridge they take it upon themselves to burn the bridge, both literally and metaphorically to the fury of the government. Living free was their dream but will it slowly turn into a nightmare??

'Online Commutiny': An ironic story about a couple of friends who, with help from an online community, fight to take down social networks!! After a drunken night out where they observed a complete lack of communication in the bar, as everyone was so engrossed in their phones, they make a video asking the world to deactivate their social network profiles. As they believed the video was just a rant that would go un-noticed, they soon forget that they posted it online. That was, until a small group of followers steadily grew into a community and back the two in their campaign. Together, they start thinking that maybe they can, at least for a short time, change the world back to the way it was. Back to a time when their â€˜friendsâ€™ were real, and if those â€˜friendsâ€™ wrote on your wall, then they would be called vandals, not friends.

The Impact

I want this campaign to encourage people to chase their imagination and prove that no matter how daft or big your dreams, if you believe in yourself and are lucky enough to get the kicks in the right direction from people who believe in you, you can achieve anything. Whether that dream is writing a book, taking on your country as a little town or going against the world as a little group, just go for it.

What We Need & What You Get

The money I need will all go towards advertising and publishing these two books. If I do not reach my goal in this campaign I will continue fundraising in other ways until I hit my target. I hope that with the unique perks I am offering we will get to where we want to be and next year, we will all be happy. Just imagine telling a new friend that you wrote a page in the new book by Robert Ryan. They dont believe you? Go to your bookshelf and show them! Go to the website and proudly point out your name as a contributor...Take that, new friend, where is your page, huh????


Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends about this campaign. 'Like' me on Facebook. Tell your rich uncles, your writing circles/squares or just keep it to yourself, donate all the money and write it with me !!! Shout the message of this campaign out loud. Do not pass it on like a chinese whisper or next year you may have donated your money towards me,  'Wiping Two Boots !!' .. Even if you just read this and pass it on, thank you...

How the process will work: 

The idea is to write the books in a similar way to Chain Novels, only with a modern day social media approach. However, it will be slightly different in that I will write the start and middle of
the books myself, and work with you to create the rest of the story. For
'Commutiny' I will be looking for the people in my community to take part and to provide me with a sentence, paragraph or page of writing for the book, which I
will prompt from them via email or social network. I will send the begining of the story and
enough of the previous page to each person to enable them to follow on from,
and subsequently, send their work back to me, in the time frame provided. The more obscure and interesting
the contribution, the better the result will be. I will then add it to, and
edit it into the story and bring it together as a book. It will work the same
for 'Online Commutiny' except that it will be you, the generous funders, who I will
be getting the material from. 


 

 What the books are about: 



'Commutiny': The citizens of a small town in the South of Ireland called Cobh
(pronounced Cove) feel so aggrieved with the situation in the country, and the
way it is being run, they decide as a community, that they want to be
independent. As Cobh is only attached to the mainland by one bridge they take
it upon themselves to burn the bridge,
both literally and metaphorically to the fury of the government. Living free
was their dream but will it slowly turn into a nightmare??



'Online Commutiny': An ironic story about a
couple of friends who, with help from an online community, fight to take down social networks!! After a
drunken night out where they observed a complete lack of communication in the bar, as everyone was so engrossed in their phones, they make a video asking the
world to deactivate their social network profiles. As they believed the video
was just a rant that would go un-noticed, they soon forget that they posted it
online. That was, until a small group of followers steadily grew into a
community and back the two in their campaign. Together, they
start thinking that maybe they can, at least for a short time, change the world
back to the way it was. Back to a time when their â€˜friendsâ€™ were real, and if
those â€˜friendsâ€™ wrote on your wall, then they would be called vandals, not
friends.
The Impact


I
want this campaign to encourage people to chase their imagination and prove
that no matter how daft or big your dreams, if you believe in yourself and are
lucky enough to get the kicks in the right direction from people who believe in
you, you can achieve anything. Whether that dream is writing a book, taking on
your country as a little town or going against the world as a little group,
just go for it.



What We Need & What You Get
The money I need will all go towards advertising and publishing these two books. If I do not reach my goal in this campaign I will continue fundraising in other ways until I hit my target. I hope that with the unique perks I am offering we will get to where we want to be and next year, we will all be happy. Just imagine telling a new friend that you wrote a page in the new book by Robert Ryan. They dont believe you? Go to your bookshelf and show them! Go to the website and proudly point out your name as a contributor...Take that, new friend, where is your page, huh????


Other Ways You Can Help
Tell your friends about this campaign. 'Like' me on Facebook. Tell your rich uncles, your writing circles/squares or just keep it to yourself, donate all the money and write it with me !!! Shout the message of this campaign out loud. Do not pass it on like a chinese whisper or next year you may have donated your money towards me,  'Wiping Two Boots !!' .. Even if you just read this and pass it on, thank you...

story:
A morgue deep under a 150 year old Insane Asylum

A School that's out forever

A Moon rocket buried in the swamp plus more...


Forbidden

Ah, vacations. Holidays. Travel. Some people like the Tropics, others prefer snow and ski or maybe a theme park. Me, I travel to abandoned asylums, hospitals, schools and factories. I love theme parks, but only if they've been closed for a decade and overgrown with weeds. What's that you heard? There's a moon rocket buried in the swamp somewhere? When can we leave?!?


More to the point; I spend my free time wandering around in old, musty, desolate abandoned structures on the verge of collapse, camera in hand, to record the magnificent, unrelenting onslaught of decay.




Forgotten

Some of the places I have visited have a grim history. 150 year-old insane asylums where lobotomies were an everyday procedure. Epic, million-square-foot Victorian buildings that were bulldozed to make cookie cutter condominiums. A moon rocket that never made it out the swamp. I guess we'll ever be doomed to repeat our history if we don't acknowledge it.


Remembered

I have thousands of pictures taken inside abandoned buildings that are no longer standing. The record I have created of these places needs to be seen. I have a 126 page book filled with an account of my travels to these places. It's laid out like a vintage travelogue. The problem is, I can only fit about 100 images in the book. I want to produce a DVD with the unpublished images so you can see the full depth and scope of these historic, and sometimes grim, buildings. I also would like to publish a quality, coffee table hardback version. To do that I need to raise $5000.


Honored

You can help remember these places, their history and the almost endless parade of the unfortunate that passed through their doors by simply passing this project along to all your friends. There's tons of useful tools sprinkled around the video above to easily share it in every conceivable manner.


Involved


For your contribution, you can get a copy of the book, the DVD and a quality, professionally printed and signed photo from the book, In doing so, you not only get stuff, but you help remember these places that would otherwise be lost to march of "progress".




Important Information About Shipping and Delivery:


The book itself is complete and ready to print. I have a finished proof in hand. The DVD is still in development and is dependent upon pledges. Please be sure to pledge and share this project so that the DVD can be developed and shipped along with the book. Shipments will begin shortly after the project is complete.


If you live in the Continental United States, shipping is included in your pledge. If you live in Alaska, Hawaii or anywhere outside the Continental U.S., there will be an additional mailing charge. I wish I could just give the book away and ship it free but, unfortunately, that would end up costing me a great deal. If you wish to contribute, I will be eternally grateful but, please be advised, I must charge for international shipping. Before you pledge, please supply me you complete address and I will supply you with mailing costs, which will be added you your pledge.


There is no shipping or additional charge for the PDF version.

story:
The Project

Raised and educated in the heart of the Bible-belt, I didn’t look at certain groups of people as valid or respectable. Liberals, Jews, Muslims, Atheists, I was taught to convert them all. But there was one people group I looked down upon more than any other. For me the LGBT (lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender) community represented the worst of what sin had to offer, and I treated it and them with extreme prejudice. I was a bully, a bigot, and a modern-day Pharisee.

After an acquaintance came out of the closet, and was kicked out of her home and cut off from her family, something unexpected happened. For the first time in my spiritual life I began to question why I believed what I did about homosexuality. Were the warnings we always got about gays and lesbians based off of theological fact, or conservative, social stereotyping? And the voice inside of me judging my poor friend for coming out, was that “the Spirit” inside of me, or something else entirely?

I had to find out for myself.

I had to learn empathy because sympathy simply wouldn’t be enough to challenge my years of programming.

I needed to see how the label of gay would change how I was viewed by everyone around me, and if people would treat me like a second-class citizen for no other reason than that they believed I was gay.

And I needed to feel the isolation and repression of the closet… as much as I would be able.

In January 2009 I entered the closet a straight man and came out to my friends and family as a gay. I lived with the label for an entire year. After my life as I knew it had quickly unraveled into nothing, I began building a new one. I became a barista at a gay café. I played in a LGBT softball league. I protested in New York City with a group of gay activists that I had encountered years before while I studied Liberty University. And I even participated in a marriage equality event with the son on Jim and Tammy Faye, Jay Bakker. For a year I immersed myself, completely and utterly, in the small gay scene of Nashville, Tennessee, and experienced firsthand the agony of being isolated, repressed, and alone.

My book is the result of that year and it tells the story of the men and women that challenged, and ultimately changed my life’s path. It is a book about faith, and a book about doubt. But mostly it is a book about people, and how the men and women I’d always been taught to shun ended up saving my life.

Why an Indiegogo campaign?

The book releases in October 11th of this year, but before it does a lot of groundwork must be laid for it to have a real chance of making it in the tough, mainstream market. This work requires a quality PR firm to help get the word out. In addition, the final edits on the book must also be done by a quality editor. These two things are more than I am able to afford in the timeframe I we are looking at. In order to get this book out, we must raise approximately $8,000.

  • $5,500 to hire a publicist for six months
  • $1,500 to the editor for the final draft revisions
  • $1,000 for travel expenses to Washington D.C. to meet with the Publicist

*What happens if we raise money over and above the goal? All funds raised above the $8,000 will go towards additional PR services needed, and the equipment needed to develop talks and workshops for speaking engagements. This is the next step after hiring the publicist.

FAQ

  • This is not a book about being gay. As a straight man I am fundamentally unqualified to write that book. Instead this book is about what I could experience firsthand, and that is to feel for myself how the label of gay would affect both my external and internal life.
  • This book is not an exposé or a theological treatise. This book is the story about my personal experiences immersed in the gay scene of Nashville. And while I was befriended by a wide variety of individuals, I would never consider myself an expert in gay, bisexual, lesbian, or trans issues. The book is about my personal journey out of prejudice and the people who taught me along the way.
  • This book is not a Christian bashing or gay bashing book. While I am honest about the negative things I experienced during my year involving both, I learned that with any group of people there are positives and negatives.  

My Heart…

My mission is to share the hearts and stories of others, so that people might begin to see and treat each other as human instead of by the labels of our religion, politics, or orientation.  I feel honored to have met the people I did during this experiment, and while my means were unorthodox to say the least, walking for a year in the shoes of a gay man, irrevocably changed my life. My intentions are not to tell you what to believe, but rather to show you what I believed, who I was, and to introduce you to a beautiful cast of characters that answered many of my questions without even knowing it. 

Will you help me?

In a time where we are bombarded by stories of prejudice towards our fellow human, and when the American people are facing a national presidential election where equal rights will be playing a starring role, it is crucial that we re-examine our beliefs before casting our ballots. I believe this book will provide insight in a way that many others haven’t. It is a book of questions and experiences, and it is my prayer that you will walk with me through the story of my “abominable” year of living with the label of gay.  

The Perks

$1 Get your toes wet-

I understand you want to help, but the economy isn't the best. At the $1 level you can support the campaign and share it with your friends and family on Facebook and Twitter. Every dollar helps!

$25 Contributor Level-

You have my infinite gratitude for believing in me and this project enough to donate and I will add your name in the acknowledgements of the book.

$50 Essential Contributor Level-

Beyond having my infinite gratitude and your name in the acknowledgements, you will receive an autographed copy of the book before its release date. Consider this a pre-order on steroids!

$100 Partner Level-

Beyond having my infinite gratitude, your name in the acknowledgements and an autographed copy of the book before the release date, we will also give you a free download of the ebook for your Kindle, Nook, or Ipad.

$250 My Personal Hero Level-

Beyond having my infinite gratitude, an autographed copy of the book before the release date, the free download of the ebook for your Kindle, Nook, or Ipad, I would also like to thank personally via Skype, Phone, or over coffee.

$500 Benefactor Level-

Not only will you receive all of the other perks, I would like to speak in person or via Skype with your book club, or your church's small group. I can’t wait to meet you because without you this thing would not have been possible!

About the Author

Timothy Kurek is a Portland based author/speaker from Nashville, Tennessee, that loves life and loves people. His first book will be released in early October 2012 and is being published by Blue Head Publishing out of Seattle, Washington. You can contact him via Facebook at www.facebook.com/timothykurek or by email at timkurek@gmail.com.
