story:
Electronic Corpse: 

Poems From A Digital Salon

On September 7, 2012, inspired by the early 20th century French surrealist parlor game, Exquisite Corpse, M Ayodele Heath began hosting digital salons: group poetry writing exercises on his Facebook page (Syllabic Sundays, Metaphoric Mondays, Wildcard Wednesdays, and Free Verse Fridays). Each poem begins with a line from a published poem. 

To date, over 130 of these exercises have been created by poets of all experiences and geographies – from state poet laureates to the casual journaler; from South Carolina to South Korea to South Africa. We've selected the best.

These poems reflect the way in which social media has transformed the ability of artists to engage with each other regardless of physical constraints or externally driven outcomes. 

It’s a truly unique and layered book.  The anthology has two sections: collaborative poems and poems from the most frequent contributors.  The reason for publishing individual poems is our hope that by seeing the individual poem, the determined reader might excavate that poet's voice within the larger voice of the group. Almost like a soloist in a choral piece.  In addition, the e-book will have a clickable index of links to all the first lines so truly curious readers can compare and contrast.

The most  important part of this anthology is for archival reasons.  Unlike pre-digital artistic communities, there will be no cocktail napkins or scrawled notebook pages to reconstruct the ways in which artistic communities engage.  In regards to social media - entire conversations can be lost if one person deletes their account.  This book archives one digital salon over the period of a year.

Svaha Paradox Salon

The Svaha Paradox Salon, responds with agility to under-exposed artists whose voices are marginalized due to the way in which they are performed in the minds of the dominant culture. And together, we share the results with audiences. 

Svaha Paradox Salon resumes where the Pittsburgh based organization Sun Crumbs left off in 2003. Through involvement In various art communities, Christina Springer seeks out artists whose exceptional work requires support from non-traditional sources. Svaha Paradox Salon provides the encouragement necessary to complete these projects. 

Making It Happen

We need your help to take the book out of the computer and into the real world.  M. Ayodele Heath has done a magnificent job running the salon, selecting, logging and editing the poems. The manuscript is in the hands of the excellent design team.  Krista Franklin has created a stunning cover.  We are going to print. We've raised the necessary funds to have this book in your hands by April 5th.    

And we need your help to cross the finish line.  We know we have a great product. But, we need to communicate that to a wider audience.  That means throwing a fantastic launch party, taking the book to conferences, designing and implementing collaborative readings, promotions and advertising. 

Sample 

#87: The five cool stars above this town look down

The five cool stars above this town look down
from their hill. They'd rather sleep, they are lost
knitted into our dark cloth of sky, light bursting through at the seams.
No one seems to recall when they appeared, but
now they stay out of habit (or obligation) to sailors and drunks.

Once upon a time, they were a boy band
caught between harmonics and hormones,
their future fueled by delicate chemistry,
a powerful mixture of
testosterone, adrenaline, ambition, and heartache

Spiraling into control, like a galaxy—
red dwarfs and supernovas, all the same to this town—
the five stars still seek the heart, exploding liquid lava light through what is in the way.

In their stuttering light, a long blue moan
splinters into iridescent shivers
as a one-time fan tightens her shawl. Turns the other way.

Even More Ways To Help 

  • Get the buzz going.  Spread the word about "Electronic Corpse: Poems From A Digital Salon" by sharing our campaign on Facebook, Google +, and Twitter

Thank you so much!
story_txt:
Electronic Corpse: Poems From A Digital SalonOn September 7, 2012, inspired by the early 20th century French surrealist parlor game, Exquisite Corpse, M Ayodele Heath began hosting digital salons: group poetry writing exercises on his Facebook page (Syllabic Sundays, Metaphoric Mondays, Wildcard Wednesdays, and Free Verse Fridays). Each poem begins with a line from a published poem. To date, over 130 of these exercises have been created by poets of all experiences and geographies – from state poet laureates to the casual journaler; from South Carolina to South Korea to South Africa. We've selected the best.These poems reflect the way in which social media has transformed the ability of artists to engage with each other regardless of physical constraints or externally driven outcomes. 
It’s a truly unique and layered book.  The anthology has two sections: collaborative poems and poems from the most frequent contributors.  The reason for publishing individual poems is our hope that by seeing the individual poem, the determined reader might excavate that poet's voice within the larger voice of the group. Almost like a soloist in a choral piece.  In addition, the e-book will have a clickable index of links to all the first lines so truly curious readers can compare and contrast.
The most  important part of this anthology is for archival reasons.  Unlike pre-digital artistic communities, there will be no cocktail napkins or scrawled notebook pages to reconstruct the ways in which artistic communities engage.  In regards to social media - entire conversations can be lost if one person deletes their account.  This book archives one digital salon over the period of a year.Svaha Paradox SalonThe Svaha Paradox Salon, responds with agility to under-exposed artists whose voices are marginalized due to the way in which they are performed in the minds of the dominant culture. And together, we share the results with audiences. Svaha Paradox Salon resumes where the Pittsburgh based organization Sun Crumbs left off in 2003. Through involvement In various art communities, Christina Springer seeks out artists whose exceptional work requires support from non-traditional sources. Svaha Paradox Salon provides the encouragement necessary to complete these projects. Making It HappenWe need your help to take the book out of the computer and into the real world.  M. Ayodele Heath has done a magnificent job running the salon, selecting, logging and editing the poems. The manuscript is in the hands of the excellent design team.  Krista Franklin has created a stunning cover.  We are going to print. We've raised the necessary funds to have this book in your hands by April 5th.    And we need your help to cross the finish line.  We know we have a great product. But, we need to communicate that to a wider audience.  That means throwing a fantastic launch party, taking the book to conferences, designing and implementing collaborative readings, promotions and advertising. Sample 


#87:
The five cool stars above this town look down



The
five cool stars above this town look downfrom their hill.  They'd
rather sleep, they are lostknitted into our dark cloth of sky,
light bursting through at the seams.No one seems to recall when
they appeared, butnow they stay out of habit (or obligation) to
sailors and drunks.
Once
upon a time, they were a boy bandcaught between harmonics and
hormones,their future fueled by delicate chemistry,a powerful
mixture oftestosterone, adrenaline, ambition, and heartache
Spiraling
into control, like a galaxy—red dwarfs and supernovas, all the
same to this town—the five stars still seek the heart,
exploding liquid lava light through what is in the way.
In
their stuttering light, a long blue moansplinters into iridescent
shiversas a one-time fan tightens her shawl.  Turns the other
way.
Even More Ways To Help 
Get the buzz going.  Spread the word about "Electronic Corpse: Poems From A Digital Salon" by sharing our campaign on Facebook, Google +, and TwitterThank you so much!

story:
Roland and I have completed the cover illustration:

************************************************************

NEW REWARD!!

As an extra reward-Anyone who contributes $75 or more will get to meet and take a picture with Adventurous Jenna and Jordan. Bring your dog-This reward includes time with both at the dog park in Hudson County Park in Bayonne, NJ. Bring your child(ren), It also includes playtime with Jordan in the play area next to the dog park. *Reward does not include transportation to or from park*

************************************************************************

Because the "Adventurous Jenna" books are told through the eyes of a rescued puppy and high functioning autistic boy, they will include information on animal rescue and autism awareness. That is why it is so important to share and fund this campaign.

Here are the first 3 pages of the "Adventurous Jenna-Jenna Finds a Home" book.

Jenna awoke early.
“What would today bring?”, she thought.
“Maybe another amazing adventure!”

Jenna searched and discovered something to eat.
A nice family in a nearby camper always ate the most delicious food.
The good stuff is way down on the bottom.

“Now to wash it all down with something cold to drink.”
A trip to the creek is in order.
“Ok, which way should I go today, right or left?” Jenna said to herself.

Which way do you think Jenna will go? Contribute today, so the book can be illustrated and published.

*************************************************************************

We have a winner!!    

**Latisha Humphrey **

Love of Reading Reward

Special Reward:For the first person to contribute $50 or more, that lucky person will receive an egift card from Barnes & Noble. 

(You will also get all the other rewards as well!)

$50 will get you a $10 egift card

She can use this egift card online or in any Barnes & Noble store. She will receive this reward on July 31, 2014 (before any other rewards).

**************************************************************************

Who is Adventurous Jenna? Who is Jordan? Who am I, the author? Who is the illustrator?

Ok, let's start with my two amazing kids-Jenna and Jordan. (Jenna is the hairy one on the floor in the picture below. Although Jordan has been known to lay on the ground and play "dead opossum" from time to time.) Jenna is an adventurous six month old Lab, Hound, Rottweiler mixed puppy. Jordan is a very creative nine year old, high functioning autistic boy. From the moment Jordan laid eyes on her and said, "She's so cute!", Jenna has been part of our family. From every lick, bark, pee on the floor and shredded couch pillow, Jenna has been one of the family.

This was taken on the day Jordan rescued Jenna.

Ok now me the author, David Neustein. By day, I teach drama in a NJ public school. By night, I teach through story telling (writing, producing and directing). I am a father, husband and pet owner (Jenna the dog, Rocky the turtle, Shelly the hermit crab). I also enjoy sports (both watching and playing), yoga, meditation, reading and watching TV and movies. And playing with Jenna. (In fact, she is nudging my leg with her nose attempting to get my attention as I write. It worked. Be right back!). It is my intention to use the book series to teach children important lessons that include, love for animals, tolerance of others and the importance of family, just to name a few. More about me can be found at www.neusteinentertainment.com.

Me and my girl. (Yes, the tongue made contact)

Born on October 22, 1962, Roland Lorente, the illustrator, is the oldest of four.  Growing up in Hoboken, reading comic books and drawing was his life.  It is fair to say that his interest in art and animation was forged by his grandmother and his father.  Grandma's generous allowances financed his growing comic book collection, while Pop, a pretty darned good photographer himself, placed an 8 mm movie camera in his hands when he was 13 years old.  Already an avid comic book reader, "Roll" and his best friends often created and sketched their own comic strips, honing his story telling skills. He often sold his sketches to his classmates in grade school, and his teachers always requested special art projects, like painting the school's windows during the holidays. He carefully watched entire animated films, one frame at a time, studying the different art techniques involved in creating narrative.  After serving in the U.S. Air Force, Roland decided to follow his heart and earned a BA degree in film and media arts. Since 2002, Roland has been currently working full time with elementary school students with special needs.  He successfully uses his art skills to help struggling kids better understand their lessons. 

Roland being creative with his bio picture.

Why should you contribute?

Being a teacher and a parent, I completely understand the importance of picture books and the love of reading. When I was young, I hated reading. My comprehension was horrible and reading was incredibly painful for me. It is my hope that children will open up an "Adventurous Jenna" book, start reading, laugh a little and never want to put the book down. "Mommy/daddy read it again!"

By contributing to this campaign, you will not only help launch the first in a series of "Adventurous Jenna" books, but you will also help launch Jenna's campaign to help children around the globe learn and reinforce the joys of reading.

Other benefits of the Adventurous Jenna book:

  • Helps parents instill a love of reading in their children.
  • Helps solidify the bond between parent and child.
  • Brings a sense of family togetherness.
  • Increases engagement, vocabulary, fluency, stimulating imagination, comprehension and understanding of text structure.
  • Develop multi-sensory learning. (Listening to and looking at a picture book, children will see the pictures, hear the words, touch the pages.)
  • Increase attention span for children.
  • The illustrations offer context clues for developing or struggling readers.
  • The laughter from the humor in the book can reduce stress levels.
  • Great subject-preschoolers love reading about animals.

After the book series gets off the ground,  "Adventurous Jenna" movies, learning apps, a children's TV show, and live stage productions are all planned. And you can help start all that today with a contribution.


What We Need

We need $8,000, Why do we need $8,000? We are looking to get everything done to help make this first book a success. That includes:

*Copy editing, *illustrations, *copyright registration, *ISBN number and price embedded barcode, *Full marketing and publicity, *Book video trailer, *Copies, *Ipad/iphone/NOOK/Kindle editions with distribution, *Rewards with US shipping and Indiegogo fees. 

If more than the $8.000 is contributed, we will have money towards publishing the second book in the series; "Adventurous Jenna Goes to the Vet" 

What You Get

Here are just some of the cool rewards (Approved by Jordan) you will get when you contribute: 

*Good Karma, *"Bark out" on the Adventurous Jenna website and facebook page, *Adventurous Jenna T-shirt, *Adventurous Jenna tote bag, *Copies of "Adventurous Jenna book, *You and/or your pet as a character in the next book and so much more. Go to the rewards section to see what you will get.
*Click on the Gallery to see pictures of some of your rewards.

Please note all the rewards (Except PDF and hard copy of the book) exclusive for this campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, it doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Why not share with everyone you know!

Thanks for all your help. It is appreciated!!

story:
Finding the Jellyfish Moon - A Novel by Dustin Lane

Instead of losing his mind while toiling away at what has become an ordinary life, 26 year old Benjamin Cane decides to rid himself of his current existence by taking to the road on his motorcycle to find that thing that he has neglected for far too long…himself.

After selling off all of his possessions, breaking up with his girlfriend and quitting his job, Benjamin sets his sights on finding the happiness that can only come by completely starting over. Along the way he meets a cast of characters that, along with the places he visits, help shape the way that Benjamin wants to see the world and himself.

The story is told in Benjamin's own words as he looks to the future while flashing back to the past, telling the story of his life and the things that have led him to this drastic new direction.

Finding the Jellyfish Moon is a classic counterculture story set in modern times that follows in the tradition of novels like "Catcher in the Rye", "On the Road", "Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas" and "The Electric Kool-Aid Acid Test".


What's the score here?

This campaign differs from other crowd funding campaigns in that this project has already been completed. The book has been written and edited. The artwork for the cover has been finalized. It's basically all ready to go. But it does cost quite a bit to get it printed up properly. That's where all of you come in. This isn't about making money. It's about getting this novel out into the world. Basically, the more pre-orders we get, the more copies we can print up. It's as simple as that.


The Book - $20

290 pages -  6" X 9" Softcover book with full color front and back laminated cover. Everyone who pre-orders will also have their name printed in the book as a special Thank You. I can also sign the book, if you so desire.

$20 pre-order includes Shipping & Handling (USA Only) and will be mailed out in mid-December 2013.


The Print - $20

The front and back cover of Finding The Jellyfish Moon was photographed and tweaked by photographer Sherry Lee. She will be printing up a super limited 13" X 19" print of the front cover design. Only 13 copies of this poster (the number 13 is pretty significant in the book) will be printed with only 12 being made available to the public (I gotta keep one, right?). It will also be signed (and numbered) by Sherry Lee and Dustin Lane.

$20 pre-order includes Shipping & Handling (The Print will be shipped in a sturdy poster tube) (USA Only)and will be mailed out in mid-December 2013.


All monies raised from this campaign will go towards the printing of this book (and the posters). More money equals more copies of the book.

Finding The Jellyfish Moon will be printed by Nonstop Printing In Los Angeles, Ca. Turnaround appears to be about a week and then I will mail everything out myself within a day or two of receiving the books back from the printers. The goal, which is completely doable, is to have them in your mailbox before Christmas. The Posters will be shipped out at the same time as the books.


Dustin Lane is a writer/director/musician who lives in Los Angeles, CA. In 2011 he wrote/filmed/edited/directed his first feature length film "The Purest Blue", as well as the short films "Blue Skied an" Clear" and "Ouija (one)". He has also done music videos for The Lords of Altamont, Should, Tahir Jahi, Fight Dirty and Christopher Richard. He has released one album and two EP's under the band name Sleeping Favor and is now in the process of writing and recording new music, set to be released sometime in 2014.

The links below are to Dustin Lane's Facebook Page, YouTube Channel and IMDb Page.

story:
The book is a philosophical inquiry into the themes of free will and the value of adversity through exploring a fictional, dystopic world where the optimal decision to every choice set can be ascertained through the use of AI. I wrote it because I wanted to explore philosophical and ethical questions that will be pertinent to our world in the near future and that stimulate my curiosity. My book will publish in February 2020.

 

Story of My Book

The Death of Uncertainty

The Death of Uncertainty is story of a world powered by a perfect AI algorithm that can accurately determine what the optimal decision is to any choice one may have — thus, in this world, no mistakes are made and everyone lives the optimal version of their respective lives. One day, a young man of this world stumbles upon suboptimality and adversity, which causes him to reflect on the system, helping him to explore the intersections of free will and uncertainty, adversity and fulfillment, and perfection and human nature...

My name is Michael Tan and I am the author of The Death of Uncertainty. I wrote this book because I hope to add value and insight to a pertinent development in our modern world, namely the rapid growth of Artificial Intelligence.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover both the myriad of ways in which AI can enhance human society and how it has the potential to degrade key parts of human nature. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for a vision of an AI future in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you think about both the physical and metaphysical implications of such a future.

In this book, you'll learn about the inverse relationship between optimality and uncertainty and the relationship between free will and uncertainty.

The main character Viktor begins the story with a comfortable, optimal life where he is able to do everything perfectly and fulfill all his wants — his happiness is certain, guided by an AI that directs his every decision to optimality.

He then experiences real adversity for the first time and then overcomes it through his own free will without any technological aid, leading to a sense of internal fulfillment which causes him to reflect on his old life and wonder if there’s more to life than just maximizing happiness and pleasure.

Viktor confronts his old life after his new realizations and further explores the relationships between optimality, free will, and uncertainty.

You will love this book if you:

  • are interested in the implications of AI
  • enjoy philosophical discussions on the nature of free will
  • like dystopian novels

The Death of Uncertainty is a fiction book that speaks to people of our modern technological age who are looking at the ethical and philosophical implications of an AI future for the first time.

 

The Book - The Death of Uncertainty


The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1 contains Chapters I-III. In this section, you will be introduced to the world (called the City) and to the main character Viktor. You’ll learn about the mechanisms and applications of the AI, and you’ll follow Viktor out on an AI-arranged date.

Part 2 contains Chapters IV-VII. For the first time, Viktor leaves the protected and comfortable AI utopia and enters into a wilderness lacking technology. Here, he experiences real hardship and learns from his experience

Part 3 contains Chapters VIII-X. Viktor returns to the City with his new knowledge and experiences gained from the wilderness. This sets him up for a confrontation with the leader of the City, and a debate of philosophies ensues.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in February 2020

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish Spring 2020.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.



I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

 

About the Author

Michael Tan is a senior at Duke University double majoring in Statistics and Economics with a certificate in Philosophy, Politics, and Economics. After graduation, he will be working in New York as an investment banking analyst at Goldman Sachs.

I wrote this book to answer for myself a question that I believe is extremely relevant to our modern age and that I am personally curious about. I sought to utilize my background in data science as well as philosophy to create an impactful and insightful discourse that can contribute to our shared understanding of how technology can affect the human condition and what the core drives of human beings are (exploring possibilities such as hedonism, eudaemonic happiness, and more).

Outside of all this, I’m also a huge sports fan (go Warriors and 49ers!) and an aspiring (but as yet unsuccessful) fantasy football manager.

For more information you can connect with Michael at michaeltan07@gmail.com and on Linkedin.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheOptimalAI and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Michael Tan
story_txt:
The book is a philosophical inquiry into the themes of free will and the value of adversity through exploring a fictional, dystopic world where the optimal decision to every choice set can be ascertained through the use of AI. I wrote it because I wanted to explore philosophical and ethical questions that will be pertinent to our world in the near future and that stimulate my curiosity. My book will publish in February 2020.
 
Story of My Book
The Death of UncertaintyThe Death of Uncertainty is story of a world powered by a perfect AI algorithm that can accurately determine what the optimal decision is to any choice one may have — thus, in this world, no mistakes are made and everyone lives the optimal version of their respective lives. One day, a young man of this world stumbles upon suboptimality and adversity, which causes him to reflect on the system, helping him to explore the intersections of free will and uncertainty, adversity and fulfillment, and perfection and human nature...My name is Michael Tan and I am the author of The Death of Uncertainty. I wrote this book because I hope to add value and insight to a pertinent development in our modern world, namely the rapid growth of Artificial Intelligence.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover both the myriad of ways in which AI can enhance human society and how it has the potential to degrade key parts of human nature. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for a vision of an AI future in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you think about both the physical and metaphysical implications of such a future.In this book, you'll learn about the inverse relationship between optimality and uncertainty and the relationship between free will and uncertainty.The main character Viktor begins the story with a comfortable, optimal life where he is able to do everything perfectly and fulfill all his wants — his happiness is certain, guided by an AI that directs his every decision to optimality.
He then experiences real adversity for the first time and then overcomes it through his own free will without any technological aid, leading to a sense of internal fulfillment which causes him to reflect on his old life and wonder if there’s more to life than just maximizing happiness and pleasure.
Viktor confronts his old life after his new realizations and further explores the relationships between optimality, free will, and uncertainty.
You will love this book if you:

are interested in the implications of AI
enjoy philosophical discussions on the nature of free will
like dystopian novels

The Death of Uncertainty is a fiction book that speaks to people of our modern technological age who are looking at the ethical and philosophical implications of an AI future for the first time.
 
The Book - The Death of Uncertainty

The book is written in 3 Parts....Part 1 contains Chapters I-III. In this section, you will be introduced to the world (called the City) and to the main character Viktor. You’ll learn about the mechanisms and applications of the AI, and you’ll follow Viktor out on an AI-arranged date.Part 2 contains Chapters IV-VII. For the first time, Viktor leaves the protected and comfortable AI utopia and enters into a wilderness lacking technology. Here, he experiences real hardship and learns from his experiencePart 3 contains Chapters VIII-X. Viktor returns to the City with his new knowledge and experiences gained from the wilderness. This sets him up for a confrontation with the leader of the City, and a debate of philosophies ensues.
 
What I Need & What You'll Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following: The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in February 2020
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish Spring 2020.
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...
 
About the Author
Michael Tan is a senior at Duke University double majoring in Statistics and Economics with a certificate in Philosophy, Politics, and Economics. After graduation, he will be working in New York as an investment banking analyst at Goldman Sachs.I wrote this book to answer for myself a question that I believe is extremely relevant to our modern age and that I am personally curious about. I sought to utilize my background in data science as well as philosophy to create an impactful and insightful discourse that can contribute to our shared understanding of how technology can affect the human condition and what the core drives of human beings are (exploring possibilities such as hedonism, eudaemonic happiness, and more).Outside of all this, I’m also a huge sports fan (go Warriors and 49ers!) and an aspiring (but as yet unsuccessful) fantasy football manager.For more information you can connect with Michael at michaeltan07@gmail.com and on Linkedin.
 
Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 
Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheOptimalAI and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.
Thank you so much of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Michael Tan

story:
It's time to replace the pick-up truck, it finally bit the dust and I need to have another vehicle. The cost of paying back a loan can be expensive as many people know. A vehicle is important in getting the family to the store, work and even the doctor's office.

Now I do not expect anyone to just give me the money without anything back. I am an author and the feedback that I have received on the stories is very positive and many have enjoyed reading the book. Check out the incentives for helping me out.

The book is ready and will be shipped to you during or just after the campaign is over. Those that have read the stories are telling me that they really enjoyed reading them and my  goal is to reach new readers who will enjoy reading the stories. You can read a portion of the new bonus story below. I'm looking forward to sending you your copy of Losing Face and hearing from you. Losing Face is available at Amazon.com, B&N and other online stores and can also be purchased through your local book store. You can also read the reviews at Amazon.com as well as purchase the book there. Remember though, you will only receive the new bonus story here.

Everyone who selects a perk will also receive a PDF of the brand new story
Déjà vu

Déjà vu

Copyright ©2013 By C. W. Smith

There may be a time when some people start to get a feeling that something is wrong. Many can look past that feeling or ignore it, but it can dig at you—and if you allow it to surface and consider that there is something to it, then your world can turn upside down. It will control the very essence of who you are and leave you feeling like an empty shell of who you once were. This feeling started in me, slowly at first, and I did ignore it, but as time passed it gnawed at me until I felt its icy grip, which snapped me out of a nightmare to awaken in something much worse.

My memories are of what feels like a long time ago, or maybe it was yesterday… everything is running together in my memories. There was a discussion amongst a few of my friends about thinking you had done something before, that you had already lived the event and you knew what was going to happen. Most people have experienced this in a fleeting thought, or in a vague memory of reliving or having dreamed what is happening to them in that very instant. For me, those instances were happening more and more often and getting stronger.

It was strange to start remembering things that were happening right now, pieces and remnants of something that had not even happened yet, but there it is, and it was happening again and again. Now I think I finally understand what’s happening and why I seem to have such strong feelings of déjà vu. From what I can recall, it started slowly and only on a few memories. I can tell you what everyone will say and what will happen no matter what I do to try to change things.

So what is happening? This is where it becomes a little complex and even interesting, though it scares the hell out of me.

(continued)

story:
Where Will Your Money Go?

YOU CAN DONATE ANY AMOUNT...every dollar helps.  The amounts at the right are called PERKS.  You get a PERK when you donate those specific amounts.

100% of the money raised goes toward printing Jenna's book. If we don't reach our goal, we will print as many books as we can.

You will receive your gift within 30 days from the close of this campaign.

Our Story

Jenna Spille is a 16 year old cancer survivor who loves God and loves to write. When we first found out about her brain cancer, she said, "God's Got This. God's got this, mom. I know He does. It's going to be okay."

When Make-A-Wish Colorado gave Jenna one wish, she took the opportunity to love and show compassion to others. The book you are supporting is that wish. Jenna's wish was to write a book for others going through cancer or sickness and to give others Hope. 

Why Is This Important?

So many children (and adults) feel alone when they are going through treatment for life-threatening illnesses. We hope to help people find Hope when they feel there is none to be found. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute right now, we understand. It would be wonderful if you would share this with your friends.

story:
¿Qué?

El valle es una narración dura, cruda quizás, de ritmo ágil y alejada de los tópicos. Una trama de madurez, de redención quizá, con un poso de denuncia social latente e imposible de ignorar.

Estamos ante una historia pasional que más que zarandear golpea, que más que avisar actúa porque entiende de su necesidad e importancia. El Amor y la Revolución aparecen enredados como si fuesen una, quizás lo sean; nombrar el principio de uno o el final del otro resulta cuestionable. Por ambos mueres y por ambos vives, por ambos el hombre honrado y la mujer honrada llevan a cabo oscuros actos, tropieza u olvida su ética. Que la intensidad de la vida es distinta en la adolescencia, es algo que sabe todo aquel que haya cumplido los veintitantos, habiendo así pasado la brecha de tiempo más visceral. Imaginen el Amor y la Revolución estallando a esa edad tan molesta, enfocado principalmente en dos personajes que tratan de aprender sobre la marcha lo que nadie les ha enseñado. Enmarcado todo en las dimensiones de un pueblo pequeño, que actúa de olla a presión, acelerando hasta el vértigo lo que no necesita de vértigo para ser apasionante.

Arturo conoce el mismo día, a través de una de esas hermosas casualidades que trae la vida, a Manuela, y junto a ella, inseparables ambas, se encuentra con la Revolución. Ambos jóvenes, creyéndose ya adultos, se ven obligados a crecer, obligados a aprender a amar, y a ser revolucionarios. A mantenerse unidos sin olvidar la lucha. Se verán envueltos en batallas que no entienden, pero deben abordar, las batallas propias del día a día, y las batallas ajenas que traen la necesaria lucha por la justicia y la libertad. Además, el libro se estructura de un modo poco habitual, rompiendo la línea temporal clásica, creando un ente particular, parecido a un atractivo rompecabezas, que hará de su lectura una aventura mucho más embriagadora.   

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Juan Mª Gallego Jara.

Nace y crece en Murcia bajo un ambiente siempre agradable y soleado. Creció enganchado a un balón de cuero, soñando quizás con llegar algún día a coronar el mundo, a través del esférico. Todo cambió el verano que había cumplido catorce años, llegó a sus manos, por medio de su madre, ávida lectora, un libro, al que en inicio no prestó demasiada atención. El libro era pequeño y fino, quizás por ello se decidió a leerlo, de haber sido más pesado, es probable, que hubiese continuado con su afán de patear el balón.

El libro era Cien años de soledad de Gabriel García Márquez. Sin él pretenderlo, pronto comprobó, embriagado por las letras del artista colombiano, que se había visto infectado por una enfermedad benigna, agradable y hermosa, de la que ya no podría salir. De la mano de este y muchos otros libros aprendió que la vida no acababa en el patio donde siempre pasó sus tardes. Adquirió afinidad por descubrir luces y sombras de lugares que antes no conocía. Se entregó al camino, a pedalear de pueblo en pueblo por países desconocidos, de lenguajes distintos al suyo. Lugares que le promocionaban la emoción y la clarividencia para agarrar, siempre al vuelo, historias y personajes que ocuparían sus escritos.

Cabe decir que este libro, El Valle, fue escrito en su último viaje en bicicleta, a través de cuatro mil kilómetros, con la ayuda de un papel en blanco, y el valor necesario para rellenarlo con su tinta. Aún hay quien le pregunta «¿Por qué escritor?», y él responde contundente siempre con las mismas palabras: «He intentado ser muchas cosas, pero no logro imaginarme haciendo nada distinto a esto».

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Tu madre llegó a casa a eso del mediodía, yo llevaba horas amarrada al balcón con medio ojo puesto en ti que en silencio removías de un lado a otro los juguetes; taciturno y decaído, no eras más que un crío, pero ya sabías que algo no iba bien. Lo decían tus ojos que eran los que un niño jamás debiera poseer, ojos tristes sin futuro. Yo vi como tu Madre aparecía tras la esquina de la avenida, medio cuerpo suyo bañado del rojo sangre de su pecho izquierdo, desnuda caminaba erguida, con la frente alta, y la mirada precisa y profunda. Los balcones se llenaban de gente, también los portales y las terrazas de los bares, la mayoría guardaba un absoluto silencio, unos pocos lloraban, otros reían jocosos, e incluso algún hijo de puta se atrevió valiéndose de su cobardía y de la multitud que lo hacía invisible para llamarla puta, y ordenarle que se tapase.
          Pero no, ella no se tapó.
          Ella no se tapó porque no tenía pecado que ocultar, porque no había errado, porque ella solo luchó con honor y valor, con orgullo y nobleza. No se tapa, avanza erguida mientras con su mano izquierda arrastra el trapo con el que los militares la obsequiaron para cubrirse. No usará el trapo, jamás lo hará. Este trapo no es otro que la nueva bandera nacionalista, la que extendió su poder a fuerza de terror, la que mató a sus hermanos, la que mató al padre de sus hijos. María se desangraría, pero no taparía con esa bandera su herida, ni escondería su cuerpo que es libre, aunque haya sido mutilado»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 920€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El valle que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Juan Mª Gallego Jara vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El valle que saldría después a la venta.
Además...
Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Juan Mª Gallego Jara vea publicada su obra.
Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
My name is Darryl Webster and for the 2013/14 season I intend to visit 14 official Manchester City supporter's clubs. From Oslo to New York, Brisbane to Abu Dhabi.

A thorough and engaging exploration of local culture, football, and of course how, when and why a Manchester City Supporter's Club came to exist in your particular part of the world. I will take in one key match at each supporter's club, documenting in writing and pictures the different ways each Heart of the City pub celebrates East Manchester's greatest export.

The finished book will be an engaging collection of stories from the most passionate and supportive fans in the world. The Citizens! Think "On The Road" if Jack Kerouac were a Blue and consumed nothing harder than a few pints.

The campaign funding is going to be split into two parts. This is Part 1, $3000 to cover North American flights and accomodation where necessary. I will still be paying my own rent back home in Toronto and there won't be any Michelin Star restaurants on the itinerary.

A second camapign will launch over the Holidays 2013 to help cover the international portion of the project as well as the physical publication of the book if we go the self-publishing route vs publisher.

Earlier this year I wrote a two-part series for Manchester City regarding their impact on local football supporters in Toronto, which you can read by visiting:

http://www.darryl-webster.com/city-piece.html

I also write a monthly blog for Manchester City's official website, check out August's piece linked below:

http://www.mcfc.com/News/Features/2013/August/City-Blogger-Darryl-1

If you live in a city with an official MCFC supporter's club you believe I've missed, please drop me an email and we'll see what we can do.

Thanks you for your time and I look forward to meeting you along the way!


Darryl Webster.

story:
A Poetry Book - Based On Your Suggestions On Instagram

Hey, I'm Tom.

Over the last few weeks, I've been asking my friends on Instagram to suggest subjects for me to write poems about; and I've crammed more than 50 of my favourites into my first ever poetry book.

Even more importantly, I'm going to be donating 100% of the profits from the sale of the book to two very important charities: Beat Eating Disorders and The Trussell Trust, who help support a network of food banks across the UK.

To say thank you for your support, we've put together some great perks. For just £15 you can get your hands on an exclusive signed copy of the book, and all perks come with free shipping in the UK.

The book has had some great reviews so far, and it would really mean a lot if you could help me get this project off the ground, so we can raise some money for two very worthwhile causes.

You can read my first attempts at Instagram poetry here

 

What's The Plan?

I've written nearly 100 poems, and in the next couple of weeks we're going to pick our 50 favourites to go in the book. If you have any last-minute ideas for subjects, feel free to suggest it on Instagram!

Some very generous and talented artists have kindly provided accompanying illustrations, so in total, there will be well over 100 pages of artistic goodness to bring joy to your soul.

I'm now hoping to raise enough money to fund a limited print run of 200 copies of the book, to raise money for our chosen charities - that's where we need your help.

As a thank-you for your support, I'd like to include some spectacular rewards to supporters of our campaign; including, but not limited to:

  • Signed copies of the book
  • Exclusive Jobs For Beluga Whales merch, including postcards and tea towels
  • Your own, unique, hand-written poem
  • The option of having your book blessed by a priest before shipping

 

What Are The Poems About?

All of the poems in the book are based on subjects people have suggested to me on Instagram. I've been sent some very weird and wonderful topics to write about.

I won't list them all, because there are more than 50 in total, but some of my favourite poems include:

  • Zoom Meetings

  • The Origin Of Eels

  • Staring At Goats

  • Low Calorie Hot Chocolate Sachets - 35p in Morrisons

  • Getting a static shock when you get up from an office chair and try to open a door

  • Showerhead Limescale

 

 

Where Will The Money Go?

Once we've covered the costs of printing the book, and of course the rewards, all the money generated from the sale of Jobs For Beluga Whales will be donated to two very important charities:

 

The Trussell Trust

The Trussell Trust supports a nationwide network of food banks, providing emergency food and support to people living in poverty. Astonishingly, that’s more than 14 million people in the UK, including more than 4 million children. Perhaps more importantly, they also campaign to end the structural inequalities in our society which mean that food banks, sadly, are still a necessity in 2020.

 

Beat Eating Disorders

Beat is the UK’s eating disorder charity. They carry out invaluable work in helping people who are suffering, one way or another, as a result of often very serious conditions. Having witnessed first-hand the impact eating disorders can have, it means an enormous amount to me that we’re able to help Beat support others who are struggling.

 

I've got a fantastic team of people helping me put the book together, including editors, illustrators, photographers, and graphic designers; and nobody has asked for a single penny in exchange for their time and effort. As soon as we've paid the printing costs, all of the money will be going to Beat and The Trussell Trust.

 

Who On Earth Are You?

My name is Tom (@TomAndThat on Instagram), and in my day job I work in the creative industries.

I help to organise a music festival in Lincolnshire called Beyond The Woods, and make social media content for Annie Mac's show on BBC Radio 1.

In my spare time I enjoy running, and making silly things for the internet. When Tony Blair was the prime minister, he sent me a congratulatory letter for watching all three Lord Of The Rings films back-to-back, without any toilet breaks.

 

The Finances

After a lot of shopping around for prices, to print 200 copies of the book will cost us £800 (including Indiegogo's Fees).

The remaining £200 will go towards funding the rewards for our amazing supporters. Costs include:

  • Upgrading up to 20 books to hardback editions

  • Jobs For Beluga Whales postcards + tea towels

  • Certificates of blessing, and travel expenses for our chosen priest

 

What If We Don't Raise £1,000?

Of course the plan is to raise more than the £1,000 we need, but if we're not able to raise the full amount then we'll order as many books as we can for the amount of money raised. For example: If we get half the funds, we might only order half the books.

 

What If We Raise More Than £1,000?

If we end up raising more than the £1,000 we need - which would be incredible - any excess profits will be donated to our charities. We won't order any more than 200 books.

If all of the perks were claimed by the end of our crowdfunding run, it would mean being able to donate almost £5,500 to our two charities!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, I completely understand that money is pretty tight for a lot of people at the moment. If you can't support the project financially (or even if you can), I'd be hugely grateful for your help in spreading the word; and letting people know about the book, and the charities we're supporting.

Even something as simple as sharing the link to this page on your socials, and telling people a bit about what we're trying to achieve, would make a massive difference.

Thank you for your help!

A quick note: As we haven't actually been able to have the book printed yet, the images used here are mock-ups of how the end product is going to look. The finished book won't look that dissimilar, but it also might not look *exactly* the same

story:
Sun Salutations to all!

Thank you for your attention. You will love this story, you are part of it !!

My name is Flor Fernández. This campaign is launched to finance the publication, presentation and publicity of the novel "Marina´s Journey". It is of utmost importance for me. I am 45, and I had always known I had to publish since I was a child. It is also a way to show that when there is a crisis, there is always the possibility of listening to one´s heart to get out of it. Ater 13 years in Scotland, where I was teaching Spanish in several Univerisities and companies, I have been back in Spain for four years. I haven´t found a job in this time, and I have seen many people losing theirs.

The core point of the book is : "The magic of pure hearts works".When you know inside who you are, then you have to follow your inner compass.

This will be a successful project that will benefit many people.

"Marina´s Journey" is an invitation to the reader to identify himself/herself with all characters, with the landscapes, the moods and the processes that fill the pages. It transmits a wellbeing sensation. In a certain way it is a kind of guided visualization that shows us parts of our collective consciousness, hence parts of ourselves. The reading will give you a holiday, where you can liberate from stress and tensions. You will fly with your imagination in territories that will fill you with brilliant sensations. It may surprise that Marina is a fairy. Nevertheless, it is not the intention of this book to be a fairytale story as such. Marina is a part of you. It is open to people of all ages. 

There are some notes at the end of the book, where the deeper meaning of some of the metaphors is explained.


It started as a dream of a summer night, from where the first 9 pages were written and it continued as a metaphore of the weakening in communication that arises out of antagonism and how it generates obstacles.

Marina is searching for what can she offer to her community to help them overcome the fact that they have split in two bands. It reflects what happens in society. It conveys the idea that the individual has a meaningful and unique way to offer his/her gifts in the co-creation of a fair society.

The division has ocurred over a disagreement regarding how to deliver Blue Berries to humanity . In the story the blue berries are a fruit, generously given by Nature to mankind. It is a metaphor that it is in our nature to find states of harmony and balance and transmit that to others. The tree of the biue berries is symbolic of the capacity of each person to ground the dreams of their souls, to nourish the seeds that are carrying inside since birth.

This book encourages deep listening, respect for all forms of life and the capacity to transcend by opening the imagination and the heart.

It will certainly benefit all those who take part and all those who read it. Everybody involved will feel part of a valuable, meaningful life experience that connects all of us through our hearts. On the other hand, relevant current issues that affect our communities are touched, such as the problems with food and obesity that have spread so fast in some countries. The solutions that appear will speak to the inner child, that will understand that there are always solutions to reach the inner balance.


The money raised will go towards the payment of the revision, editing and printing of the first 1000 books, the launching and the publicity, as well as the supervision of its translation into English. During the presentations of the book I would like to sing the songs that came to me and appear in the book, as well as organise beautiful inspiring evenings, with meditations, music and question/answer time .

This is a book to spread happiness, healing and union. It stimulates creativity, reading between lines and the trust in oneself and the community.

Oceans of gratitude for your attention, for reading me, for your support and for seeing with as much clarity as me that this project deserves to reach the public as soon as possible.

 If the financial goal were not to be reached, then I would reduce the number of copies published to 500, all depending on budget, as well as cutting expenses from the organasation of the presentation, publicity etc.

My most sincere thanks to all of you and to all those who pass the word around to their family and friends. Together it will happen: I am sure. Thank you!!

Dedicated to all the children in the Earth, and to the inner child of all the adults. Dedicated as well to my parents and to all parents.

Everything is possible. The highest gentle forms of communication, too.

 Peace, Conscious living, Literature as Medicine, Collective grounding of dreams.

My most sincere thanks to all of you and to all those who pass the word around to their family and friends. Together it will happen: I am sure. Thank you!!
Dedicated to all the children in the Earth, and to the inner child of all the adults. Dedicated as well to my parents and to all parents.
Everything is possible. The highest gentle forms of communication, too.
 Peace, Conscious living, Literature as Medicine, Collective grounding of dreams.

story:
What to say, what to say... Well, honestly, I am wholly new at this. I can’t make any claims that I know entirely what I am doing. But even though I am a novice in this industry, I am fervently committed. I live, breathe and lose sleep over this project, because I have this saga I am compelled to share.

Somewhere deep within, a creativity I didn’t think I harbored, awoke from sharing my grandparents history to a particular friend. Over the years, every person I ever told my family's story to, I’ve been rewarded with his or her genuine intrigue and downright shock; while morbidly, I’ve relished each and every one of their reactions to it!

Now see, this friend, while consumed with my tale, offhandedly said “you’ve got to be kidding…this sounds like a book I haven’t read yet.” 

And that statement was the catalytic point that steered me towards my new endeavor.

So here I am now, composing this book in a way that allows my imagination to run wild with creativity, whilst allowing the essence of their story to be shared at the same time. 

With Farewell, my Loves, I’ll give you the romance novel that emerged from my late mother's accounts of her parents’ true story.

But with passion, comes struggle...

I’m not afraid of the work this project entails. Actually, as mentioned before, I am consumed. I have been working on this non-stop. Whether it is researching deeper into my family history from those left to tell it, how I will go about publishing once I’ve finished compiling the story, or the late nights getting in a scene that just has to be written; nevertheless, it all requires time, capital and dedication to complete it.

At the moment, my novel is a work in progress. The story is already there. The drafts are being written. The process has fully commenced; however I am not too proud to admit that I need help.

This is where all you generous contributors come in.

Sincerely, this form of a “book advance” will help. Freelance work isn’t free after all!

But most importantly, after completing the manuscript I need it to be copy edited. Checked for grammatical corrections after my eyes have twisted to the point I can’t find the errors myself anymore. Being my first novel, I am going to need help with content editing as well to make sure the book I put out there is in its best form. Another pair of eyes just won’t do it. They’ve got to be professional and that doesn’t come cheap. Not only do I need the book reviewed, but most likely I’d need help formatting it into ePUB format for eBook distribution. Do I even get into the ins and outs of print publishing or can you only imagine? Print on demand very well may be the route I take as a self-published author.

We can’t forget about the cover design now either. That’s got to be weighed with just as much importance. The book is a form of art and the cover needs to reflect that. The design will need to encompass the nostalgia and beauty that this story is. A flawless cover is essential, in my opinion.

So what makes my project special you ask?

Well, novels have a unique way of transporting a reader to another place. Perhaps another country. A different era even. It can make one embark on a love affair they’ve yet to experience their selves. Books also make readers relate on the most basic human levels and empathize when the situation correlates.

What’s most incredible is that a book can make a person experience the story wholeheartedly. Feel, even though it’s fictional. It can get someone to reminisce his or her own experiences, when a walk down memory lane could be just what a reader is in the mood for.

And that is what I have set out to do, because I myself love to read. The experience of delving completely into a book is amazing; when the whole world fades away and all that you’ve got happening is the story that is unfolding before your eyes...bliss!

With that said, I’d like to share the stories my mother bestowed upon me. Although I’ve changed it up, plenty actually happened.

Have I piqued your curiosity?

Would you like to see what unfolds? Then please, contribute as much as your kind heart and wallet can! With your help, I know I can get this completed and self-published sooner than I’ve been able to do thus far.



>>Make sure to check in for #TeaserTuesday snippets straight from the book in my gallery tab!

completely into a book is amazing; when the whole world fades away and all that
you’ve got happening is the story that is unfolding before your eyes...bliss!
With that said, I’d like to share the
stories my mother bestowed upon me. Although I’ve changed it up, plenty actually
happened.
Have I piqued your curiosity?
Would you like to see what unfolds?
Then please, contribute as much as your kind heart and wallet can! With
your help, I know I can get this completed and self-published sooner than I’ve
been able to do thus far.
>>Make sure to check in for #TeaserTuesday snippets straight from the book in my gallery tab!

story:
‘The Beauty of Nature’ is my heart’s work, that I have been writing and creating for around ten years. I would truly appreciate receiving your support and funding for self-publishing this poetry book. 

If you choose the option offered, you can pre-order and receive a signed copy of my book when it is published, in exchange for a donation of £10, which is a 15% discount on the usual price I will sell my book for. 

 Through my poetry, I aim to inspire others to connect with nature, enjoy peace through meditation, and feel deeper connection and care for other people, animals and the Earth. More than ever, in these very unsettled times of climate change, we need to consider the impact we make upon Earth by our actions, and also find inner solace.
The book includes  images of my paintings, gracing it with colour and beauty, still allowing freedom of your imagination. Writing and art are mediums through which we can touch the heart and soul, plant seeds of kindness, in unseen ways. 

I wrote this large selection of 80 poems from a place of inner peace, pure joy and depth of heart, based on my own experiences. On the poetic journey, I reveal to you serenity and grace in nature’s embrace; walking on the beautiful Malvern hills, by the calm lakes and sea of Sweden, and in a Spanish paradise; through the cycle of the seasons. I share my love for the sea and sailing, the depths of our devoted love, appreciation for family and friends, also for their artistic gifts, and the beauty of the human spirit; our capacity for compassion towards ourselves and all sentient beings.

The funds raised will all go towards the cost of sending to the printers to print and make paperback books of ‘The Beauty of Nature’ I would be so grateful if you assist me in making my dream of publishing my first book come true! Thank you for your donation if you feel to support my creative work. 

One of my calm poems, from the chapter entitled, ‘Autumn’:

In the Garden of Tenderness 

 

In the garden of tenderness,

Soft beauty meets the eye,

As seven white doves fly 

Across silver-white hazy skies.

 

Melting into presence,

With gentle sweetness, 

I gaze and merge

With delicate hues of rose and aster.  

 

This love,

This peace

Is always here

To come Home to;

The sacred space of stillness 

Within you and I.

Hey All

Matt is a great poet and hard working guy and it is unfortunate that someone stole his car right out of his front yard. He has two young sons and deserves some goodness. Please give whatever you can. They deserve a little boost!

story:
The Pitch...

Her name is Anavasavsta. Born on Mars in the year 1880 to an ancient royal house, she was heir to the throne of an empire. She was only a child when the Earthmen came to her world, and changed everything.

When the British came to explore Mars in 1879, they found a harsh, ancient world teeming with new and strange forms of life, including the red-skinned people of Mars, who live in the deeps of the Tarivinan Delve – a network of ravines and river valleys five times as deep as the Grand Canyon, where the air pressure provides an atmosphere more suited for life.

The Martian city-states and federations had lasted for thousands of years. Often at war, using technology left behind from an ancient golden age, they were totally unprepared for the arrival of Earthmen. Trade and colonization disrupted the world’s balance of power, and a war tore apart the oldest empire on the face of the planet.

The British thought it would be useful to have an heiress to the throne at hand, so when her family was wiped out, they took young Anavasavsta to Earth. She almost did not survive the harshness of her new home – the heavy gravity and dense air pressure. But now she has lived on Earth for ten years, learning languages, customs, and, above all, to adapt to the hardships of her new planet. She has a new name, given to her by the British: Anastasia.

Now, in 1899, the coalition that seized the throne on Mars has fallen apart, and the empire is there to be taken. Now she will return to the planet of her birth at the head of a battalion of soldiers to take the throne in the name of the British Empire.

She is going back to a world she has not seen since she was a child, where she does not know if she belongs. She will be given the power to take revenge on the people who killed her family, but as a pawn of the British Empire. The Earthmen are her allies – some are even her friends – but is she willing to take the throne just to make it a possession of the Crown? Must she choose between being Anavasavsta or Anastasia? Can she become the Queen of Mars?

So what makes this story so great?  Why should you support it?

  • This is going to be a Planetary Romance in the grand old style of Burroughs, yet with a different feel and approach, incorporating our modern knowledge of the Red Planet
  • Strong female lead!  Anastasia (or Anavasavsta) is an intelligent, strong-willed woman thrust into a world of danger and interplanetary intrigue.
  • Action!  There will be swordfights, monsters, escapes, airships, and exploration of the amazing imagined world of Mars.
  • Perks!  Ebooks, print books, and more!  Perks include jewelry, cameos, and bonus scenes.

What I Need & What You Get

  • This money goes to keep me alive.  This is my job, and I just want to be paid enough to keep doing it.
  • All kinds of perks this time, from ebook and print editions, to Cameo appearances in the novel.  I also am making some freelance slots available through the campaign for editing and custom writing.
  • Even if I don't make goal, everyone will get what they pay for.  No exceptions.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, the most important thing you can do is share.  The hardest thing about these campaigns is making my voice heard above the tumult of the internet and standing out.  Signal boost!  Reblogs, Facebook posts, Tweets - everything helps!

story:
Scotty Rushing's Amazing Journey

From homelessness to a diagnosis of Multiple Sclerosis, Scotty Rushing is no stranger to overcoming challenges. By embracing Henry David Thoreau's philosophy of making a conscious endeavor to succeed, Scotty transformed his obstacles into opportunities and has become an inspiration to thousands of people. Now, Scotty is hoping to share his story with a larger audience by self-publishing his autobiography.

In 2005, Scotty Rushing lost almost everything he owned and became homeless after a job he held for several years came to an end with no warning. Scotty was forced to live in his car for six months while he struggled to find work. One of Scotty's few remaining possessions was an old copy of Henry David Thoreau's Walden. A passage from that book became Scotty's personal motto:

“I know of no more encouraging fact than the unquestionable ability of man to elevate his life by a conscious endeavor.”

With little more than these words to sustain him, Scotty embarked on an effort to reclaim his life and achieve success. He found work as a groom for racehorses in Louisiana, lived in a small tack room, and eventually became a licensed sports agent representing professional jockeys. Scotty embraced his lifelong passion and talent for writing and became a monthly columnist for a nationally-published magazine. 

Scotty faced another challenge in 2011 when a minor illness led to a diagnosis of Multiple Sclerosis. Despite the pain caused by this debilitating disease, Scotty has continued his work of making a conscious endeavor.

One of Scotty's great regrets was the absence of a college education, so he decided to enroll in school to pursue a degree. After exploring the possibilities of online education by participating in free classes, Scotty became a 45 year-old freshman at the Florida Institute of Technology where he became an academic standout. Scotty was named Outstanding Sophomore in 2014 and inducted as a member of Psi Chi, the International Honor Society for Psychology. After graduating from Florida Tech, Scotty transferred to Arizona State University where he is now pursuing a BA in English.

Scotty Rushing has been featured in publications in the United States and France and has been the subject of short video documentaries. This campaign is designed to help him complete and self-publish his autobiography in the hopes that others will be inspired to overcome their own challenges by making a conscious endeavor.

As a contributor to this campaign you can help Scotty share his story and continue his inspirational work. Scotty is a great example of the power of the human spirit and the ability of an individual to succeed through hard work and dedication to personal excellence. By becoming a contributor you will have played a significant role in encouraging others to succeed.

How Your Money Helps and What We Can Offer In Return

In order to self-publish his autobiography Scotty needs to raise a minimum of $7500. The money will be allocated to the following expenses:

  • $5000 will be devoted to the printing costs of the book.
  • $2000 will be used for promotional expenses including advertising, photos, press kits, and other related expenses.
  • $500 will be used to prepare the book for e-reader platforms and make it available in a digital format.

Why Your Contribution Matters

The power of encouragement in our society cannot be overstated. People need to hear the uplifting stories of others who have endured hardships similar to their own. This project is valuable because it has the power to reinforce self-sufficiency in the face of adversity. Scotty Rushing's life is a testimony to the importance of accepting personal responsibility and creating a life of value.

Scotty's writing has a very unique voice that comes across as down-to-earth and genuine. His words are crafted to reach a wide variety of readers and motivate them to take action.

Risks & Challenges

As someone that has faced and overcome many significant challenges, Scotty understands that this project has its own hurdles. Significant time must be allotted to the final draft of the manuscript and Scotty's health is the primary challenge. Multiple Sclerosis affects Scotty in a variety of ways from optic neuritis to muscle spasms that make it difficult to work for prolonged periods. Nevertheless, Scotty has proven time and again throughout his academic and writing career that he has the fortitude to push through and complete his tasks. He follows the medical advice of his amazing doctors and also works to maintain optimum health through diet and exercise.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute to this campaign there are other ways you can help Scotty reach potential contributors and complete his project:

  • Share Scotty's campaign with your friends and family.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to promote Scotty's campaign on a variety of platforms.

story:
MY PASSION, MY STORY

Ever since I was a little child, film, art and people intrigued me. I would spend most of my free time people watching and when that wasn't available to me, I watched people through T.V. My fascination with people turned into a love of the arts people created. Television shows, I learned rather quickly, came from the minds of people. They were able to put into words and transfer onto the screen, what they had envisioned within their minds.

I remember seeing Star Wars as a child. It was so fascinating to me. The odd planets and the strange creatures that inhabited them. The different ways the characters spoke. The humans or Jedi and Sith, who could move things with their minds and the interesting looking alien and mechanical beings they interacted with, who in the story, weren’t that different from the humans. I remember saying that’s what I want to do. I want to create stories, worlds and characters that INSPIRE whole generations.

I would say that my curiosity for writing stemmed from my childhood of watching foreign and domestic science fiction, fantasy and horror films. I was especially intrigued by vampire movies and fancied to call myself a vampire expert at the age of twelve, even though I might not have been. For me writing and T.V. offered an escape from a household of domestic violence. T.V. was my safe haven, a place where characters of shows were my non-judgmental friends.

Shows like Xena: Warrior Princess, Hercules: The Legendary Journeys, Buffy the Vampire Slayer, and Murder She Wrote (my grandmother’s favorite) were on my daily watch list. And movies like Star Wars, The Matrix, Devdas, Azumi, and Harry Potter, became some of my biggest sources of inspiration. Though my first forms of writing were poetry, I now find myself writing science fiction and fantasy novels as well as screenplays.


DREAM BIG OR GO HOME

                                               

                                                  My Vision

1. To one day see my stories on the big screen and television.

2. To see that my stories have helped someone get over a high hurdle in their life.

3. To see that they’ve inspired someone into action as others have inspired me.

4. To be a positive inspiration to children.

5. To become a household name.


IT’S IN THE BLOOD

Writing is in my blood. It’s something I feel I must do. Every day when I wake up, I think, "What can I create today." Not many people ever experience that feeling. The feeling of knowing what it is you’re supposed to do. I know for certain that I am a writer. I’m T.S. Patton: The Greatest Writer You’ve Never Heard of.


MY TIME MY SEASON

I started writing Rise of the Omarian King over three years ago. It started with a simple idea that came to me while I was lying down on my bed. Within minutes that idea had grown in complexity, so I went to work writing. In months, the first draft was done and in the months that followed, ideas about the second novel in the series, flooded my mind, so I went to work jotting those down. Many people think writing a novel takes a modicum of effort and that it is an easy task but I am here to tell you, it is not. It takes a lot of patience, sheer determination and a strong will. It is my patience, determination and will that has brought me to the finish line after three long years. I am proud to say that my book is now complete. I however am unable to fund the final publishing process for my book on my own. This is why I am asking for your help.

Your “good will seeds”, will allow me to reach the world with my novel. I know that Rise of the Omarian King will inspire not only children but adults alike. Rise of the Omarian King has been a true labor of love and to be able to share it with the world is I want to do.All funds raised, will go directly to editing, book cover design, marketing and promotions. Please help make my literary dreams come true.


SO WHERE’S THE MONEY GOING EXACTLY?

I need $5,000 dollars and $5,000 dollars only. The two rounds of editing will cost $2,700. The book cover design will cost $800 and marketing $950, and promotional supplies $550.

SPREAD THE WORD

If you can’t contribute financially yourself, please, feel free to share my Indiegogo Campaign with family, friends as well as strangers. Word of mouth is just as powerful as financial donations.
