story:
Automatische Literaturkritik - der Preis:


Alle klagen über schlechte Literatur, aber niemand bemüht sich um konstruktive Kritik und nachvollziehbare Bewertungskriterien. Jedenfalls niemand außer uns.

In Klagenfurt traten auch 2014 wieder 14 Autorinnen und Autoren bei den Tagen der deutschsprachigen Literatur zum öffentlichen Wettlesen an. Eine Jury aus Literaturfachleuten bestimmt dort vor laufenden Kameras mehrere Gewinner. Weil man als Zuschauer nicht immer nachvollziehen kann, ob ein Text jetzt "rhizomatisch" oder eine "Engführung gelungen" ist oder nicht, ergänzt seit 2008 der Automatische Literaturkritik Preis das Geschehen. Mit Hilfe einer transparenten und leicht anwendbaren Liste von Plus-und Minuspunkten wird ein Preisträgertext ermittelt.

Ob dieser Text dann auch wirklich der beste ist, weiß man nicht – genau wie bei den Jurypreisen. Aber dass er den Preis zu Recht bekommen hat, ist garantiert und lässt sich anhand der Kriterienliste jederzeit nachprüfen.

In vielen Jahren haben die Gewinner des ALK-Preises danach noch andere Preise gewonnen (etwa Tilman Rammstedt, der außerdem mit dem Bachmannpreis und dem Publikumspreis ausgezeichnet wurde), in manchen Jahren aber auch nicht. Und weil es uns schmerzte, die Autoren in diesen anderen Jahren nur mit einer – wenn auch sehr hübschen – Urkunde und 500 Euro nach Hause gehen zu sehen, wurde das Preisgeld 2014 durch Crowdfunding aufgebracht. 

So konnten wir Michael Fehr am 6. Juli 2014 noch vor der offiziellen Preisverleihung 5000 Euro in bar übergeben.

Premiere: Der erste Preisträger 2008

Von links nach rechts: Sascha Lobo, Tilman Rammstedt freut sich über den Automatische Literaturkritik Preis 2008, Kathrin Passig, Aleks Scholz

Die bisherigen Preisträger

  • 2008: Tilman Rammstedt, "Der Kaiser von China"
  • 2009: Karl-Gustav Ruch, "Hinter der Wand"
  • 2010: Dorothee Elmiger, "Einladung an die Waghalsigen"
  • 2011: Linus Reichlin, "Weltgegend"
  • 2012: Matthias Nawrat, "Unternehmer"
  • 2013: Roman Ehrlich, "Das kalte Jahr"
  • 2014: Michael Fehr, "Simeliberg"
Links:
  • Der Preis erklärt
  • Der Preis noch viel ausführlicher erklärt
  • Kriterienliste 2014
  • Auswertung mit Zuschauerhilfe 2013
  • Bei der Auswertung helfen 2014
  • 38. Tage deutschsprachiger Literatur, die Kandidaten





Informationen zum Crowdfunding 2014, hier hinterlassen:

Was haben die Spender davon?

Die Spender erwarten Prämien (sogenannte "Perks"), die man nicht kaufen kann (jedenfalls nicht zu solchen Preisen): Hervorragende Bücher, von namhaften Literaturbetriebsmitgliedern benutzte Schwimmtiere oder eine luxuriöse Tretbootfahrt auf dem Wörthersee, aber auch Unikate wie eigens gedichtete Sonette von Clemens J. Setz, die Originalzeichnung "Burkhard Spinnen findet ein Haar im Text" von Tex Rubinowitz, bewährt bachmannpreisgewinnbringende Unterwäsche und ein so gut wie unveröffentlichter Eichhörnchentext von Martin Fritz (aka Mauszfabrick).


Das gestiftete Geld

wird fast vollständig an die Preisträgerin oder den Preisträger ausgeschüttet, auch wenn mehr oder weniger als 5000 Euro eingehen. Wir ziehen nur einen kleinen Betrag für die Finanzierung von Perks bzw. deren Versand und Transaktionskosten (indiegogo) ab. Die Perks stammen überwiegend aus Sachspenden.
Die Perks werden gespendet von
  • Dumont Buchverlag 
  • Rowohlt 
  • edition8 
  • Galiani Verlag
  • Nagel & Kimche (Hanser Literaturverlage)
  • Martin Fritz
  • Jo Lendle
  • Clemens J. Setz
  • Tex Rubinowitz
  • Kathrin Passig
  • Angela Leinen

Tex Rubinowitz nimmt außer Konkurrenz teil, weil er der Riesenmaschine zu nahe steht (ebenso wie Aleks Scholz 2010). Dadurch steigen die Chancen für die anderen 13 Teilnehmer!



  •

Am Sonntag, 6. Juli 2014, 10.30 Uhr wurde der

Federwelt Preis

der Automatischen Literaturkritikan den Schweizer Autor

Michael Fehr

verliehen.
Wir übergeben im Garten vor dem ORF-Theater eine Urkunde und ein Preisgeld von 5000 Euro.

Links:
Michael Fehr beim Bachmannpreis
Text: Auszüge aus "Simeliberg"
Homepage des Preisträgers

Durch eine Spende von 1000 Euro hat Sandra Uschtrin, vielen Autoren über ihr Portal autorenwelt.de und die Zeitschrift "Federwelt" bekannt, das Recht zur Preisbenennung erworben. Vielen Dank dafür!

Wir freuen uns, wenn viele Unterstützer kommen, auch fürs Foto!
Das gilt natürlich auch und besonders für die Spender von Perks: Tex Rubinowitz, Jo Lendle, Clemens Setz und Vertreter der Verlage Dumont, Rowohlt, Hanser/Nagel & Kimche, Galiani und edition 8.

Wir können 5000 Euro auszahlen, freuen uns aber immer noch über Spenden, weil die Kosten (Paypal- und Indiegogo-Gebühren, Ausgaben für Perks und Werbemittel) nur knapp gedeckt sind.

Wir nehmen noch bis Sonntag, 6.7., Spenden per Barzahlung (bei Kathrin Passig und Angela Leinen) oder Überweisung an (Mail an sopran@sopranisse.de, Bankverbindung folgt).
story_txt:
Automatische Literaturkritik - der Preis:
Alle klagen über schlechte Literatur, aber niemand bemüht sich um konstruktive Kritik und nachvollziehbare Bewertungskriterien. Jedenfalls niemand außer uns.In Klagenfurt traten auch 2014 wieder 14 Autorinnen und Autoren bei den Tagen der deutschsprachigen Literatur zum öffentlichen Wettlesen an. Eine Jury aus Literaturfachleuten bestimmt dort vor laufenden Kameras mehrere Gewinner. Weil man als Zuschauer nicht immer nachvollziehen kann, ob ein Text jetzt "rhizomatisch" oder eine "Engführung gelungen" ist oder nicht, ergänzt seit 2008 der Automatische Literaturkritik Preis das Geschehen. Mit Hilfe einer transparenten und leicht anwendbaren Liste von Plus-und Minuspunkten wird ein Preisträgertext ermittelt.Ob dieser Text dann auch wirklich der beste ist, weiß man nicht – genau wie bei den Jurypreisen. Aber dass er den Preis zu Recht bekommen hat, ist garantiert und lässt sich anhand der Kriterienliste jederzeit nachprüfen.In vielen Jahren haben die Gewinner des ALK-Preises danach noch andere Preise gewonnen (etwa Tilman Rammstedt, der außerdem mit dem Bachmannpreis und dem Publikumspreis ausgezeichnet wurde), in manchen Jahren aber auch nicht. Und weil es uns schmerzte, die Autoren in diesen anderen Jahren nur mit einer – wenn auch sehr hübschen – Urkunde und 500 Euro nach Hause gehen zu sehen, wurde das Preisgeld 2014 durch Crowdfunding aufgebracht. So konnten wir Michael Fehr am 6. Juli 2014 noch vor der offiziellen Preisverleihung 5000 Euro in bar übergeben. Premiere: Der erste Preisträger 2008Von links nach rechts: Sascha Lobo, Tilman Rammstedt freut sich über den Automatische Literaturkritik Preis 2008, Kathrin Passig, Aleks ScholzDie bisherigen Preisträger







2008: Tilman Rammstedt, "Der Kaiser von China"

2010: Dorothee Elmiger, "Einladung an die Waghalsigen"
2011: Linus Reichlin, "Weltgegend"
2012: Matthias Nawrat, "Unternehmer"
2013: Roman Ehrlich, "Das kalte Jahr"
2014: Michael Fehr, "Simeliberg"

story:
The List Campaign

What the Campaign is About: To get help and raise $2,500 to self-publish my next book, a thriller called The List.

There are two ways to live a life – in theory or in practice. One involves talking about what might happen and the other requires taking risks and letting go of the outcome. I was stuck in the first camp for a long time, which meant I preferred to turn over most of the work, the rewards and what I saw as the risk of failure to a traditional publishing house. The results are Wired, The Sitting Sisters and A Place to Call Home – three great books that have been well received. It seemed like enough.

But then in 2009 I was told I had cancer and only a one percent chance of living longer than one more year. I walked out of the doctor’s office shaking, trying to come up with something comforting to say to my 21-year-old son, Louie. Instead, he looked at me and said very firmly, “You weren’t listening. They said there was hope.” Something clicked and I realized that I was going to have to figure out how to be present for every day I had left rather than stare at my death.

It turns out that for now the doctors were wrong about the year but I’ve had four more operations for cancer since then. I’ve had to learn how to live with cancer without making it the focus and to be grateful for the rewards that come along with being reminded that life isn’t a guarantee.

The biggest reward I’ve gotten so far is learning how to ask for help from friends and family. At times I’ve really needed it because I couldn’t walk very well or because my face was bandaged and I couldn’t speak. I’ve learned that help can also be about just needing comfort and company like watching a scary movie with friends or throwing together a potluck or learning how to ride a bike again. That one took four spectacular spills but eventually I stayed on the bike. This past year I even started acting like I plan to live a long time and lost 86 pounds.

It doesn’t have to be complicated.

So, I’m doing my best to let go of old ideas about everything and learn to live in the moment. To make writing more about why I started - to share something – including the journey to get the book in your hands as well as every conversation afterwards. If you want to join in you can take a look at the different things you can get by making a donation. You can even be a part of what is turning into an amazing journey just by letting your friends know about The List Campaign. Share the link by using the share buttons on this site.

Thank you so much for your ongoing love and support. I am really looking forward to seeing what comes next, whatever it is – and to walking through it, to enjoying it with all of you.

What the Book is About:

The List is a novel of suspense about a happy family caught between two old political powers that have always existed behind the scenes, invisible to most of the public. The two sides have battled over control for hundreds of years actively recruiting new members at a young age to groom them for politics, Wall Street, Corporate corner offices and the military. Good Old Boy networks, private clubs and political action committees were all formed with the same idea in mind to grease the wheels of life because we all want to ensure a nice, fat piece of the American pie, especially for our children. However, families find out a little too late that once they’ve joined there’s no out clause.

 

What You Can Do & What You Can Get*:

  • First Level: $25 – You receive a signed copy of The List.
  • Second Level: $35 – You receive a signed copy of The List and your name in the dedication.
  • Third Level: $50 – You receive a signed copy of The List, your name in the dedication AND a password that lets you read the next three chapters of the sequel, The Keeper.
  • Fourth Level: $100 – You receive a signed copy of The List, your name in the dedication, a password that lets you read the next three chapters of the sequel, The Keeper AND a Skype visit from me to a meeting of your book club.
  • Fifth Level: $250 - You receive a signed copy of The List, your name in the dedication, a password that lets you read the next three chapters of the sequel, The Keeper, a Skype visit from me to a meeting of your book club and a character in The Keeper named after you. (Only two available at this level.)
  • Sixth Level: $250 - You receive a signed copy of The List, your name in the dedication, a password that lets you read the next three chapters of the sequel, The Keeper and a Skype visit from me to a meeting of your book club, AND an appearance by me, to speak at an event** for the local charity of your choice. All proceeds from book sales on that day will go to your charity.

 

*All rewards will be processed after March 31st at the close of the campaign.

**Event to be organized by the person or group who chooses this level. Travel and accommodations provided by person or group who choose this level.
Read more about the Author at www.MarthaCarr.com

story:
The story

Please, close your eyes and start your imagination!

Imagine the smells and fragrances of once upon a time. Imagine an old stone mansion built before 1500, in the center of a village perched at 1300 meters above sea level.

Now imagine a grandmother, a nice little old lady with the strength of two truckers, who kneads bread and then cooks it in the huge wood-fired oven in the house.

Can you hear the dry wood crackling, the smell of tomato sauce for the lasagna baking, the smell of bread slowly baking in the oven?

Granny Gioconda's Home


Well, I remember very well, because I was is in the group of children who entered like a herd of buffalo and with the hunger of a mountain lion. Five, ten children, brothers, cousins, friends entering in the middle of a summer afternoon with only one thought in mind: hunger!

My grandmother, calmly and with a smile of happiness, began to slice huge slices of bread, still warm. Imagine each of those slices as long as an arm of a child, warm and crisp.

Then, with the water pitcher, she watered each slice with the right amount of water and finally distributing the sugar on every centimeter of bread.

It is not difficult to imagine that, for a good ten minutes in the house of Grandma she did not feel a fly.


When Grandma Gioconda put a Nazi commander in his place!

Born in 1897 in St. Stefano of Sessanio, she is no longer with us since 1991, after spending 94 years as only a true Abruzzo bear can do.

In his life she always had to work and struggle to live and maintain their 5 children along with the ever present and taciturn grandfather Ferdinand.

I want to tell only a small event, to make you understand what that woman was hardening. In 1944, St. Stefano was occupied by the Nazis and made ​​it an outpost for communications.

The village at that time was, like many other villages in Italy, mainly self-sufficient because they were able to produce the food necessary to the life of the population. Fruits, vegetables, meat, sausages, cereals, cheese, bread, everything was produced and processed in the village. There were only few who could afford "luxury" goods and cars could be counted on the fingers of one hand.

With the arrival of the Nazis, the population was enslaved and forced to work to supply the military contingent stationed. Grandma told me that it was a period of considerable hardship, with little food and a lot of fear. By that time the Nazi massacre in the village of Onna, a few kilometers away.

Grandmother Gioconda worked in the oven to bake bread daily and she usually sent one of his sons to deliver bread to the command and the radio station.

That day it fell to my Uncle Nicola, age 7, to deliver the bread to the radio station installed on the Medici Tower, 20 meters high.

The tower of St. Stefano was renovated in the 80s and collapsed in the earthquake of 2009. Prior to the restructuring, I remember it perfectly, to climb the tower stairs were made ​​of wood, stuck to spiral around the circumference and without protection.

It went up by 8 yards up to the first platform, then for another 10 yards up to the top of the tower. I do not suffer from vertigo but I can assure you that it was very dangerous and it took courage to climb.

My uncle tells me that, just come on top with four loaves of bread that weighed almost as much as him, one of the soldiers began to tease him. He was a child and did not speak German, so can not tell us what they wanted, but at some point he was picked up and held back only by the ankle, leaning out from the battlements of the tower amidst the laughter of the German soldiers.

Can you imagine, 22-yards cliff on the sharp rocks of the Apennines, the screams and the horror in the eyes of that little boy.

When he came home in tears told what had happened to my grandmother who ran the command and, making their way among the armed soldiers, entered shoting the office of the Nazi commander. 

She has never wanted to say how she did it and what was said, the fact is that she obtained a public apology from the commander, an apology from the soldier and, since then, they had no more problems until the day of the retreat of the Germans.

A woman of the past, and with a temper out of the ordinary. I collected so many other testimonies about her life and I hope to be able to insert as many cameos in the upcoming book.

You get rewarded without a pledge? Zero time reward

It's unusual, I know, but I want to send you your reward in zero time! And also before you pledge!

If, after testing, you and your child/ren like my grandma's recipe, pledge and support me writing and publishing the Grandma Gioconda Recipe Book.


Are you ready for your reward? Ok, follow the pictures, it's easy like 1-2-3!

1) Take two slices of bread and put in your toaster

Tip: Choose a medium level toasting


2) When ready, watereth each slice with half espresso cup of water

Tip: Don't concentrate water and avoid edges


3) Distribute a teaspoon of sugar over the entire surface of each slice

Tip: ..., ... ok, no tips!! Sprinkle at will :-) 


Now eat it, don't wait!! 

The slice must be half crunchy and half soft, with the edges still warm and the sugar melting on the surface.

Bread, Water and Sugar!!


Nutritional Fact

Yeah, ok, maybe it's unnecessary, but look at this nutritional fact for a single slice of Bread, Water and Sugar and compare it with your child preferred snack:


Some words on Santo Stefano di Sessanio

Far from me the idea to write here a sneak copy of Wikipedia, what can I say is that St. Stefano is a must see place, almost one time in life.

Actually is like a hitted lion, full of signs of the terrible hearthquake of five years ago. Reconstruction is made difficult becase each single house is connected and embedded in other buildings. The whole village was built centuries ago as a continuous wall for protection reasons.

Santo Stefano di Sessanio Photobook (Free eBook from Lulu.com)

The Tower before and after earthquake


The Lake Church in '70s and today



Licensing

The recipe described is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0

story:
A Book that Bends the Imagination

“A powerful yet very accessible voice - just right for telling stories.”  - Margot C. - Glasgow U.K.

My book - Somewhere in a Town You Never Knew Existed Somewhere, is a quirky collection of prose pieces, and a book that wanted to write itself. The characters implored me to speak about injustice, vulnerability, and sensitivity in a world that reveres power and force. They wanted me to speak directly to society's "elephants" in the living room - through kooky hooliganism and satire. And in allowing the voices of small children, elephants, cows, butterflies, and the broken hearted to speak through me, the book became a voice for the voiceless, calling out gentle songs for this fragile place we call home. I care deeply about the earth and our environment, and this book is dedicated to that cause. 

My name is Nina Hart, and I’m seeking support to publish my first book and strategize and launch tours where I will perform pieces from the book, and offer workshops. I love to speak these stories out loud  - and I’m excited to share the zany wisdom of the voice that finds its way through me (and anyone if they will let it) because I’ve seen how powerfully its expression touches others and inspires them to unleash their own creative impulses onto the world. I believe that’s what this world needs more of: creative people who trust their childish muse.

Praise for Nina's Writing:

"Nina Hart is a writer and mentor and community activist like no other. Reading her wild and funny and haunting work, learning from her as a liberating and brilliant teacher, working at her side on the causes of awakening, you will be reminded of the descriptions of an “impact site.” Nina helps you remember that, as a result of something believable and incredible and natural and magical, words hit you, burrow into you, invite you to hear what is echoing inside you and beyond you. My wife (the author Christine Hale) and I support Nina Hart’s Indiegogo campaign because we wish for the impact of her rare voice to penetrate the hard shell of this conservative and restrictive moment in American literary culture." 

-Kevin McIlvoy, author,The Complete History of New Mexico & Other Stories; faculty, MFA Program in Creative Writing at Warren Wilson College; Board of Directors, Associated Writers and Writing Programs and Council of Literary Magazines and Presses & Christine Hale, author, Basil’s Dream; faculty, Antioch University – Los Angeles Low-Residency MFA Program.

Written in an improvisatory manner, characters in Somewhere In A Town You Never Knew Existed Somewhere skid apart and reunite, stories connect and disconnect. The reader may chuckle, smirk or feel their mouths drop open, but no doubt they will be pulled along like a child running through a field, discovering things in a funny, surreal, magical world. The stories are raw and dreamlike, breaking time/space reality rules, committing literary misdemeanors and requiring the reader not only have an imagination but be willing to stretch it beyond normal fictional boundaries. The stories have sweet simplicity, and they also have psychotic breaks.

The Impact

Testimonials from the community:

"Her voice is utterly unique - like a radical new art form that flows with the cadences of nature while illuminating the depths of human feeling. What a tremendous and completely intact gift she's been given."  - Karuna H. - Austin TX
"Nina's writing is brilliantly cinematic, playful and freeing. As an artist it eggs me on. When I read her work I hear myself say - you're allowed to do that?"- Bonnie F. - Asheville NC
“When I started Nina's class, I had mostly not written for two years - and was starting to wonder if I was still a writer. Now I'm on fire for writing, and I know that Nina's class played a significant role in that. She is a truly creative soul - and a phenomenal cheerleader, coach, and creativity instigator.” - Majo M. - Asheville NC

About me: I am a writer, performer, and Creativity Coach trained in the Kaizen-Muse method. I live in the beautiful Smoky Mountains of Asheville, NC. My work has appeared in MadSwirl, Black Fox Literary Magazine, The Ghazal Page, and in the audio magazine 4’33 in London, England. Somewhere in a Town you Never Knew Existed Somewhere is my first book of prose poetry, and I am especially fond of performing my stories. I was also an original member of Sara Shelton Mann’s experimental dance troupe Contraband, in San Francisco, and, playing a purple electric bass, have recorded and performed with numerous bands. Over the past few years I’ve developed a unique method of teaching called “Writing from the Top of your Head,” which combines group Creativity Coaching with creative writing. www.writingfromthetopofyourhead.com

What We Need & What You Get

What the $5000 is for:

Design and layout of book

Print on-demand guidance for Amazon / CreateSpace

Printing costs

Cover art, graphics and design

Pre-publication tasks such as author and book pages (Amazon, facebook), pre-publication reviews and endorsements (query, summary, and research)

Creation of marketing packages to send out to prospective teaching/performance/reading venues

Creation of outreach letter and blueprint for tours

Create book web page with book title as URL as link to other sites

Video for Indiegogo, Amazon page etc.

RRBowker ISBN number block 

With whatever is leftover, I will pay myself a stipend so I have more time to work on all of this! Time is a beautiful thing!

Publishing and touring involves a huge amount of work and part of these funds will go to pay my “navigator” Judy Herzl, in Santa Fe NM. Judy is a rockin’ marketing professional, and doesn’t mess around. We want to get this done.

I enthusiastically invite you to hop aboard and join us in any way you deem possible. With your help, we will all be supporting and affirming the creation of new paradigms and outspoken hooligan-like experiments in performance, writing, and teaching. 

If 100 people donate $25, I would be halfway to my goal.

Depending on your level of financial contribution, I have exciting and fun creative perks! Please read on!

Other Ways You Can Help

Help me grow my network. Support my project. Any amount large or small will make a difference in helping to make my book project come to fruition. I invite you to become a member of my “team” by sending the word out to your circles. Please share with all your friends and contacts. If you would like to email your list on behalf of this project, let me know. I would love to make you a part of this team effort.

With love and heartfelt gratitude to you and all my friends, family, and artistic allies, who have believed in me and given me such phenomenal, steadfast encouragement. Please know that your support is beyond priceless.

Nina

Share on Facebook.

Blog  Somewhere in a Town You Never Knew Existed Somewhere.

Tweet Somewhere in a Town You Never Knew Existed Somewhere.

*SPECIAL thanks to Badria Jazairi for voiceover, Bing for the song "Thirsty Child," Josiane Keller for elephant book cover photo, and Michael Hadley for video. 

"You must use your voice. Use it to express yourself, to help others, to change the world."  - Leo Babauta

story:
Hi, my name is Maribeth McKenzie MacDonald and I am the lucky wife of Tom MacDonald. Let me tell you about him... He runs a food pantry in Charlestown, MA. He is a great guy and an amazing writer! Really -- he is.  He has already written two award-winning crime novels and is ready to publish his third.  His first two novels--The Charlestown Connection and Beyond the Bridge--were published by Oceanview Publishing.  His two-book obligation is now fulfilled with Oceanview, and we decided to publish his third novel, The Revenge of Liam McGrew, ourselves.  
Our goal is to raise $5,000 to cover marketing costs. Here is what we plan to do:
Take out an ad in the Library Journal 
Radio Advertising on the Irish hit Parade (Did I tell you his book takes place in Boston and Belfast?) and WATD Marshfield (Maybe Steve Sweeney will give it an extra plug on his Tuesday night show with Joe Malone.)
Advertising at local movie theaters (You know those riveting ads before the movie)
Ads in local newspapers
TV Ad - Charlie Moore's Fishing Show (Did you see the one with Ken Casey from Dropkick Murphys? or the one with Luis Tiant?)
Promotions using social media (that's my department);
You get the idea!
Let me tell you about the perks!
First, you will love his novels and will be so excited to see your name in print! Yes, YOU can be a major or a minor character in Tom's fourth novel, An Unlucky Break.  Makes a great present for the person who has everything!
Lunch or dinner with the author!- He is really funny and likes to eat!  (don't tell him I said that)
Invitation to the book launching party for The Revenge of Liam McGrew!
Listed as a supporter in the acknowledgments of The Revenge of Liam McGrew.
Signed copies of Tom's novels.
and more...
O.K. The bottom line is this... The Revenge of Liam McGrew is a great story! WE need great stories - Help us reach as many readers as possible.  Hey, you never know, it could become a movie.  (even if we film it ourselves on our phone)
I thank you from the bottom my heart!
Maribeth
P.S.  Help us get the word out.   Every donation is deeply appreciated!

story:
¿Qué?

Estación para fugados es una historia acerca de los viajes iniciáticos, una trama de superación (quizás también de madurez), donde el enemigo más temible está dentro de uno mismo.

Fernando Nassau dirige un taller de narrativa en el barrio de Legazpi, en Madrid. En torno a este lugar y su director de ceremonias se despliegan las ficciones en las que trabajan estos escritores noveles, pero también sus rutinas vitales, sus deseos, sus vidas imaginadas.

La novela sigue los pasos de estos personajes, sus días llenos de confusión, donde escribir se vuelve una forma de resistencia. O  simplemente un engaño, un disfraz.

 Estación para fugados es una novela sobre la literatura y la insatisfacción, sobre cómo a veces nos fugamos a otras vidas incapaces de explorar la nuestra hasta saciarnos, donde su autor, Raúl Cazorla, disecciona, en un estilo minimalista, despojado de adornos innecesarios, las frágiles costuras de la identidad, que estallan el día menos pensado. Una de las preguntas que ya estaban presentes en Kubrick en los muelles, el brillante debut en la ficción de Raúl Cazorla, Estación para Fugados busca responder a por qué necesitamos refugiarnos en la ficción para sobrevivir.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Raúl Cazorla.

Profesor, periodista cultural y narrador, colabora con los medios Perroverde, Jotdown y El Varapalo. Ha publicado hasta la fecha el libro de relatos Kubrick en los muelles (Editorial Terracota, Ciudad de México, 2014) y el ensayo Narrativa policiaca y periodismo de investigación: relaciones consentidas (FronteraD, Madrid, 2015).

Raúl Cazorla os sorprenderá.

Además, la obra contará con el prólogo de Luisgé Martín, Premio Ramón Gómez de la Serna, Premio del Tren "Antonio Machado" de Cuento y Premio Vargas Llosa NH de relatos... todo un lujo que no debe pasarse por alto.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 800€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Estación para fugados que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Raúl Cazorla vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
The 100 Poem Challenge

Hello, folks! On 6th-7th October 2015 I'm going to be writing 100 poems in 48 hours to raise money for The Book Bus, a wonderful charity that sends mobile libraries to communities in various places across Africa, Asia and South America to help children learn to read, provide teaching materials and create school libraries.  

  • On the 6th-7th I'll be posting the poems online as I write them at http://100poemchallenge.blogspot.com Before then, if you'd like to, please tweet me tag words using the hashtag #100PoemChallenge - I'll use some of these as titles of poems or to spark off ideas when the time comes.

  • Any amount that you could donate would be very much appreciated: £1, £2, whatever you can spare. I've set the goal at £1000 but I would love to raise as much money as possible - as I'm sure you'll agree: stories are a huge part of what makes us who we are, and reading is a skill that should be available to every child.
  • There are also two perks that you can purchase: a handwritten poem on a postcard at £5 (I'll be handwriting each of the 100 poems on postcards after the event) and a limited edition poetry pamphlet of all of the poems for £10. Both of these can be shipped to anywhere in the world. All proceeds go to The Book Bus.

About The Book Bus

See recent amazing activity from The Book Bus on their Facebook and Twitter

& from their website:

The Book Bus supports schools by providing mobile library facilities and volunteer story-tellers to help children become confident and literate readers for life. Working mainly with rural schools in Zambia, Malawi, India and Ecuador, our volunteer crew divide huge classes into small groups and inspire the children to read by personalizing the reading experience through story-telling, assisted reading practice and creative arts. This simple and effective support is sustained by provision of books and resources to each school library. Each Book Bus and its volunteer crew supports a cluster of five schools for up to three months. We make weekly visits to these schools working with up to 800 children from the cluster. The project finishes with an end of term party and opening of a new school library.

Registered Charity No: 1117357

About Jen

Jen Campbell is the Sunday Times bestselling author of the ‘Weird Things Customers Say in Bookshops’ series and ‘The Bookshop Book.’ She’s also an award-winning poet and short story writer; her poetry pamphlet 'The Hungry Ghost Festival' is published by The Rialto, and she runs a Youtube channel over at www.youtube.com/jenvcampbell where she discusses all things books. You can read more of her poetry here.

story:
Summary

The purpose of this campaign is to provide schools and youth organizations with a FREE updated digital version of the Whiz Teens in Business book, a book for kids and teenagers who want to start their own business. The book has started being used by schools and has even been bought by the The Montgomery Alabama School Board for their students, through the Small Business development Center, College of Business Administration of the Alabama State University.

A new cover is being created, illustrations inside the book are being replaced, the chapter on using technology for doing business is being updated and a couple of  very important chapters are being added to discuss self-esteem, limiting emotions and the proper mindset for success.

A PR and email campaign will be done to inform schools and youth organizations of the free interactive PDF format for their students and members.

Included in the interactive digital book are online videos demonstrating more complex topics such as making a budget and revenue projections. For the Table of Contents, go to www.whizventures.com/whizteenstoc.html

About Myself

I have always been an entrepreneur for as long as I can remember. I started writing books when I was 14. I started working for a large telecommunication company when I was 18.

In the 1990s, being self-employed myself, I started an association for self-employed people who were practically persecuted at the time, myself included. We were considered pariahs with no regular income, working out of the dark basement. For instance, in those days, when the telephone company found out you were working from home it cut off your home phone service with no warning and forced you to subscribe to an expensive commercial service. So, with a colleague mine, we were able to completely reverse the situation and obtain recognition for self-employed people from governments, financial institutions and telecommunication companies. Several government programs were created based on our research and our work.

In those days I also started taking full advantage of what the early Web and first commercial browser had to offer, because I saw from early on the potential it had for small businesses. During that time I built on the knowledge and experience I already had and realized that this information could definitely benefit young people.  To view my full bio, go to www.whizventures.com/bio.html

The job market has been very difficult for several years and even decades now. Young people need to have some hope and know that they don’t need to necessarily depend on employers to accomplish great things. All they need is some ideas and the necessary knowledge.

I have worked in small businesses and large corporations and have an extensive knowledge of business and the Web, and I am specialized in online learning. I wrote “Leading Your Business Into the Future With the Internet” in 1999. Unfortunately, one makes little or no money when dealing with publishers.

This is why I wrote and self-published the first edition of the Whiz Teens in Business book. I wanted to share my business knowledge with those who needed it the most. The first paperback edition of the book was purchased by several schools and is used by teachers to teach business principles to young people. This book needs to become more widely available in schools worldwide.

The upcoming 2014 edition of the book contains additional chapters and will be available in several formats. First, new Web and social media information needs to be added to the technology chapter. Second, self-esteem, dealing with limiting emotions and having the right mindset are crucial in order to be successful, so a couple of chapters are being added to show how to program the mind for success. And the cover has been redesigned to reflect today’s reality more closely.

But the main features of this book are that it will take full advantage of technology by integrating tutorials right inside the book. And this campaign is to make the book available for free to schools and youth organizations that want to use it in their curriculum. 

What I Need

Material like new photos and illustrations for preparing a book is expensive, and so is producing interactive material for the book. Making resources available on the Internet is not free. Reaching out to the vast network of schools and libraries is very costly. Furthermore, when things are offered for free, they may not be perceived as having any value. But having the Whiz Teens in Business book sponsored in a major way gives it an added value for those who receive it.

The campaign consists in obtaining lists of contacts, sending out emails to schools and youth organizations, sending out press releases, social media activity and word of mouth. I need your help to accomplish this.

What You Get

Whether all or part of the funds is raised, the book will be published and distributed. Not raising all of the funds will simply make the book distribution process slower, and more funds will mean that the distribution can be accelerated with more help. It may also allow me to make personal appearances when requested, to talk to future entrepreneurs.

$5 – Gets you my deep gratitude and an advanced copy of the digital book.

$10 –  Gets you an advanced copy of the digital book and your name in the book as a supporter.

$35 –  Gets you one paperback copy of the book (unsigned), an advanced copy of the digital book and your name in the book as a supporter. Shipping included in North America. Other destinations please add $10 for shipping.

$60 –  Gets you one signed paperback copy, an advanced copy of the digital book, personal thank you printed at the end of the book and your name on the book website as a supporter.

$100 –  Gets you five signed paperback copies one week before the official launch, an advanced copy of the digital book, personal thank you printed at the end of the book and your name on the book website as a supporter.  You will also receive an invitation to the online launch and your name on the book website as a supporter.

$500 –  Gets you ten signed paperback copies one week before the official launch, an advanced copy of the digital book, plus you will be listed in the book as a major sponsor with a dedication on the first pages. You will also receive an invitation to the online launch and your name on the book website as a supporter.

$1,000 –  Gets you everything you get with the $500 contribution, PLUS the priceless extra: a series of 5 personal online sessions with Skype to get rid of the effect of old traumatic emotions and to acquire the proper mindset for success, whether you are an entrepreneur or not.

The Impact

The interactive PDF will be available on-demand, to schools and youth organizations that request it after being informed of the free option. By offering the book for free to schools, the book becomes accessible to over 5 million children in over 15,000 schools in Canada, and to over 49 million children in over 95,000 schools in the U.S., and who knows to how many more in the rest of the world.

Even children in the most remote locations, everywhere on the planet, will benefit from high quality business material. It should be noted that children with typical entrepreneurial profiles are prime dropout candidates, so having a business topic is an asset to retain them in school.

Children worldwide should have access to a good life and have options for succeeding in their career.

The Whiz Teens in Business book reveals the Secrets to Business Success! It shows you how to…

 • Lower your risks while getting better results by learning how to “Plan Your Work and Work Your Plan”.

 • Establish credibility with potential customers, as well as lenders and investors, by creating a solid business plan they will respect.

 • Learn the language of business to look and sound like a Pro. This book reveals the secret meaning of all the business jargon and terms, and makes them easy for you to understand.

 • Have all the paperwork laid out for you on a platter: business forms, invoices, agreements... This books offers templates and makes them easy to use.

 • Learn insiders’ secrets that will give your business a quick boost. Learn about business etiquette, how to use the World Wide Web and many other topics that will give you an edge and put your business on a stellar course!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, we still need all the help we can get, so please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign and among schools and youth organizations! Use the Indiegogo tools with your social media!


And that’s it, folks! Thank you in advance!

story:
Tired of "impossible" children?

Allow me to introduce you to "It is okay to ride a bike in a pajamas" -How to raise a selfloving superstar,- a book about parenting and authentic children with a super self esteem.

This book is written to professionals, parents and teenagers, that wants to let go of  self sabotaging patterns and beliefs and instead nurture the authenticity factor for themselves as well as future generations.

WARNING!

When you read this book, there's a huge possibility that you'll get wiser on childrens love language, mindfulness, family values, and how you guide your child to be a selfloving superstar that has the ability and courage to be themselves, no matter what.

EXTRA BONUS: you learn the same!

The book will provide you with tools so you as a parent or professional can let go of your limitations and self sabotaging stories and become even better at being you and letting go of the need for external recognision


What others say about the danish version of the book:

"This is the book I wished, we've read before we had our children 12 years ago. I highly recommend it because it provides you with amazing tools and the book is well structured and filled with cool learning that inspire you" Sine Larsen Unicef ambassador
  

"I have just had the most incredible reading experience - both as a preofessional as well as a grandmother. Christina have created a book on how to create children with high selfworth, and I salute her. There are so many AHA moments and very useful tools. I really wish I've read it when I was a new mother."
Belinda Donkin, relationship therapist, heartmath specialist
  

"Your new book is fabulous. You've provided a bunch of usuful knowledge. I highly recommend the book to others". Kim Mejer
  

I've become so much wiser because I found some great tools to work not only on my own self esteeem but my daughters as well. Furthermore I've gained new perspectives on how to solve our conflicts and other challenges in our home. The book is hearfelt, engaging and can easily be read by parents, professionals working with children. Even teenagers can benefit from reading this book end become aware of their own story and history.
Online magasin EJSIKKENLEG

 

WHO AM I?


Let me introduce myself, so you have an idea about what I stand for and how I contribute to this World.

I'm a transformation expert and author. I'm helping people transform their blueprint so that they can live a much more authentic life, filled with more happiness, love, success and inner peace.

I've already published two books in Denmark about authenticity, and I have been working with tranformation for over a decade.

The first book is about helping people to get rid of the people pleaser syndrom and it was a huge success in Denmark. The book reached thousands of people, that transformed their life.

My latest published book is about how to create authentic children with a super high self esteem and selfworth.

I believe we're all born as authentic unique shining souls filled with happiness and selflove but during our childhood we're being messured and told all the wrong and bad things we do, which create a lot of shadows, underlying commitments and beliefs that control our future and our self believe on what we can do and not do.

I'm extremely passionated about changing humanity into becoming much more loving, especially selfloving, and have a fundamental happiness because then we don't need to judge and point fingers of other people and furthermore we don't have to fear other peoples reactions and judgment of us.

I believe it will create a better balance not only to the individual but to the entire World,  but we need to start raising our children in a different way. We need to focus on all the things they do right and we definitely have to focus on building their fundament (selfworth) instead of their rooftop (self confidence)

So in order for me to get my message out there, and I know it will make such a huge difference, not only at this moment but in the future as well, because the philosofy will create authentic future leaders that are able to lead from both their Heart and their head, I need to raise Money to have my book translated and published.


How to create happy children even right before dinner!

The Funding is solely to have the book translated into english and have it published through Balboa press which is a devision of Hay House. And they have already accepted the book but I need to raise the money.

So your contribution will help me get my passion published through the biggest publishing company in my industry as well as giving me the opportunity to reach more parents in the world. I believe it's crucial we start doing things differently, so we prevent and stop school shooting, bullying, depressions, suicide etc.


I believe in the beauty of the human being and with the right tools we're all shining stars with a enormous talent. We just need to allow ourselves and others to shine


Love & Light

YOUR GREATNESS IS MY PASSION

Christina Aros

story:
What is Jewel of the Thames?

Jewel of the Thames is the debut novel of author Angela Misri. An historical young adult book, it centres around Portia Adams and her mysterious past.

Here's the blurb:

There’s a new detective at 221 Baker Street

Set against the background of 1930s England, Jewel of the Thames introduces Portia Adams, a budding detective with an interesting — and somewhat mysterious — heritage.

Nineteen-year-old Portia Adams has always been inquisitive. There’s nothing she likes better than working her way through a mystery. When her mother dies, Portia puzzles over why she was left in the care of the extravagant Mrs. Jones but doesn’t have long to dwell on it before she is promptly whisked from Toronto to London by her new guardian. Once there Portia discovers that she has inherited 221 Baker Street — the former offices of Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson.

Portia settles into her new home and gets to know her downstairs tenants, including the handsome and charming Brian Dawes. She also finds herself entangled in three cases: the first involving stolen jewelry, the second a sick judge and the final case revolving around a kidnapped child. But the greatest mystery of all is her own. How did she come to inherit this townhouse? And why did her mother keep her heritage from her? Portia has a feeling Mrs. Jones knows more than she is letting on. In fact, she thinks her new guardian may be the biggest clue of all.


Who is Portia Adams?

When we opened submissions to the rest of Canada this summer, we knew that we would be reading some amazing Canadian young adult lit. And we did! But from the moment we were whipped into Portia Adams’ world, we knew Jewel of the Thames was a book that we wanted to publish.

Portia is one of those characters that you just want to get to know better. Far from perfect, she’s intriguing and readers will easily be carried along on her adventures.


Why support this campaign?

Well that’s no mystery! For the love of books. And tea. And awesome swag. And to show your support for indie publishers and the amazing authors who sign with them.


How can you support Jewel of the Thames?

Of course, the best way to show your support would be to preorder Jewel of the Thames through this Indiegogo campaign. But there are other ways that you can support it.  Buy a copy for a friend.  Or simply share the link to the campaign on Twitter and Facebook. Helping us get the word out about Jewel of the Thames and Portia Adams is awesome.


Where will the money go?

Here’s a breakdown of where your money will go when you opt in to one of our levels:

Editing: $500

Interior illustrations: $800

Cover design: $600

Books for the launch: $315

Marketing and promotion: $800

Indiegogo fulfillment costs: $1,700

story:
Breve reseña

Los colaboradores financian ideas con las que se sienten apasionados y a la gente en la que confían. Estas son algunas cosas que puedes hacer en esta sección:

  • Preséntate y cuenta tu historia.
  • Describe brevemente tu campaña y explica por qué es importante para ti.
  • Expresa la magnitud de lo que logrará la ayuda de los colaboradores.

Recuerda, sé breve pero personal. Pregúntate: si alguien dejara de leer aquí, ¿estaría listo para colaborar?

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Presenta más detalles:

  • explica cuánto financiamiento necesitas y a dónde va. Sé transparente y específico, la gente necesita confiar en ti para que quiera financiarte.
  • Cuéntale a la gente sobre tus recompensas exclusivas. ¡Haz que se entusiasmen!
  • Describe a dónde van los fondos si no logras la meta total.

El impacto

Explica tu campaña en mayor detalle y cuéntale a la gente la diferencia que hará su contribución:

  • explica por qué tu proyecto es valioso para el colaborador y para el mundo.
  • Describe tu historial de éxito en proyectos como este (si lo tienes).
  • Haz que la gente lo sienta real y genera confianza.

Riesgos y desafíos

Las personas valoran tu transparencia. Sé abierto y destácate al proveer perspectivas sobre los riesgos y obstáculos que puedes enfrentar en el camino hacia lograr tu meta.

  • Comparte lo que hace que te destaques para superar estos obstáculos.
  • Describe tu plan para solucionar estos desafíos.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Algunas personas no pueden colaborar, pero eso no significa que no puedan ayudar:

  • pídele a la gente que difunda tu campaña y que genere eco.
  • Recuérdale que use las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.

Y eso es todo.
story_txt:
Breve reseña Los colaboradores financian ideas con las que se sienten apasionados y a la gente en la que confían. Estas son algunas cosas que puedes hacer en esta sección:  
Preséntate y cuenta tu historia.  Describe brevemente tu campaña y explica por qué es importante para ti.  Expresa la magnitud de lo que logrará la ayuda de los colaboradores.  
Recuerda, sé breve pero personal. Pregúntate: si alguien dejara de leer aquí, ¿estaría listo para colaborar?    Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes Presenta  más detalles: 
explica cuánto financiamiento necesitas y a dónde va. Sé transparente y específico, la gente necesita confiar en ti para que quiera financiarte.   Cuéntale a la gente sobre tus recompensas exclusivas. ¡Haz que se entusiasmen!  Describe a dónde van los fondos si no logras la meta total.  
  El impacto Explica tu campaña en mayor detalle y cuéntale a la gente la diferencia que hará su contribución:  
explica por qué tu proyecto es valioso para el colaborador y para el mundo.  Describe tu historial de éxito en proyectos como este (si lo tienes).  Haz que la gente lo sienta real y genera confianza.  
  Riesgos y desafíos  Las personas valoran tu transparencia. Sé abierto y destácate al proveer perspectivas sobre los riesgos y obstáculos que puedes enfrentar en el camino hacia lograr tu meta. 
Comparte lo que hace que te destaques para superar estos obstáculos. Describe tu plan para solucionar estos desafíos. 
  Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar  Algunas personas no pueden colaborar, pero eso no significa que no puedan ayudar:  
pídele a la gente que difunda tu campaña y que genere eco.  Recuérdale que use las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo. 
  Y eso es todo.

story:
'Into the Kimchi pot' tells the story of a mother and a teenage boy travelling together in South Korea. While overcoming cultural obstacles they both tell their story with doses of humor and irony. This story will open a window to the Korean culture as well as to the relationship between the two travelers. From spending time in public sauna and getting massage they weren't expecting, or spending the night together in a love motel, eating food way too spicy and riding the subway in rush hour, all those stories and many more are told in the funniest way by mother and son. 
    With an honorary B.A. degree in psychology and a Master degree in development policy, I am always a happy observer of cultures, societies and of people in particular and I dive gladly into the vast ocean of human behavior and characters. The more I observe, the more I realize how little I know. As a mother of three boys, I know that those three boys can teach me something new with every day that goes by. All I need to do is to listen to what is said and to what isn’t. 
   As a former employee in the Foreign Ministry I had the good fortune of living for long periods of time in different places in the world and getting to know different cultures, South Korea is one of these places. It made me realize how open minded I have to be in everything in life. This book tells the story of Korea from a different angle and will tell you about things you don't usually read in a guide book. Just like sitting with friends over coffee and listening to their tale about the last vacation they took in a funny, revealing and honest way. 
   With the help I will be getting from you, dear contributors, I will be able to publish the book through a self-publishing agency. This book later can be bought by any bookstore, kindle or other version of E-book and get to as many people as possible. Part of the money is dedicated to marketing the book as part of the publishing deal. I hope that six months from now, you will be able to see this book on the shelves in your favorite bookstore's travel section. The aim is to raise $2500 which is the publishing deal I was offered. This book will be published "By hook or by crook', as we say, so any amount of money I will raise will go to the publishing. I would appreciate your help by funding but also by talking about this campaign. Let your friends know about it. People who love to travel, people who have been to Korea or know Korean people, people who love to laugh and even just mothers with teenaged boys or anyone who has seen PSY with his song 'Kangnam Style'. Everyone will find something funny in the book and that is my aim; to make people smile while reading it.
 Please share and thank you for your help.
A short teaser:

   "The subway we got on was full to the rim. As it was, I could not even see who was spooning me so comfortably from behind. Trying to keep the panic out of my voice, I cracked jokes with the chick, a thing that had attracted some lady's attention. She kept sending us looks and then, at one point, turned to me and said: 'Your son is very handsome. Girls must like him a lot'. After thanking her, I thought it was my parental responsibility to teach the chick some manners so I asked him to thank the good lady. The chick, with a lovely smile, turned and from zero distance blew his thanks into the good lady's face, heavily coated with the smell of onion and who knows what else. In slow motion, I saw the flinch and the horror but there was nothing I could do.
It is forever engraved in the stones: handsome but stinks."

story:
Hello. My name is Jaidon Wells. I’m a professional LGBTQIA romance writer, and I’m staring down the face of eventual disability.

In May of 2012, I was injured at my job in an assisted living home, a knee injury that required two and a half months of physical therapy to get me walking again. At the time, my orthopedist advised me to pass over surgery to repair what he said was minor damage to the knee—listening to that advice turned out to be an incredibly stupid mistake.

A year later, I got a desperately needed second job as an assisted manager in a restaurant, which requires me to work 12 hour shifts on my feet. What started out as minor knee pain after my shifts has progressed to constant, severe pain and the need to wear a knee brace at all times just to be able to walk. The damage to my knee my orthopedist told me was minor has turned out to be anything but and only becomes worse every time I walk. I’ve been told that elective surgery is no longer optional: either I get it now or the damage to my knee continues to compound every time I’m on my feet until, eventually, I won’t be able to walk, at all. 

The problem? I have no health insurance and work two low wage jobs, neither of which is legally required to help me under workers comp laws in Texas. I have to pay for the surgery out of pocket and no matter what way I look at it, I’m going to come out several thousand dollars short of paying for it myself.

I don’t want handouts, though. So what I decided to do in exchange for donations was to put my writing skills to use: I’m opening up to commissions of any sort (the price ranges of which are listed as perks). If you’d like to commission me just choose whichever perk your heart may desire, then take a screenshot of your donation confirmation page and attach it to an email with your story prompt and anything you might specifically want to see in it in the body of the email to jaidonwells(at)outlook(dot)com. I will email your completed story back to whatever address the email is sent from, so be sure that it’s one you check. I will send you a confirmation that I’ve received your prompt when I get it.

Other authors and artists doing commissions for this project are listed on this page. Should you wish to commission one of them instead simply make a donation here for the appropriate amount, screenshot your donation confirmation, and submit it along with what you would like to commission from them to their personal blogs (all linked from that page, aside from Travis, who can be contacted through that blog).

EDIT: The amazing Sasha Miller is now doing commissions for this project. Her commission prices are the same as those listed on this page, but she has a few rules in regards to what she'll write (which is strictly original fiction):

Commission nets the commissioner one story dedicated to them and based on a prompt from them. Prompts can include characters from an existing ‘verse of hers or something original, but she won’t write something that interferes with (1) sequel or WIP plans or (2) canon for existing stories. Commissioners can offer multiple prompts, in which case she will try to incorporate as many as possible or pick from the offered prompts. She writes all genres and across the LGBTQ spectrum. She does not write dub/non-con, character torture and does not guarantee any sexually explicit content. Stories will be delivered within a year of the commission drive ending (and probably much sooner).

Slots for 10K, 15K, and 20K stories are limited to five.

story:
Assist in the pre-sale/fundraising campaign to bring this deck to print.

On the right side of the screen are ways you can help.

From sharing the link to this site with your friends, to buying a deck, every little bit uplifts!

Thanks in advance!


~~~

to help an artist

see their project come to life

is a special gift
 

Some time ago, deep in my heart, I came upon a wellspring of Haiku. There were times when couldn't get them on to the paper before another one came. There is nothing conventional about these Haiku (aside from the 5, 7, 5) but  each holds a valuable piece of wisdom gleaned from my

life of wonder and fulfillment. 


I sat on them for some time, not sure how to share them with others.

A book? That didn't really feel right.

Then it came...

Of course!!! A deck of inspirational cards.

 


 

Writing the haiku was the easy part. Then there was choosing which to include. I was so

connected to each one that it wasn't easy to just pick fifty or so. Manhandling Indesign and Illustrator  took months, and quite a bit of blood, sweat, and tears... But I did it!


 

I have compiled the haiku. Completed the artwork, layout and set-up of a deck of cards fifty+ in all. They are ready for print. Like so many projects- they are waiting for the finances for

production to materialize.


 

That's where you come in...

 


 

I realized that although it felt good to do it all by myself; it was time to really open up to others

and allow support. One of the bravest things one can do is ask for help. And a wonderful way to

offer an opportunity to be of assistance. Now it's time to bring these babies to print!

what I give to you

comes back to me in my heart

and so I give more

 
When I share my observations with another person, and they feel invigorated, or wiser, or just a
little bit better than they did before they came, then I gain from that experience as well. It is a sharing, and hopefully a receiving that benefits everyone involved. I look forward to the
opportunity to turn the wheels in a few more minds... maybe start up a few conversations.
I hope to see these cards inspire may people to look inside for more questions. It's the only way
to find the answers.





how bout we call it

the new way to start a biz

pre-sale with some perks

 
My goal is to wholesale the deck and get it out to stores ASAP. In order to do that they must sell
at wholesale cost.
When it comes to printing, the more you print, the cheaper the cost. Only thing is, the more you
print, the more you have to outlay. So even though it is less per piece, one has to buy more
pieces.

Thus the costly upstart costs of self publishing.

I have found my printer, and I am Excited!

Where is the money from this campaign going? What happens if I do not reach my goal, you ask?

Below is the breakdown including boxing, shrink wrapping each deck and shipping to me (I will cover all shipping costs to fulfill any perk you claim) :




  • When I reach my goal ($8,500) I print 2500 decks at a cost that allows me to wholesale a fair and reasonable price (half of the wholesale rate    while creating the capital to promote the deck and perhaps print a second run.
 
  • If I reach only part of my goal I will print as many decks as I am able to do so with the funds raised.


Whether or not my goal is reached, I will honor every perk claimed.
I have every intention of publishing Haiku for Thought, it is just a matter of when in 2012 that is.
Everyone who contributes to this campaign will see their fruition, and I can't wait to fulfill!!




THERE ARE lots of  PERKS!!!!

 

and what kind of perks you ask?

 

just scroll down my friend

 
  • The opportunity to purchase decks in the pre-sale at a lower than retail rate
  • Your own personal haiku delivered to your inbox
  • A personal reading from the deck by me (Rachel Marco-Havens) in person or via skype, depending on location
  • Merit: help an aspiring writer to see her art come to print!


Other ways to help

you can share this with your friends

spread the haiku word


The easiest way is to share this link with your people.

For me, the best thing about facebook and twitter... myspace-- networking online in general, is to bring each other to the world! Play with networking and promote the endeavors of others.

Street teams baby! IndieGoGo is a great way to take it to the streets! Feel free to use the tools they have so graciously provided!

Their motto: "DIWO- Do it with others."
It's always more fun and Effective that way

story:
YES!!! We did it! Thanks to everyone for your generous contributions... without you we wouldn't have reached our goal. In just 50 days we raised over $5,000. We're now working hard to get the books ready (and making the chocolates) so that we can share them with you.

All the books are now available to order directly through the Treehouse Press website.

Again, thanks so much for all your amazing support throughout the Campaign, and thanks to IndieGoGo for creating a space for this to happen.


Watch the video about the 3-in-1 Treehouse Campaign

We are Treehouse Press. A small independent publishing house based in London. We publish beautiful books of short stories and poems and graphic stories of no more than 60 pages. We strive for edgy, experimental, diverse and lyrical work. We believe that a book - like a good treehouse - is a place to play and be still and meditate and fortify ourselves for when we go back out into the world.

Last year we launched our first Three-in-One Chapbook Contest. This year we're about to publish the three winning entries. We raised some cash through competition entries - thanks to everyone for submitting work! - but we need some more to publish the chapbooks in November 2011.    

Think of this campaign as a cross between a donation and a way to pre-order your copies.


We're excited to be publishing three beautiful books by three amazing writers.


1. Lou Dellaguzzo's The Hex Artist with photographs by Josh McNey.

Three short stories about desire, obsession, a trucker, two bookshops, and cross-generational attraction.

read an interview with Lou Dellaguzzo about his book, The Hex Artist

In “Pegasus on the Turnpike” Dale, barely out of high school, fights his way off the family farm, steals his dad’s pick-up, and heads for Philly. He meets a trucker, Rick, at his first stop. and the older man invites Dale to share his motel room. What might sound like a porn scenario becomes a tender and meticulous study of freedom and companionship in Lou Dellaguzzo’s skillful hands. More erotic angst is part of the mating ritual in “Secret Shoppers” when Freddie and Jack hook up in a bookstore. In the title story, Aaron is cooking breakfast and plotting his way out of an abusive relationship, even if he has nowehere to go. How will it all end?! In all three stories the dialogue is electric, and the characters – an investigation into what it means to be a young gay man trying to connect with other men in the world.


2. Becky Mayhew's Lost Souls with photographs by Paul G. Vine.

Three short stories about sex, libraries, infidelity and inner-city strife.

read an interview with Becky Mayhew about her book, Lost Souls

“Roses”, “Shelves”, and “Ramona” are three stories about three very different women… a school teacher, a librarian, and a florist. The school teacher in “Ramona” is obsessed with her fearless student while her marriage is on rocky ground. In “Shelves”, the librarian narrator judges men by the books they take out, but will go to bed with them anyway! And the florist, in the more experimental and atmospheric “Roses” grapples with reality and her love for a stranger she’s been watching in a cafe across the road. Becky Mayhew is a new and exciting voice. We are proud to be publishing her first book of short stories.


3. Beldan Sezen's Zakkum, a graphic novella.

A graphic murder mystery about family, loyalty, love, cultural etiquette and taboos.

read an interview with Beldan Sezen about her book, Zakkum

We are delighted to be publishing Beldan’s first full-length comic book. Zakkum (“oleander” in Turkish) is a graphic murder mystery about family, loyalty, love, cultural etiquette and taboos. The narrator, an artist in her early 30s, lives in Amsterdam. A letter arrives one day from her favourite aunt in Istanbul with a cry for help, only to be followed soon after with news of the aunt’s death. Alarmed by this unusual coincidence, she sets off to investigate a possible murder in a city she knows only from childhood holidays and a recent love affair. Family secrets, poisonous plants, and a blinding dislike for her uncle, lead the narrator to jump to the wrong conclusion! Humorous and moving, Zakkum is a unique story and a refreshing glimpse into gay life in Istanbul.


You can read more about the writers and artists.


What We Need & What You'll Get

Our goal of £3,000 ($5,000) will make sure the books have high production values and that the artists and our designer get paid for their work. For £15 ($25) you get to choose one of the books; £25 will get you two; and £35 will get you all three. For £50 we'll send you all three winning books, along with our first two books (The Joshua Tales and Snapshots of The Boy). And for £100, we'll make sure you get signed copies of all 5 Chapbooks, AND your name will be included on the acknowledgements page of all three Chapbooks.


Other Ways You Can Help

Help us to spread the word. Just because they say the publishing industry is in a dismal state, doesn't mean we can't keep creating beautiful books and making sure new and exciting voices get heard. If you want to talk to us or interview us or any of the three winning authors and artists, please get in touch at hi@treehousepress.co.uk or call us on +44(0)20-7193-7642.

We're on Facebook, so check us out there, and on Twitter, and our website. Spread the word.

 be a young gay man trying to connect with other men in the world.

Three short stories about sex, libraries, infidelity and inner-city strife.
read an interview with Becky Mayhew about her book, Lost Souls
“Roses”, “Shelves”, and “Ramona” are three stories about three very 
different women… a school teacher, a librarian, and a florist. The 
school teacher in “Ramona” is obsessed with her fearless student while 
her marriage is on rocky ground. In “Shelves”, the librarian narrator 
judges men by the books they take out, but will go to bed with them 
anyway! And the florist, in the more experimental and atmospheric 
“Roses” grapples with reality and her love for a stranger she’s been 
watching in a cafe across the road. Becky Mayhew is a new and exciting 
voice. We are proud to be publishing her first book of short stories.

3. Beldan Sezen's Zakkum, a graphic novella.
A graphic murder mystery about family, loyalty, love, cultural etiquette and taboos.
read an interview with Beldan Sezen about her book, Zakkum
We are delighted to be publishing Beldan’s first full-length comic book.
 Zakkum (“oleander” in Turkish) is a graphic murder mystery about 
family, loyalty, love, cultural etiquette and taboos. The narrator, an 
artist in her early 30s, lives in Amsterdam. A letter arrives one day 
from her favourite aunt in Istanbul with a cry for help, only to be 
followed soon after with news of the aunt’s death. Alarmed by this 
unusual coincidence, she sets off to investigate a possible murder in a 
city she knows only from childhood holidays and a recent love affair. 
Family secrets, poisonous plants, and a blinding dislike for her uncle, 
lead the narrator to jump to the wrong conclusion! Humorous and moving, 
Zakkum is a unique story and a refreshing glimpse into gay life in 
Istanbul.

You can read more about the writers and artists.


What We Need & What You'll Get
Our goal of £3,000 ($5,000) will make sure the books have high 
production values and that the artists and our designer get paid for 
their work. For £15 ($25) you get to choose one of the books; £25 will get you two; and £35 will get you all three. For £50 we'll send you all three winning books, along with our first two books (The Joshua Tales and Snapshots of The Boy). And for £100, we'll make sure you get signed copies of all 5 Chapbooks, AND your name will be included on the acknowledgements page of all three Chapbooks.


Other Ways You Can Help
Help us to spread the word. Just because they say the publishing industry is in a dismal state, doesn't mean we can't keep creating beautiful books and making sure new and exciting voices get heard. If you want to talk to us or interview us or any of the three winning authors and artists, please get in touch at hi@treehousepress.co.uk or call us on +44(0)20-7193-7642.
We're on Facebook, so check us out there, and on Twitter, and our website. Spread the word.

story:
Sono un fotografo, un fotografo che vola.
Un viaggiatore che fotografa e vola, da solo, con un parapendio a motore.

Il progetto Cieli d'Italia nasce sulla scorta del primo grande viaggio realizzato lungo il corso del Po  

Il fine: raccontare l'Italia, ma da un punto di vista differente. Dal cielo

Il progetto del volo lungo il Po è stato pienamente autoprodotto, leggendo il resoconto del viaggio sul blog è chiaramente visibile come sono stati gli incontri casuali, gratuiti e non combinati, ad arricchire e soprattutto rendere sostenibile il viaggio. Ogni persona incontrata lungo il viaggio ha contribuito a suo modo a farmi raggiungere l'obiettivo. Un panino, qualche litro di benzina, una roulotte dismessa per passare la notte: piccoli gesti che hanno donato ricchezza al viaggio. A sua volta un viaggio nato per raccontare il corso di un fiume è diventato - inaspettatamente - un pretesto per raccontare le sue genti, la ricchezza umana di chi lo vive.

Ecco perchè il crowdfunding: un piccolo contributo prima della partenza, una sicurezza per fare rifornimento ed assicurarsi un pasto. Nulla di più.
Così come lungo il Po ogni persona incontrata è diventata protagonista e compagno di viaggio - seppur per una piccola parte di esso - grazie al crowdfunding mi piace l'idea di trovare tanti compagni di viaggio che contribuiranno a questa esperienza, condividendola con loro. Ognuno avrà un "perk", una "gratificazione". Sia essa una stampa, o quanto è possibile dare in cambio.

Il viaggio sarà raccontato "in diretta" dal 25 agosto: come lungo il Po ogni giorno il blog sarà aggiornato con testi e fotografie del Diario di Bordo di giornata. Questa volta arricchito da video, interviste, ed il making of, accessibili tramite un'are riservata.



E' un periodo in cui vogliamo lasciare l'Italia, abbandonarla, fuggire, andare all'estero. Io non ho mai amato tanto l'Italia e gli italiani come nell'ultimo viaggio. Voglio ripeterlo, e questa volta lungo tutta l'Italia, e coinvolgere per quanto possibile ogni persona a terra che sia disponibile ed interessata a farlo.

 

Cosa è necessario, come puoi contribuire

Il bussiness plan è molto semplice: in questo momento abbiamo un piano di volo di massima, per quanto è possibile prevedere un viaggio sottoposto a numerose variabili: soprattutto quelle metereologiche.
La cifra che intendiamo raggiungere (meno di 2.500 euro)ci servirà per il carburante (benzina e olio per la miscela), e per contribuire alle spese vive di un umile ma funzionante ufficio stampa (non ci piace far lavorare la gente soltanto per la gloria...), il tutto per almeno un mese e mezzo circa.

Chi contribuisce può farlo con un sostegno economico tramite questa iniziativa, in cambio di una stampa autografata, di una copia del libro, o assicurandosi l'elica in legno usata durante il viaggio (è anche un bel soprammobile: io ne ho una in salotto).
Oppure può sostenere l'iniziativa ospitandomi per una notte, o con un panino o un piatto di pasta. Sono ben accetti anche i sostegni puramente morali ed il tifo.

Il progetto partirà se viene raggiunto almeno il 50% della cifra necessaria. La restante parte sarà eventualmente ricercata con altri mezzi (sponsor, autofinanziamento, vendita di stampe e libro ad amici che non usano internet...).
Nel caso in cui la cifra non raggiunga la quota del 50% l'ammontare sarà versato all'Associazione Nazionale Vigili del Fuoco Volontari: sono un pompiere volontario, e i soldi che arrivano dal Ministero non sono mai abbastanza...almeno garantiranno un po' di gasolio per l'autopompa...

Le finalità

Un Road Book (cartaceo ed e-book) che raccoglierà le immagini dell'Italia vista dal cielo e la storia dell'avventura e delle persone che avranno partecipato alla sua realizzazione.
Come già fatto, per il Po, sul blog http://lozenelartedelvoloinparamotore.com/
 
Il libro conterà 96 pagine, stampato su carta 150 gr/mq, la lavorazione garantita da un fornitore abituale e di qualità.
